loans.name: Rufai

texts.en:
Rufai is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Sani, Idris and Tsalhatu. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Rufai would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to provide for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

Rufai is requesting a loan to meet his immediate expenses, such as food and school fees, to eliminate pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest. With his loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rufai can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Rufai spoke of his ambition to use his additional income to educate his children. He eventually hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to meet expenses such as food and child school fees and eliminate pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Nebahat

texts.en:
Nebahat  is married and has three children. She puts lavender in lace candy pouches given out at weddings and baby celebrations. She began this work five months ago. By doing this work at home, she has been able to contribute to her family's income. 

Nebahat has made agreements with shops in her neighborhood and now she also gets orders from shops. At first, she bought whatever supplies she was able to afford. Then she heard about microfinance from a friend and applied for a loan to buy more supplies.  

She will use this loan to buy supplies at better wholesale prices to fill her orders and increase her income. She wants to support her family and buy a house.

loans.use: to buy lavender

loans.name: Awurade Ne Me Hwefo Group

texts.en:
These people are part of a three-member group called Awurade Ne Me Hwefo (God Is Our Provider). They live in the same area and sell secondhand clothing, corn dough, and sandals and shoes. 

Benedicta is a wife and mother who sells sandals and shoes. She is asking for 600 GHS to buy more sandals and shoes to sell to customers. She handles her family's daily expenses and supports her husband in managing their expenses. She has more than three years experience in this business and is applying for her second loan with ID-Ghana. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.

The group has received proper orientation about the loan and saving principals and promises to utilize this loan judiciously. 

In the future, and with the help of the institution, Benedicta would like to expand her business and save money to improve the life of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sandals and shoes to sell to customers.

loans.name: Sara 1 Group

texts.en:
Sara is a 22-year-old married woman. Five years ago, she started selling lingerie to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family. Sara is the featured borrower for the Sara 1 Group. She came together with her other group members to request an Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. The group is working hard to develop their businesses and improve their living situations at the same time.

Sara is requesting a loan from the Kiva field partner AL Majmoua to purchase a new fashionable collection of lingerie to increase her income and improve her family's living condition. The other group members, Monaya, 24 years old, and Darine, 21 years old, are single ladies who are requesting loans to pay their university tuition fees. In this picture, Sara is the first lady on the left, Monaya is the lady sitting in the middle, and Darine is the lady in the right of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase a new fashionable collection of lingerie

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
56 años de edad y un gran sentimiento por su equipo de futbol son dos características de la señora Rosa quien tiene un negocio de venta de mercancía pero solo de su equipo el club Atlético Nacional de Medellín, un negocio que le ha permitido criar a sus 3 hijos y sonreír al compartir su fanatismo con sus clientes.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido en general mercancía y artículos deportivos.  
Este crédito mejorara su mercancía y mas que tiene que estar a la vanguardia pues el equipo cada año saca mercancía nueva.
Espera una ayuda para seguir compartiendo su pasión por el futbol y por el equipo a todos sus clientes,
texts.en:
Rosa is 56 years old and has a lot of enthusiasm for her soccer team. She has a business selling sports merchandise, but only for her team, the Atlético Nacional de Medellín. The business has allowed her to raise three children and smile by sharing her fanaticism with her customers.

She seeks a loan to buy an assortment of general merchandise and sporting clothes. This loan will improve her merchandise, which has to be on the cutting edge as the team has new merchandise every year. She hopes for help to continue sharing her passion for soccer and for the team with her customers.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of athletic clothing to spread joy and love for sports among her customers.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is 38 years old and is married with two children who are in school. For the past four years, she has operated a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has successfully repaid her previous loans.

Shiela is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan from NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Ezekiel's Group

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a 51-year-old proud father of six children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 15 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Ezekiel has noticed that he has learned a lot from farming training.

Ezekiel described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Ezekiel’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 15 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
Edelmira es una mujer solitaria de 55 años de edad que busca a través del Micro-crédito una solución para tener una entrada de dinero suficiente para mantenerse a sí misma pues hace un tiempo su esposo la abandono dejándola sola.
Su idea es montar una empresa de venta de mercancía de catálogo y venta de comida, con la que espera tener éxito y salir adelante, sus sueños son triunfar para poder montar su propio local, generar empleo pero está consciente que iniciara de 0, pero trabajara constantemente para hacer un éxito su idea de negocio. 
Con el crédito comprara los insumos para iniciar formalmente su negocio a la espera que le de una alegría.
texts.en:
Edelmira is a single woman 55 years of age.  She is looking, through means of a micro-loan, for a solution in order to have enough money to support herself, since some time ago her husband left her, leaving her on her own.  Her idea is to set up a business selling both merchandise by catalog and selling food, with the hope of success and getting ahead.

Her dreams are to succeed and be able to set up her own retail space and hire employees.  She is aware that she is starting from nothing, but will work constantly in order to make her business idea a success.  With the loan she will buy the supplies to officially start her business, which she hopes will bring her happiness.

loans.use: to start a business selling food and selling goods by catalog.

loans.name: Naziha

texts.en:
Naziha, a 60-year-old married mother of 8 children, has been selling fruits and vegetables for the past 34 years, helping her husband grow their livelihood.

Naziha is a hardworking woman with a wide range of experience, earning her customers' trust and support. 

Today, Naziha is borrowing her second loan cycle from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development so she can both expand her inventory with special seasonal items and encourage competitive pricing. In addition, she will start a new business selling perfumes and beauty cosmetics.

With her previous loan, Naziha proved to be a borrower in good standing, who was capable of not only developing her business in a well-managed way, but also repaying her loan on schedule.

Naziha hopes to stay in good health and remain capable of developing her businesses and supporting her beloved family.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of special seasonal items in greater volume and encourage competitive pricing.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal and coconuts. Grace is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of bananas to sell for her buy-and-sell banana business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase class materials and to cover some household costs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 64 years old and married with five children.

Maria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Maria has borrowed and paid twelve loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Maria aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a maize farmer from Mafera village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mohammad would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mohammad can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Mohammad, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to access a loan that meets expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Martin Julio

texts.es:
Martin un hombre de 57 años de edad, un hombre soltero, responsable y muy creativo que ante la desesperación del desempleo logro montar un pequeño de venta de jugos con el que ha podido solventar sus necesidades básicas.
Aunque su profesión es muy monótona con su alegría que lo caracteriza hace que cada día pase algo que valga la pena y con la ayuda de motivaciones que ha recibido por parte de sus clientes quiere solicitar un crédito para iniciar junto con su venta de jugos, venta de alimentos para acompañarlos y disfrutar un desayuno nutritivo y sabroso. 
Su idea con el nuevo producto que ofrecerá es poder tener capital para tener una mejor vida y realizar modificaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Martin is a single 57-year-old man. He is responsible and very creative, since after the desperation of unemployment he put together a small juice business with which he has been able to cover his basic necessities. 

Although his profession is monotonous, with the happiness that characterizes him, he makes it so each day something happens that makes it worth it. With the help of the motivation that he has received from his customers, he wants to request a loan to begin, together with his sale of juices, the sale of food to accompany them and to enjoy a nutritious and flavorful breakfast. 

His idea with the new products that he will offer is to be able to have capital to have a better life and carry out modifications to his home.

loans.use: to sell foods that will go with his natural juice drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build the back wall of her home which will prevent water from entering her house and causing damage

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of two children, Silvia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs. Silvia is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of rice grains to sell for her rice grains business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Silvia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Jeannilyn

texts.en:
Jeannilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothes to sell for her business.

Jeannilyn has been in this business for ten years and earns additional income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Jeannilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 45 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 21,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Teresita has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from a printing shop.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Teresita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Shushan

texts.en:
Shushan is from Akhlatyan village, where she lives with her husband, father-in-law and two little daughters (in the photo). Shushan's husband works at a local village municipality, but the salary he gets is so low that is hardly enough to cover the family's basic needs.

Shushan runs their family farm in order to sustain it and earn income for their living expenses. She keeps three cows and ten calves, and cultivates wheat, emmer wheat, potatoes, nuts, apples and pears. Shushan and her husband sell the gathered harvest in nearby villages and communities. 

To enlarge her farming business, Shushan asks lenders to support her in purchasing 100 packages of forage for feeding the cattle, and seeds and fuel for land cultivation. Shushan is sure that the loan will bring her more income and will make her farm more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to pay for 100 packages of forage for feeding the cattle, seeds and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Meshack's Group

texts.en:
Meshack's Group was formed by ten farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Meshack, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 45 years old, married, and has three children. Meshack has been a farmer for fifteen years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Meshack isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. 

This year, Meshack will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition, since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Meshack's Group will purchase a total of seven solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Mane's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 7 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 29 novembre 2009. Il est composé de membres qui vivent dans le même quartier et les environs. Les membres vivent dans la bonne entente et sont solidaires. Leur principale est le commerce.
Mane, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 56 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants:  06 garçons dont un décédé. Elle fait comme activité principale le commerce de tissus imprimés communément appelé Thioub. Elle achète des tissus dans le pays voisin pour les revendre dans sa ville. Elle fait cette activité depuis longtemps. Cette fois-ci, elle compte tout investir dans le commerce de tissus.
Elle va acheter 20 pièces de tissus Thioub à 9000 F la pièce qu'elle va revendre à 12000 F si c'est comptant et 14000 F si c'est mensuellement. Elle achète aussi 20 autres tissus de Gagnilah à 10000 F la pièce qu'elle va revendre à 15000 F si c'est comptant et 17000 F si c'est mensuellement. Les 20000 F qui reste vont lui servir de frais de transport.
Avec les bénéfices, elle compte payer les frais scolaires des enfants, assurer leurs soins médicaux, leurs habillements et le quotidien de la famille vu que son mari est à la retraite.
texts.en:
This seven-member group is associated with the banc villageois which was created on 29th November 2009. The members of this group live in the same district and its surrounding areas. Its members live in harmony and solidarity. The group's main source of income is trading.

Mane, the woman standing to the right of the photo with her hand raised, is 56 years old. She is a married mother to 10 children: six sons, one of whom is deceased, and four daughters. Her main business activity involves selling printed fabrics commonly known as "Thioub". She buys these fabrics from a neighbouring country then resells them in her town. She has carried out this activity for a long time. With this loan, she is planning on fully investing into her fabric business.

She plans on purchasing 20 sheets of "Thioub" fabric at 9000 F apiece, which she will resell for 12,000 F cash or 14.000 F in monthly instalments. She will also purchase 20 sheets of "Gagnilah" fabric at 10,000 F apiece, which she will for 15,000 F cash or 17,000 F in monthly instalments. The remaining 20,000 F will be used to pay for her transport.

With the profits from this loan, she is planning on paying for her children's school fees, medical care and clothing, as well as seeing to her family's daily expenses given that her husband is now retired.

loans.use: to purchase printed fabrics

loans.name: Ndiolle's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 07 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 27 octobre 2007. Les femmes ont une bonne cohésion sociale. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche.
Dieynaba, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 03 garçons. Elle fait comme activité de l'embouche ovine. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 2007. Elle va acheter 08 moutons à 280000 F dont 35000 F l'un. Elle achète des aliments pour bétail à 2000 F. Ce qui lui reste d'argent va lui servir de fonds de roulement. Elle va engraisser les moutons et au bout de quelques mois, les revendre au prix de 75000 F l'un au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires.
Les bénéfices vont lui permettre d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire en embouche, subvenir à ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This seven-member group is part of the banc villageois that was created on October 27, 2007. The women get along well with one another. Their main activities are business and livestock fattening. 

Dieynaba, standing at right with her hand raised, is 43 years old. She is married and the mother of seven children (including three boys). 

She has been fattening sheep since 2007. She will buy eight sheep for 280,000 FCFA (35,000 FCFA each). She buys feed for 2,000 FCFA. She will use the remaining funds as working capital. She will fatten the sheep for a few months and then resell them for 75,000 FCFA in the weekly markets. 

Her earnings will allow her to increase her sales and to meet her needs and those of her children.

loans.use: with livestock fattening.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy fishing netting and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Mercy has been in this business for 21 years. She earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing netting and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 27,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her rice business.

Marilou has been in this business for 10 years. Marilou earns additional income from farming rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Remelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell recycled materials business in the Philippines. Remelyn is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to  purchase more stocks of recycled materials to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Remelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials.

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer muy emprendedora y tenaz, con grandes deseos que ha estado cultivando y tratando de cumplir.

Tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de alimentos, como empanadas y pasteles que ella misma prepara y vende en un carrito de comidas.

Con esta actividad intenta día a día  salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia compuesta por sus tres hijos quienes son el motor de su vida y su motivación para luchar diariamente.

Su mayor dificultad es la competencia del sector, pero con su gran capacidad de trabajo es capaz de sostenerse y progresar.

Gloria solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de ingredientes para sus preparaciones y para realizar reparaciones a su carro de comidas.

Con esta ayuda podrá cumplir su sueño de otorgar una buena educación a sus hijos

Con tu ayuda Gloria Podrá pagar la educación de sus hijos que es uno de sus más grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Gloria is a very enterprising and tenacious woman, who fosters big dreams that she is trying to fulfill.

She has a small food sales business, where she sells empanadas and pastries that she prepares herself and sells from a food stall.

Through this business, she works daily to succeed and improve her family's living conditions. She has three children who are the driving force of her life and her motivation to keep fighting every day.

Her greatest difficulty is the sector's competition, but with her great capacity to work hard, she is capable of maintaining and growing her business.

Gloria is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for her products and to repair her food stall.

With this support, she will be able to fulfill her dream of offering her children a good education. With your help, Gloria will be able to pay for her children's education, with is one of her greatest dreams!

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her products and to maintain her food stall

loans.name: Elam's Group

texts.en:
Elam is a 74-year-old proud father of eight children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Elam has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Elam described his harvest as good last year, but he believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore, save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Elam’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Alh. Sale

texts.en:
Alh. Sale is a maize farmer from Kadanya Biyar village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alh. Sale would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Sale can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Alh. Sale, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: meet expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Julius Ummaru

texts.en:
Julius Ummaru is a maize farmer from Mayau Rumi village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Julius Ummaru would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Julius Ummaru can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Julius Ummaru, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to meet expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Gabriel joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Laazarus, Luka, and Joshua.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Gabriel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Gabriel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Gabriel spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to meet expenses such as food and his children's school fees, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sehira

texts.en: Sehira is 51 years old, married, and has two children. She is a housewife and farmer. To support the family, she and her husband have been growing fruit and vegetables for 25 years. Raising of seasonal fruits is very common in Azerbaijan because people have a high demand for fresh fruits. They use fruits to make juice, jam, fruit pies and fruit cocktails. People visit her grocery because the fruits there are always fresh and tasty. Her income from this business is 200 AZN.Gardening is the only source of income but Sehira has a problem with water. She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to repair her water pipes to be able to water her garden properly.

loans.use: to repair water pipes to be able to water her garden properly.

loans.name: Maryfel

texts.en:
Maryfel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, chips, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

Maryfel has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Maryfel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, chips, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Seonilyn

texts.en:
Seonilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Seonilyn has been in this business for one year. Seonilyn earns more income from pig fattening and buying and selling dried fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Seonilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Tarife

texts.en:
Tarife is married and the mother of three children. She makes her own phyllo dough and doesn’t have to buy bread. Over time, her neighbors started asking her to make them bread as well. She had never considered selling her products, but she realized she could contribute to her household and provide for her children and thought, “Why not?” As people began to hear about her, her orders increased. For seven years, she has made and sold phyllo dough and dried phyllo, which is used by wetting and placing the desired ingredients inside. As the winter months are beginning, she has recieved a lot of winter orders and will buy phyllo ingredients wholesale. She wants to work as long as she is healthy and to make a pilgrimage. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Tarife hanım evli üç çocuk annesi.  Evde kendi ne saçdan yufka  yapyor  ve ekmeğini dışarıdan almıyor.  Zaman içinde çevresindeki komşuları bize de yaparmısın diyerek teklif yapmış.  Yapıp satmayı hiç düşünmezken aklında yokken çocuklarına eve katkısı olacağını düşünüp neden olmasın diyerek işe başlamış.  Zamanla kişiler tarafından duyularak siparişleri artmış.  Yedi yıldır sipariş üzerine dışarıya yufka ve biti denilen (kurutulmuş yufka,kullanmak istediğinde ıslatılarak açılıp içine istenilen malzeme konularak pişiriliyor)yufkanın satışını yapıyor.Kış aylarına girdiğimizden kışlık siparişleri çok olduğundan toplu yufka malzemesi alacak.Sağlığı el verdikçe işini yapmak ve Umreye gitmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy phyllo ingredients

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Catherine is 39 years old and is often described as a very friendly person. She has four children and is married. As a group leader, Catherine is representing her group of nine farmers in Kakamega North District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Catherine's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Catherine and her group will receive a total of six solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of four acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es:
Zaida, a sus 64 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y pujante; pues siempre va en busca de alternativas que le permitan progresar. 

Desde hace muchos años se dedica a trabajar en el campo de la confección, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y poco a poco fue perfeccionando su técnica y ampliando sus conocimientos por medio de la práctica, esto la impulsó para iniciar su propio taller, para lo cual adecuó un espacio en la casa donde reside y, con unos ahorros que tenía compró sus primeras máquinas, trabaja sola todos los días, pero en ocasiones recibe el apoyo de una persona, dependiendo de la cantidad de contratos que tenga; así ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos del hogar. 

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para el fortalecimiento de su labor, pues con el dinero comprará insumos como tela e hilos, con la que podrá agilizar el proceso de producción y adquirir más contratos, generando mayor rentabilidad en el negocio. 

Zaida manifiesta que su mayor desafío es la competencia en el mercado, sin embargo esto la sigue motivando para seguir prestando un mejor servicio y luchar para que el sueño de la acreditación de su negocio se haga realidad y le permita generar oportunidades de empleo, así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de las personas que influyan en la labor.
texts.en:
Zaida, at 64 years of age, is a hardworking and thriving woman. She always goes in search of opportunities that will allow her to improve.

For many years she has worked in the field of dressmaking. She learned the trade in an empirical way and little by little she perfected her technique and expanded her knowledge through practice. This motivated her to start her own shop, for which she adapted a space in the house where she lives, and with some savings that she had she bought her first machines. She works alone every day, but occasionally she receives the support of one person, depending on the quantity of contracts that she has. In this way she has been able to generate sufficient resources to cover the expenses of her home.

The loan she requests is to support the strengthening of her work, since with the money she will purchase supplies like fabric and thread, with which she will be able to accelerate the production process and acquire more contracts, generating better profitability in the business. 

Zaida expresses that her greatest challenge is the competition of the market, however this continues to motivate her to continue providing a better service and to fight so that the dream of accrediting her business becomes a reality and allows her to create employment opportunities. In this way she will improve her quality of life and that of the people who contribute to the work.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fabric and thread.

loans.name: Telman

texts.en:
Telman is 43 years old and lives in the village of Pambak in the Lori region. He lives with his retired mother, wife and three children (two sons and a daughter, all of them school-aged). 

Telman is the only breadwinner in his family. Simultaneously working at his village electrical station, he also runs a farming business in which his mother and wife try to help him. On his farm, he now has four cows and two calves. He sells the meat and milk right from his house. Telman greatly wants to start swine breeding, which will be very profitable for his family; it will allow him to sell more meat from his farm with more profit as well.

Telman is asking for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a pig and also a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle, since the need for fodder is great with the coming of the cold season.

loans.use: to buy a pig and also a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Fredesvinda

texts.es:
Fredesvinda tiene 60 años, es viuda, conocida en el medio por prestar el servicio en costura y confección. Vive en casa propia con nieta y 02 bisnietos, quienes estudian en colegio de la zona, nieta trabaja independientemente. Fredesvinda percibe prestación de ONP por jubilación y ella cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su familia es unida unida. Vive en una comunidad habitada por gente amigable y amable, que se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería; y está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Fredesvinda se dedica a la confección y costura de ropa para damas, niños, etc., desde hace más de 20 años, de manera continua. Ella necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de tela para su negocio, ya que cuenta con varios pedidos pendientes de clientes, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Fredesvinda is a 60-year-old widow. She is well-known locally for her dressmaking services. She lives in a house of her own with her granddaughter and two great-grandchildren, who go to the local school. Her granddaughter is an independent worker.

Fredesvinda receives a pension and has good personal and professional references. Her family is very close-knit. Local people are friendly and kind, and work in agriculture, commerce and raising cattle. Her community is located in the Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, region of Lambayeque in the northern coast of Peru.

Fredesvinda has been making clothes for women, children, etc. for more than twenty years, uninterruptedly. She is requesting a loan to buy fabrics for her business, now that she has many pending orders. This will help her to increase her income in the short term, make more profits and improve her and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase home appliances for his house, such as a refrigerator, washing machine, TV, stove and other home appliances.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 34-year-old married woman blessed with 2 children

Jane has sold paraffin for 4 years to earn a monthly income of 5,000 KES

Jane has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya for 10,000 KES which she will use to buy  paraffin to sell.

With the anticipated profits, Jane will be able to educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future is to diversify into farming.

loans.use: to buy paraffin.

loans.name: Limpason

texts.en:
Limpason is 34 years old, married to Florence and blessed with three school going children. He is in the transport business and at the same time he does dairy farming. He has been in this business for the past four years, earning a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

He has applied for his first loan of 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy a spare wheel for his motorbike and also buy animal feed for his dairy cattle.

He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children. In the future he hopes to grow his business and educate his children to higher levels.

loans.use: to buy a spare wheel and buy dairy cattle feed.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 50-year-old married, hard working entrepreneur with five children. 

Rosalina has had a vegetable vending business for 15 years and requests 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Surriya

texts.en:
Surriya is a 32-year-old mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. His rickshaw has not been working properly for many days. Because of this, he is unable to generate any income and wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. 

Therefore, Surriya has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Surriya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
Martha, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years. She is now proud to represent her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. She is 45 years old, is married and has 5 children.

Martha likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has learned a lot from farming trainings. Martha plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Martha’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, the group will receive a total of 4 solar lights with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Saba

texts.en:
Saba is a 29 year old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last five years. 

For a while now, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular usage. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So he is unable to generate any income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. 

Therefore Saba has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Saba is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is 27 years old, married, and she has two kids. Her husband is a worker, but his salary is not enough to cover the family's needs. For this reason, Gulshan is growing vegetables in her own land. Gulshan herself has been familiar with agricultural techniques since childhood, so it wasn't hard for her to begin farming at her husband's house. She has been growing plants for seven years already. 

Currently, she and her husband's family are planting for winter. To finish the winter planting, they need a few more seeds and fertilizer. She is requesting a loan to obtain the needed seeds and fertilizer. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to obtain the needed seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Griselvina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Una gran idea y un negocio poco visto en su sector residencial ubicado en Sincelejo el cual es venta de mercancía como acolchados, ropa, decoraciones navideñas entre otros fue el que inicio la señora Griselvina hace aproximadamente 2 años, decimos poco visto porque es un municipio que se caracteriza por otro tipo de servicios y ha tenido muy buena acogida pero no ha podido expenderse pro los limitantes económicas que no le permiten comprar mercancía, y más sabiendo que sus productos da facilidad de pagos de hasta 30 días de plazo, en realidad son muchos limitantes que hace que Griselvina no pueda progresar.
Buscando mejores ventas y aumentar su capital, Griselvina le gustaría pedir un crédito para comprar inventario en acolchados, decoraciones navideñas y variedad de ropa siempre apuntando a mejorar su empresa y poder algun día abrir su local comercial.
texts.en:
A fine idea and a business seldom seen in her residential area in Sincelejo is the sale of merchandise such as bedspreads, clothing, Christmas decorations and other items that Griselva began approximately 2 years ago. We say seldom seen because it is a municipality known for other types of services. It has been very well received, but she has not been able to expand because of the financial limitations which don't allow her to buy merchandise. 

In addition, keeping in mind that she allows up to 30 days for payment, Griselvina has many challenges that prevent her from being able to forward. Seeking better sales and to increase her working capital, Griselva would like to request a loan to buy inventory in bedspreads, Christmas decorations and a variety of clothing, always aiming at improving her business and someday being able to open her own store.

loans.use: To purchase bedspreads and Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Malemnganbi Jlg Group

texts.en:
Thaja is a talented weaver who spends most of her time weaving. She is a mother of one child and engages herself in weaving beautiful traditional shawls worn by womenfolk. She is the featured borrower of the group and is pictured with her hand raised. 

Thaja joined the group in the year 2011 and started earning money by engaging herself in weaving, which became the main source of income for their family. The name of the shawl she weaves is “Rani Phi” (local name), which requires a lot of effort to create just one shawl. “It takes ten days to complete one shawl, and one should be creative and have the skill to make this shawl,” she said. She has to design the cloth full of colourful flowers so that it will be attractive to the customers. 

She makes around 2,000 INR by selling one shawl. The profit she gets is spent on household requirements and school fees for her child. Now she aspires to weave more shawls of different designs to sell more products. She will buy silk yarn of different textures to weave pretty shawls that will attract customers. She will renovate her house and will save up money to pay for the school admission fees and new textbooks of her child for the new session. She sends good wishes to all the lenders. 

The entire group members are excited to get the loan. They are engaged in weaving, farming, and poultry for sustenance. They are looking forward to leading an independent life through a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy colourful textures of yarn and thread for weaving.

loans.name: Hernan  Benigno

texts.es:
Hernan Benigno tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, vive en el sector Guayaquil, el cual es una zona rural. Vive con en casa familiar, en esta zona la vida es muy pasiva y tranquila; su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Hernan Benigno se dedica a las actividad de cria y venta de animales menores con un año de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, él solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y alimento de engorde balanceado para estos, dicha inversión le servirá para poder atender con mayor número de ventas, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hernan Benigno is 22 years old and single. He lives in Guayaquil, a rural community, in a house with his family. Life is calm and easy there and locals work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising cattle. It is located in the Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, in the northern coast of Peru.

Hernan Benigno works raising and selling farm animals. He has been doing this for a year in the back of his house. He is requesting a loan to buy animals and feed for them. This will help him to increase his sales, which will result in a higher income in the short term and better profits, and thus better living conditions for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 30-year-old married man, who opened a shop to sell clothing 2 years ago.  He wanted to improve his career and develop his family's standard of living.


Ali used to work as a baker with his father, but he discovered that being a baker didn't match his dreams. He decided to let go and start his own career path, which led him to establish his own clothes selling business.

His business is doing well, but since he is the sole earner of his family, he has a lot of responsibilities. These prevent him from  expanding and developing his business.

He requests a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase his  merchandise with newly released Autumn & Winter collections.

Ali enjoys his business and works hard to develop it in the future through opening a larger shop and diversifying his products to include men and children's items.

loans.use: to increase his  merchandise with newly released Autumn & Winter clothing collections.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 66-year-old married man blessed with six grown children.  He has run a retail shop for 30 years  to sell a variety of goods.  He  earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.
	 		
He has applied for his fourth loan of 100,000 KES from ‘VisionFund Kenya after successfully repaying his previous loan.  He  intends to use the loan  to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, and soft drinks to meet the demands of the high season.                                                                                           

Michael will use the anticipated profits to fence his premises.  He hopes to grow his business and construct residential rooms.

loans.use: to buy flour, wheat flour, sugar and soft drinks.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida, 31 years old, is a very enthusiastic person. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been successfully running a general store. He offers a variety of daily-use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, he needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. 

For this reason, Shahida has requested a loan from Murabaha of 30,000 PKR for her husband, who will buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. In this way, he will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at his store and improve his earnings.

loans.use: enable her husband to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Zaragul

texts.en:
Zaragul was born in 1966 and lives in her own house with her family. She has a home-based business to make clothes. She has made a variety of different items for 20 years and is very experienced. 

Zaragul is a repeat client of IMON and has a good credit history. Zaragul must buy coal and wood to heat her house in the winter  and needs a loan of 3,500 TJS to buy coal and wood. 

She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase coal and wood to heat her house in the winter season.

loans.name: Imer

texts.es:
Imer tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el caserío Cabramayo una zona rural del distrito de Colasay, una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Imer se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, cria de cerdos; desde hace 5 años, en el caserio Cabramayo. El destino del crédito es para incrementar su negocio, pues desea abastecer con una mayor proporción a sus clientes, desea realizar la compra de abarrotes para surtir los productos de su tienda y desea realizar también la compra de comida de engorde balanceada para sus cerdos. Es una de las pocas bodegas que existe en la zona por lo que negocio es rentable. Con el préstamo Imer podrá satisfacer todos los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Imer is 36 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the rural community of Cabramayo, a rural area of the Colasay district, a community that is characterized by its green landscapes. Its population makes its living in agriculture, commerce, and ranching. It is situated in the Jaén Province, which belongs to the Lambayeque Region, on the northern coast of Peru.

For 5 years, Imer has made his living selling groceries and raising pigs in the Cabramayo rural community.

The purpose of the loan is to increase his business, as he would like to provide his customers with more goods. He would like to buy groceries in order to stock his store, and also buy animal feed for his pigs.

His is one of the few stores that exist in the era, which is why his business is profitable. With the loan, Imer will be able to satisfy all his customers' tastes and preferences, which will allow him, in a short time, to improve his income, increase his earnings, and as a result, improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to increase his product inventory in order to stock his store.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita tiene 48 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, vive en casa propia, ella es natural de la zona. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería como sustento principal, siembra y cosecha de banano, maíz, fréjol caupí. Etc. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Anita es la crianza de animales (chanchos, ovejos, pavos, pollos) y venta del mismo, además de la venta de cerveza, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 4 años, con experiencia en el negocio,con muy buenas referencias personales , laborales y económicas en la zona. Anita cuenta con capacidad de pago. El destino del crédito será para capital de trabajo pues desea ampliar y diversificar su stock de animales para poder satisfacer todos los gustos y preferencias y de su público consumidor, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Anita is 48 years old, married, and lives in a house she owns.  She is originally from this area.  Life in her area is tranquil, and the people work in farming and raising livestock as their main source of income.  They plant and harvest bananas, corn, and black eyed peas.  Her community is located in the district and province of Morropón in the Piura region on the northern coast of Perú.

Anita works raising animals (pigs, sheep, turkeys, chicken) and selling them.  She has also sold beer for more than four years.  With experience in her business and good local personal, work, and financial references, Anita has the ability to repay her loan. 

She will use this loan to provide working capital to expand and diversify her stock of animals so that she can satisfy all of the tastes and preferences of her consumers.  This will allow her to improve her income quickly, expand her profits, and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to have working capital to expand and diversify her stock of animals.

loans.name: Termine

texts.en:
Termine lives in Balaq village, in the Syuniq region, with her husband and two sons aged 8 and 9 years old. They have migrated here from the Nagorno-Karabakh region because of ongoing conflict concerning the territory. They established their farm after moving to the Syuniq region.

Because of their hard work, Termine and her husband own a farm which includes cows, calves, oxen and piglets. They also cultivate emmer wheat, nuts, apples and pears. 


Now, to be able to be prepared for the coming cold season, Termine asks for this loan. She hopes to purchase forage for feeding the livestock (800 kg of condensed forage and 1200 packages of grass). She hopes for lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock (800 kg of condensed forage and 1200 packages of grass)

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
The acquisition and installation of water tanks is certainly a dream come true for most of the rural smallholder farmers in Kenya. Janice, a Juhudi Kilimo farmer, is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to get one and also to buy irrigation pipes. 

Janice lives in Chuka, a rural town in Kenya. She is a mother of three who has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years. She enjoys milking and mixing manure. However, the climate in the region has changed rapidly, leading to long dry spells. Janice acknowledges that acquiring a water tank will be advantageous to her and the environment. “All I need is a water tank that matches my farm’s requirements, and I will start reaping the benefits almost immediately.” The water will serve both domestic and farming purposes. Janice’s family suffers through making several trips a day to carry water over long distances during dry seasons. To Janice, storing water in tanks not only reduces their work for fetching, but also puts an end to the wastage that takes place when rain water simply drains away. The water pipes will be used in irrigating the farm, hence increasing the production level, which will translate to improved income. All that Janice waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and irrigation pipes

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, 39 years old, is married and has four children. She has been involved in the business of making footballs for the last 2 years. She stitches balls in different sizes and colors. She earns enough money to bear the expenses of her family members. Nasreen is liable to provide good quality food and clothing to her family.

To improve her business, Nasreen contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of 45,000 PKR. She will use this amount to buy needles, leather and other raw material necessary to make footballs. She is hopeful that this will expand her business, which will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy needles, leather and other raw material necessary to make footballs (soccer balls)

loans.name: Leidy Johana

texts.es:
Leidy es una mujer con toda la energía y disposición para enfrentar el mundo y superarse.

Desea iniciar un negocio de Papelería y café internet, con este negocio podría obtener ingresos para poder mantener y sostener a sus dos hijos.

Es una joven muy aplicada pues estudia y tiene deseos de salir adelante y ser profesional.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de una vitrina y u computador.

Con este préstamo puede cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y darle a su madre todo lo que necesite, además de poder pagar sus estudios y progresar.

Apoya el proyecto de una joven emprendedora Colombiana!
texts.en:
Leidy is a woman who has the energy and willingness to take on the world and overcome. She wants to start an internet cafe business that also sells stationery. With this business, she could obtain the income she needs to be able to maintain and support her two children. 

She is a very applied young lady. She studies and has the desire to get ahead and be professional. She is requesting a loan to buy a showcase and a computer.

With this loan, she can fulfill her dream of being independent and giving her mother everything she needs, as well as being able to pay for her studies and progress.

Support the plans of a young, entrepreneurial, Colombian woman!

loans.use: to buy a showcase and a computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's shutter business.

loans.name: Irum

texts.en:
Irum is a 29-year old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Irum’s husband. He runs a horse cart as a transportation service. Eight years ago he started this business to carry material from one place to another. He makes enough to meet the family's needs.

In order to purchase a larger wooden cart for the horse, Irum has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR from Murabaha. Her husband will be able to take more things on his cart at once, which will ultimately save his time and hopefully increase his net income. Irum plans to spend the additional revenue on bettering the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a larger wooden cart for the horse, in order to take more things on the cart at once.

loans.name: Bayarmagnai

texts.en:
Mrs. Bayarmagnai, 44 years old, lives in her sister's home in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son has been called into military service recently. She works as a saleswoman at a supermarket. 

The house she and her sister's family live in has deteriorated over the years, so she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, planks and fiberglass for house renovation. 

After renovation, she and her sister's family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating, thus releasing fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate her sister's house

loans.name: Enkhmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Enkhmaa, 46 years old, lives with her mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a child carer since 2010. Her mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. As winter is coming, she is in urgent need of renovating her house. So she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam for her house renovation. After renovation, she and her mother will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air. In the profile picture, the borrower is with a child whom she is responsible for caring.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Nisrine Group

texts.en:
Nisrine group consists of three ambitious women, who put so much effort into developing their family's living and businesses. They have been neighbors and friends for a long time. They decided to hold hands and acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Aida is the featured borrower; she is a 49-year-old married mother of three. She has been working at making and selling hand made souvenirs and embroidery for ten years to support her beloved husband who works as a blacksmith to cover their family's living needs.

Today, Aida's loan will be invested in covering her beloved children's increasing university tuition fees.

Aida is the first lady at the far left side of the picture. As for the other group members, Jouhaina is the lady at the center, while Nouhad is the first from the right.

loans.use: to pay for her children's increasing university fees.

loans.name: Kholzhamol

texts.en:
Kholzhamol is a married mother of precious adult children. Her greatest dream is to be able to see her children become fine professionals. That is why she always strives to provide them with better education. 

Through her own initiative, she opened a store, beginning with home products. Her store has now grown. Now she sells food items. She lives in North Tajikistan with her family, and is a very enterprising and innovative person. She is always trying to improve her business. She works every day at her store and believes that it is going well because of her dedication and the excellent service she provides to her customers.

Kholzhamol intends to use the loan to buy merchandise to stock in her store. She will buy groceries, detergents, soft drinks, mineral water, and other items. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for their generosity. Thanks to them, she will help her family get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy food items to stock in her store

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 55-year-old married father of one child and a person with no registered nationality. 

He has worked for 23 years in selling scraps to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Khodor is trying desperately to provide his family with better living conditions, thus he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate his house and make it a healthier and better place for his beloved child.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Angelo

texts.en:
Angelo is very dedicated to his studies and wants to become successful in the future. He is studying Maritime in a university. His parents are earning income from their business. He has two siblings living with his family. 

He borrowed this loan from GDMPC for the purpose of paying the school tuition fee for the first semester. In the future, he wants to find a job that enables him to support himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
Reina tiene 61 años de edad, es conviviente, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Reina se dedica a la venta de comida, desde hace 05 años, negocio se encuentra ubicado en el mercado de abasto de Oyotún, solicita préstamo para activo fijo; construcción de su cocina, pues con esto ella podrá elaborar sus productos en mejores condiciones y mejor calidad, Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Reina, 61, has a partner and no children under her care. She lives in her own house, in a rural area of the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. Her community works primarily in agriculture, livestock and trade.

Reina makes a living selling food. For the last five years, her business has been located in the meat market of Oyotún. She is requesting a fixed asset loan for the construction of her kitchen. With this, she will be able to make her products with better quality and in better conditions. 

This will allow her to improve her income, increase her earnings and therefore improve her quality of life and that of her family in the short term.

loans.use: to build a kitchen

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a married woman with nine children.  She works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and  earns additional income  raising pigs.  Violeta requests 28,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy vegetables to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and  requests another loan to further build her businesses.

Violeta has  sustained her business through 22 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money  to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Yeranuhi

texts.en:
Yeranuhi lives with her only daughter. She has been involved in agriculture for more than 15 years. Yeranuhi is skilled in breeding cows, calves, sheep, pigs, hens and turkeys. Yeranuhi also cultivates barley, emmer wheat and potato. To sustain her daughter's living, Yeranuhi is also employed on a dairy farm. 

To be able to solve some urgent problems on her farm, Yeranuhi has applied for this loan. She asks lenders to support her in purchasing forage for feeding the livestock (500 kg of barley and 1000 packages of grass).

 
Yeranuhi will be very thankful to lenders if they support her loan to be fully funded.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock (500 kg of barley and 1,000 packages of grass )

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cement to renovate their house.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de buenas ideas y de mente creativa, siempre está tratando de buscar actividades para aumentar sus ingresos familiares.

Ella monto un café internet desde hace varios años y vende alternativamente algunos elementos de papelería en el mismo negocio.

Ella tiene 38 años y tiene todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar los desafíos que la vida le tenga preparados.

Ella solicita un apoyo económico para comprar una fotocopiadora. 

Con este dinero podrá invertir en su negocio y atraerá más clientes impactando de esta manera sus utilidades de una manera positiva.

Su mayor sueño es tener una gran sala de internet con buenos ingresos y generar empleo.
texts.en:
Ana is a woman with good ideas and a creative mind.  She is always trying to find work to increase her family's income.  She opened an internet cafe a few years ago and also sells some stationery items there.  Ana is 38 years old and is ready to face all of the challenges that life has for her.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase a copy machine.  With this money, she can invest in her business and attract more customers, which will have a positive impact on her income.

Her dream is to have a large internet cafe that employs others and generates good profits.

loans.use: to purchase a copy machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for her house

loans.name: Samson's Group

texts.en:
Samson has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is proud to represent his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. He is a 47-year-old married man with children.

Samson likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has worked with One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has learned a lot from the training. Samson plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

Samson’s Group will receive supplies to cultivate 5.25 acres of land. Some members of the group will also purchase a solar light, with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Emine

texts.en:
Emine is married and a university graduate. While trying to find something else to do, she decided to make jewelry as this interested her. Without having any background, Emine started making jewelry with beads and fishing line, looking at things on the Internet. After getting good at it, Emine showed her work to people in her circle and, after getting their affirmation, she started selling it. Since she has insufficient materials (where she lives), Emine is going to buy jewelry materials and take orders for work. This will help her increase her selection. She wants to be able to help her husband financially; it makes her happy to be a successful person who earns her own money.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Emine hanım evli.  Üniversite mezunu.  Evlendikten sonra ,takılara olan merakından takı yapmaya karar veriyor.  Hiç bilmediği takı yapımına bir misine ve boncukla başlıyor. İnternetten takı yapımına bakarak bir şeyler yapmaya başlıyor.  Zamanla bu işte ustalaşınca çevresine göstererek onay alıyor ve satmaya başlıyor.  Malzeme eksiği çok olduğundan takı malzemeleri alıp siparişlerini yapacak.  Çeşidini arttıracak.  Maddi olarak eşine destek olmak ve kendi parasını kazanan başarılı birisi olmak hoşuna gidiyor.

loans.use: to buy jewelry materials

loans.name: Bandar

texts.en:
Bandar is a 37-year-old married man and a father of four children, living with them in Taiz City, Yemen. The house where Bandar lives with his family lacks many home appliances and furniture. The family feels very inconvenienced by this condition. It can't afford the items. All the members of the family feel ashamed when any visitor comes to their house. Bandar strives strongly to provide his family with the necessary needs but his income is not enough to do that. Bandar turned to Al-Amal Microfinance Bank and took a loan of 350,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase the necessary home appliances and furniture for his house.

Bandar looks forward to starting his own business to be able to provide his children with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary home appliances and furniture for his house.

loans.name: Nl 16 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ang, 52, is a widow who lives with her son and his wife and their child, her infant grandchild. They live in an old, small, Thai traditional house and work at cultivation and animal husbandry for a living. They grow rice and vegetables, and they breed buffaloes for ploughing, chickens, ducks and fish.

To have a more sustainable income, Mrs. Ang has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to expand their agricultural production. This is the fourth time she has received a loan from the Program, and she will use it to buy piglets and food for the pigs.

With her extensive experience in agricultural activities, together with the counselling and the training she has received from the Program, she believes her investment will go well and bring her a high income. 

Mrs. Ang dreams that her children and her grandchild will overcome the difficulties ahead and have a stable and abundant life. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets and food for the pigs

loans.name: Anees

texts.en:
Anees is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her five children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family and has run his own sound system shop for many years. 

Anees's husband wants to purchase different types of sound system accessories for his business, but due to insufficient finances, he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore Anees has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to purchase relevant items for his business  so that he can earn more income to manage his business and house hold.

Anees is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sound system accessories to sell.

loans.name: Maryati

texts.en:
This is the story of Khasanudin, son of Maryati:

"My father supports the family by selling chicken porridge in Jakarta. I was the second of four siblings, and my mother did not work, but taking care of her children.

My father's income is uncertain, because the power factor and the factor of safety on the highway that much at all after the vehicle. I do not want anything bad to happen to my dad, because a month ago when my father crossed the street to push the cart, he was nearly ruined by a speeding motorcycle, but God protected him and he was fine and then stuff around Jakarta .

I would love to help but I can only pray for him. My father was instrumental to my family, he was tireless and tired of working hard over backwards. Morning till night, I wish that my father could be given health and longevity.
With a loan from Kiva, can finance my school for 3 years at a vocational high school, hopefully I can finish my study until completion, without having to burden my parents. With this loan, may be able to ease the burden on my parents. I am very upset with the condition of my parents, hopefully after I graduate I can help parents and my brothers. Thanks for the borrower, who has provided a loan for my studies". In the photograph, Maryati and Khasanudin her son.

loans.use: to pay for educational fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy reels of thread and packs of beads, sequins and stones

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima, age 24, is a married woman. A year ago, her husband (also shown in the photo) started a business to sell fruits in his locality. He makes a good amount of income to run his household activities. Saima wants to provide continuous support for the growth of his business. 

Currently, she has availed Murabaha of 20,000 PKR for her husband. It allowed him to purchase more sacks of fresh fruits, including oranges, apples, guavas and bananas, to consistently meet market demands. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of fresh vegetables, including onions, potatoes, tomatoes and ginger, to consistently meet market demands.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 36 years old, is married to Virginia, and they have been blessed with two children, ages 11 and nine years. Virginia earns additional income for the family.

Joseph owns some plots of land as well as a posho mill, a business he has run for the last six years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 13,000. He has requested his first loan with VisionFund Kenya for Kshs. 15,000 to buy a stock of dried maize for grinding into flour. With the anticipated profits, Joseph will be able to buy more dried cereals for grinding as well as expand his plots.

Joseph's dream for the future is to succeed in his business so that he can diversify into other enterprises.

loans.use: to buy a stock of dried maize for grinding

loans.name: Las Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 48 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene dos hijos; uno de 18 años y otro de 9 años, y su negocio es la venta ambulante de refrescos.
Ella es buena madre, responsable, constante, emprendedora y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un lugar caracterizado por el crecimiento de su población, emigrantes del lugar como la tribu ‘Ayorea’ y del occidente del país como los mineros relocalizados. De clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que ronda los 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Maria es de tez morena, estatura mediana cabello negro largo, viste a la moda, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español (al centro, lleva blusa blanca entera y pantalón jean azul). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y sus dos hijos que estudian en la escuela, la familia vive en una casa propia de una habitación, cuenta con agua potable y luz eléctrica.
