La necesidad por emprender un nuevo negocio la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de sándwiches, artesanía en yeso, librería, venta de ropa, venta de fruta, venta de tomates, confección de tejidos y venta de pescado, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de refrescos naturales como; chicha (similar al arroz con leche, pero con arroz licuado y mucho más líquido), somó (a base de maíz pelado y harina de trigo), tamarindo, guayaba, achachairú, limonada y jugo de lima, refrescos de miel o el caldo de caña, entre otros, que vende a diario ambulando por lugares de comercio. Su sueño es tener un puesto fijo de venta para no tener que seguir ambulando, ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de un carrito hamburguesero donde pueda cocinar comidas rápidas, como; hamburguesas, hot dogs, salchichas con papas fritas, etc. para incrementar sus ingresos y pagar los gastos de su familia. Esta es la quinta secuencia de préstamos con la institución en diez años que viene realizando esta labor.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de un carrito hamburguesero, para generar mejores ingresos económicos y pagar los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is a 48-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and has two children aged 18 and 9. She works as a street vendor, selling beverages. She is a good mother and a responsible, persistent, entrepreneurial and hardworking woman. She works in an area called “plan 3000”, with a growing population and immigrants that come from a tribe called “Ayorea” and relocated miners from the west. It has a warm, tropical weather and the temperature is 30°C [86°F] on average during the whole year.

Maria is dark-skinned, short and has long black hair. She likes to dress fashionably and her mother tongue is Guaraní, although she speaks Spanish (she is the one in the middle, wearing a white shirt and a blue jean). She shares her life with her partner, who is a construction worker, and her two children, who go to school. They live in a house of their own, which has one room and is served with water and electricity.

She needed to start a new business, so she started a communal bank with other people who work selling sandwiches, gypsum handicrafts, clothes, fruits, tomatoes or fish, make dresses or have a bookshop, in order to request a loan and expand their businesses. She sells different types of beverages, such as chicha (similar to rice pudding, but less thick and the rice is liquefied), somó (made with peeled corn and wheat flour), tamarind juice, guava juice, achachairú juice (a local fruit), lemon juice, lime juice, sugarcane juice, etc.

She works daily as a street vendor. Her dream is to have an establishment so she does not have to walk. She wants to expand her business by buying a hamburger cart where she can prepare fast foods, such as hamburgers, hot dogs, fries with sausages, etc. Her income will increase and she will be able to better cover the home expenses. This is the fifth loan she receives from the institution since she started with this activity ten years ago.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy a hamburger cart in order to improve her income and cover the home expenses.

loans.use: to buy a hamburger cart.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Un talador y pulidora son los elementos que necesita con urgencia el señor Rubén, un constructor de 51 años que trabaja diariamente por buscar un mejor beneficio y llevar el sustento  a su familia.
Es padre de dos hijos de 15 y 18 años ambas mujeres y su meta es que estas dos hermosas flores puedan asistir a una universidad y estudiar lo que gusten para convertirse en grandes profesionales y Rubén no quiere negarles ese gusto por eso solicita un crédito para comprar con urgencia estos dos implementos de trabajo ya que no dispone de capital y tiene trabajo pendientes por realizar donde requiere de ambos elementos.
Su sueño es que esas dos mujeres siempre mantengan la sonrisa y hacerlas muy felices por el resto que le queda de vida.
texts.en:
A drill and polisher are the two things that Rubén needs urgently. He is a 51-year-old construction worker who works daily to seek better profits and support his family.

He is the father of two children, ages 15 and 18, both of whom are females. His goal is to allow these two beautiful flowers to attend universities and study whatever they would like in order to become great professionals. 

Rubén does not want to deny them this pleasure, which is why he is requesting a loan to quickly buy these two work tools, since he does not have the capital available and has work pending that requires both tools. 

His dream to keep the smile on these two women´s faces, and to make them very happy for what remains of his life.

loans.use: to buy a drill and polisher, two things he needs urgently to work but does not have the capital to buy

loans.name: Jorge Ivan

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven campesino de 29 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 

Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee cultivos de mora, actividad que realiza todos los días y las cosechas son vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio, adicionalmente, realiza labores de jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, pues con ello complementa los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de sus hijos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros), con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos y tendrá una mejor cosecha, mucho más productiva, con lo que mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus productos. 

Jorge, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is a young farmer.  He is 29 years old, hardworking, and humble.  When he was a child, he learned to farm from his parents.  This has allowed him to progress, and now he owns blackberry crops.  He does this work every day and sells his crops in the plaza at the town market.  He also works as a day laborer at different farms in the area in order to add to his income, which supports the well-being of his children.

With this loan, he will purchase farming supplies at wholesale (manure, pesticides, fertilizers, and other items).  This will allow him to continue caring for his crops and have a better harvest.  More production will improve his income when he sells his products.

Jorge, with his enterprising spirit, strength, and tenacity, wants to continue fighting to achieve his dream of having his own farm, where he can grow a large variety of products and improve the profitability of his business.  This will guarantee financial stability so he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret, a 10-member group leader, represents the farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is married, has 2 children, and is a very experienced farmer.

Initially, Margaret joined One Acre Fund in 2009 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has learned a lot from  training. She will use the profits to send her children to school.

The 10 farmers in Margaret's Group will plant a total of 6.75 acres of land using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Some of the farmers in the group will purchase a solar light and the group will receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grown maize.

loans.name: Gülafer

texts.en:
Gülafer is married and has three children. For 17 years, she has made manti (dumplings). At first, she made manti from home, but later she began working in a manti shop. But she grew tired of having to work around other people.  She had loyal customers and decided to return  to working from home. “I’ve learned how to make my own money,” she says. 

With the loan from Maya, she will purchase a deep-freezer, which will allow her to store her manti. She hopes to see great days ahead as her own boss and with her children.

loans.use: to purchase a deep-freezer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old and lives in the city of Ijevan in the Tavush region.  She is married and has two sons. The oldest son is in the military service at the army and the youngest son is a student. Maria has a higher education and works at the city’s art school as a painting teacher. 

Maria  has had health problems and suffers from articular pains, which demand seasonal medical exams and  treatments, in order to keep the disease under control.

 Mari will be very thankful to have this Kiva loan, which she will use to pay for medical examinations  and treatment to control the disease.

loans.use: to pay for continuing medical examinations and treatment for her medical condition.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a married woman and the mother of 4 children. One of her sons who is also shown in the photo, started taxi driving business some time ago. He earns good amount of income and needs some financial help to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the taxi. 

Therefore, Parveen has availed Murabaha of 20,000 PKR loan for her son. She is hopeful that her son’s business will prosper and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy new baking equipment and tools

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 44 year old mother of two who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. Her two daughters are married and she lives with her husband who also lived his whole life inside the camp. 
While her husband's income for his job as a painter has always been the family's only source of income, Sawsan established her own business beginning 2011 by opening a grocery store in a very crowded street in the camp. Her husband also helps her running the store during his free time. The store had a very positive impact on the household's income and allowed Sawsan to support her husband in covering the family's expenses. 
Sawsan is asking for a 1,927,328 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She needs the loan to increase her supplies in food products and cleaning products which will allow her to satisfy the increasing demand from her customers and boost her monthly revenue.

loans.use: increase her stocks in food and cleaning products

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is a 37-year-old working woman. After she married, she felt that she should help her husband to improve their financial condition, so she started a business selling children’s garments in her locality. Khalida believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. She is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Khalida has taken out a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase good-quality clothes in different colors to increase sales and earn substantial profits. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality clothes in different colors to increase sales and earn substantial profits.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng (in photo) is 40 years old and lives in the Chbar Ampov district along the Mekong River.Seng has been married since 1997 and has two sons and one daughter. They are attending school.Seng has been raising ducks for 11 years, while his wife has been doing the same work. He would like to apply for a loan to buy ducks and feeds for ducks(He said that now he has 500 ducks,so he apply a loan more to buy ducks and feeds more.He hopes that after raising them three or four months they can get fruitful and he can get much money and then can pay back Maxima

loans.use: to buy more ducks and feeds.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
From Urut village in the Lori region, Anahit is is involved in farming with the help of her husband and her 33-year-old daughter. Anahit  raises livestock including cows, calves, pigs and hens and also cultivates potatoes. 

A hardworking and enthusiastic woman trying to provide her family with appropriate living conditions, Anahit will be very grateful if lenders support her with this loan  to expand her livestock with three additional calves and livestock forage. 

This loan will be a big help for Anahit and her family in enlarging their farm and developing it further.

loans.use: to pay for three calves and livestock forage

loans.name: Subhiye's Group

texts.en: Subhiye and Ayat are two independent women who are working to make a small business to help support their families. They bought a couple of sewing machines and fabric and started a tailoring business. Now they want to add a new line, sewing military clothes as Subhiye’s husband was a tailor for the military and has the experience in choosing the fabric and tailoring ways. For that, Subhiye and Ayat are asking for a loan to buy the fabric and expand their workshop to fit more employees.

loans.use: to buy fabric and expand their workshop

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 38 years old and has eight children. Lourdes is a married woman and has five children who are in school.

Lourdes is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lourdes has been running her business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 54 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Perla is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Perla has been pig fattening for ten years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sukriye

texts.en:
Şükriye is a married mother of two children, one of whom has health problems. She began working by making handicrafts at home and selling them.  Later, she started buying and reselling ready-made crocheted duvet covers. Şükriye now buys additional items such as fleece coverlets and crochet, selling them to the staff and to the relatives of the patients at the two different rehabilitation centers where she takes her son for treatment. 

With this loan from Maya to purchase more items, Şükriye will be able to increase her sales. She wants her son’s health to improve.

loans.use: to buy underwear, coverlet sets and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Ümmühan

texts.en:
Ummuhan is divorced from her husband and has three children. She endeavors to stand on her own feet. She works as a housekeeper at a cleaning company and earns the minimum wage. But her wage is not enough to support her two sons, who are at the college, and her daughter, who is in the 8th grade. So she works day and night to support her children's education.  

She is planning to purchase underwear and leggings to resell. Since she will be able to purchase more merchandise with the new loan, she hopes to make more sales.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Ümmühan Hanım,3 çocuklu,eşinden ayrılmış.  Kendi ayakları üstünde durmak için mücadele eden bir kadın.  Temizlik şirketinde hizmetli olarak çalışmakta.  Askari ücret alıyor.  Bu para oldukça yetersiz.  Çünkü 2 oğlu ünversite,kızı 8.sınıfta okuyor.  Çocuklarının eğitimini tamamlatmak için,gece gündüz çalışmakta.Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile iç çamaşırı ve tayt alacak.  Toplu malzeme alacağından daha çok satış yapabilecek.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 29 year old Palestinian taxi driver living and working inside a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. Growing up and settling with his wife and their two children inside the camp, living conditions were hard due to political tensions and economic instabilities which made Wissam leave the country to seek better opportunities. 
A couple of years later, Wissam had to come back to the camp for personal reasons. He bought his own car and started  working as a taxi driver two years ago. He has a wide range of clients inside the camp who see him as an honest, trustworthy taxi driver. 
Wissam is asking for a 2,313,998 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He needs the loan to complete his car registration and cover maintenance costs which will allow him to work in better conditions and support his family, his wife being unemployed and his kids still in elementary school.

loans.use: to complete his car registration and cover maintenance costs

loans.name: Rukhsat

texts.en:
Rukhsat is a 46-year-old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her son, who is a van driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. He wants to change the engine of his van as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work. That is why Rukhsat has availed Murabaha of 30,000 PKR for her son, who will buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to his customers. 

Rukhsat is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for her son's van to provide better facilities to his customers.

loans.name: Faamanini

texts.en: Faamanini is 27 years old and married with one child. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for three years. Faamanini needs a loan to buy two fridges, frozen goods, canned items, snacks and cordials. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy two fridges, frozen goods, canned items, snacks and cordials.

loans.name: Asotasi

texts.en:
Asotasi is 31 years old and unmarried with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Asotasi needs a loan to buy crops, a pitch-fork, a spade, a crowbar, chemicals, fertilizer, and gum-boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Asotasi will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy crops, a pitch-fork, a spade, a crowbar, chemicals, fertilizer, and gum-boots

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 40 years old and is married with three school-aged children. She lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. For the past five years, she has operated a solar dryer where farmers bring their harvest to dry and prepare for milling. Paulina has been a member of PMPC for five years.

Paulina is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan to pay for labor to expand her solar dryer to increase her monthly income. In the future, she wants to buy a mechanical dyer for the rainy season.

loans.use: to expand her solar dryer

loans.name: Hiệp

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiệp has a retail business, selling dry food. 
She has been involved in this business for five years. 
Hiệp is 30 years old, and she is married and has one child. She lives and works in Bim Son town, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province.
The main hardship that Hiệp faces in her life is the lack of a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick,... to build a  toilet. 
She will use these materials to build a toilet and bathroom and water filter system.

With her business profit, Hiệp hopes to maintain a successful business, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick,... to build a  toilet

loans.name: Tuyên

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyên operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit.

She is 52 years old and married with four children. Tuyên lives with two dependents in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Tuyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tuyên has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a clean water syterm and hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Tuyên hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 29-year-old single man who has worked for fifteen years repairing motorcycles to help in covering the needs and expenses of his poor family. 

Mahmoud is an ambitious man who is working hard to expand his business, thus he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary repairing tools to facilitate his work and provide his customers with better service.

Mahmoud hopes to expand his business more in the future to improve his family's living conditions and save some profit for his future.

loans.use: to buy necessary repairing tools

loans.name: Lành

texts.en:
Mrs. Lành works in agriculture farming food. She is 44 years old and she is married with three children. 

She lives and works in Bim Son town, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with three dependents.

Lành has been involved in this business for eight years.

Her most difficult is lack of biogas system. She request a loan to purchase equipment to build biogas system.
In the future, Lành hope healthy and happy for her family, her business doing well and she can build a new hourse.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to build biogas system

loans.name: Lành

texts.en:
Mrs. Lành works in agriculture, farming food. She is 35 years old and married with three children. She lives and works in Bim Son town, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa Province .

Lành has been involved in this business for eight years. The main hardship that Lành faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick, to build toilet.
With his business profit, Lành hopes for his business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to remodel his house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick, to build toilet.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia, 42, is married to Wambua and they have three children who are 25, 22 and 20.

Teresia has sold cereal for 9 years to earn a monthly income of 1,000 KES.

Teresia requests 10,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya to increase her cereal business.
With the anticipated profits, Teresia will be able to expand her business.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to  have a good inventory and increase profits.

loans.use: to increase her cereal business.

loans.name: Mansueta

texts.en:
Mansueta is 44 years old and has five children. Mansueta is a married woman and three of her children are in school.

Mansueta is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mansueta has been running her business for 4 years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mansueta would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosel

texts.en:
Rosel is 30 years old and has two children. Rosel is married, and her two children are in school.

Rosel is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosel has been running her business for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nahbone Group

texts.en:
Nom is excited that he, like his group member, was able to purchase a water filter. The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of water borne diseases. Nom's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in his village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  

Even though some people in the village, including Nom, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Nom and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Nom's filter is guaranteed for two years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter, increasing time available for productive work also improves a family’s income and over all well-being.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 54 years old and single.

Zenaida is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been running her business for two years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Zenaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Zulakaan

texts.en:
Zulakaan is a 48-year-old energetic, married woman. She and her husband have sold animals for 10 years. She has 2 goats and her business helps to pay the daily expenses and provides a decent living.

She plans  to buy more goats to increase her sales and income. She contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for 40,000 PKR.

loans.use: to buy goats to increase her sales and revenue.

loans.name: Prabir

texts.en:
Prabir is 40 years-old a differently able man lives with his wife, parents and three children in a small village of Jharsuguda district of Odisha state, India. He owns a General store where he sells basic household items, some groceries items, personnel care products and stationery items. He makes 6,000 INR per month. He says "Its very difficult to manage a seven members consisting family in 6,000 INR per month income and it is also very difficult for me to pay my children's educational cost". He is very hardworking man and he wants to improve his business by adding more items in his general store so that he can make more money.

He has requested this loan to buy cosmetics items and basic household items for resell. He is grateful to kiva and its lenders for this support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics items and basic household items for resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a piece of land

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 40-year-old  hardworking, energetic  mother of 2 lovely children. Edna resides in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and favorable weather conditions for farming. 

Edna has farmed for 10 years and  has gathered experience with farming techniques. She has been able to take care of her family and  provide the basic needs for her children. Edna is a very enterprising woman and has always worked hard on her farm to provide decent meals. 

The Kapsowar area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why Edna  seeks a loan to start farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Edna feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. 

Edna is very disciplined with finances and plans to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Zanib

texts.en: Zanib is a 47-year-old married woman who has been in the business of purchasing and selling cattle for the past 2 years. She is very enthusiastic about her business and earns a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She has 5 children. She is very motivated to provide her children with a beautiful life, including good education, food, health and clothing. She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses. She is in her 8th loan cycle with Kashf Foundation, and she is happily running her business through Kashf Foundation's support. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more cow and feed for the calves that she already has. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for the calves that she already has

loans.name: Maria Silvia

texts.es:
Maria es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus tres hijos que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia. 

Desea montar una venta de huevos, para lo cual requiere tiene una cantidad de gallinas que le permiten tener muy buenas ventas. 

Solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de algunas gallinas y materiales para construir un galpón.

Maria sueña con tener un gran negocio donde pueda utilizar toda la capacidad que pueda para sacarlo adelante y así ofrecerles a sus hijos un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
Maria is a single mother and the head of her family of three children.  She has had to experience many adversities in her life.  Nevertheless, she has always had the strength to get ahead and to continue progressing with her family.

She wishes to set up a business selling eggs.  In order to do, so she needs some hens that will allow her to have very good sales.

She is requesting a loan to buy some hens and materials to build a shed.

Maria dreams of having a large business where she will be able to use all of the capacity that she can in order to get ahead.  This way she will provide her children with a stable financial future.

loans.use: to buy hens.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos en su búsqueda por un futuro prometedor y unas buenas oportunidades para salir adelante, decidió iniciar un negocio que según él le dará todo eso que siempre ha soñado.

Montara un negocio de tienda de abarrotes en su casa en el municipio de Medellín, con el cual planea sostener a su hijo y a su esposa.

Para esto necesita la ayuda de un préstamo para la compra de un enfriador, estanterías, vitrinas y surtido de productos básicos de la canasta familiar para abastecer e iniciar su negocio.

Apoya a los sueños emprendedores de un joven Colombiano con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
In his search for a promising future and good opportunities to get ahead, Carlos decided to start a business.  According to him, it will give him everything that has always dreamed of.

He will set up a business, a grocery store, at his house in the Medellín municipality.  He plans to support his child and his wife with the business.

In order to do this, he needs the help of a loan to buy a cooler, shelves, display cases, and stock of basic needs products to stock and start his business.

Support the enterprising dreams of a young Colombian man with a loan now.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, shelves, display cases, and stock of basic needs products.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is a 36-year-old married woman. Her husband has operated a food stall for seven years. He makes potato cutlets and offers.  He has become famous in his town for proving good service and makes enough money to lead a decent life. He takes orders from nearby hotels and people in the  community. 

Naheed is a responsible mother with 4 children. She has requested 50,000 PKR to buy  flour, spices, oil, and baking powder at lower rates from the market. 

She has a positive outlook regarding her husband's future earnings.

loans.use: to buy flour, spices, oil, and baking powder at lower rates from the market.

loans.name: Eddah

texts.en:
Eddah sells fruits in Kitengela town and has been running this business for 8 years now. She is 39 years old, married, and together with her spouse has been blessed with 1 child. 

She will use this loan to buy more stock of mangoes, avocados, oranges and bananas to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her child and buy more fruit for her business. 

This is Eddah's first loan from VisionFund Kenya and in the future she hopes to have a prosperous business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a married mother, with one daughter who attends university. She sells baby items that she makes at home. 

Rabia has recently also decided to start buying and selling ready-made children's and baby clothes. She makes her sales during the daytime to people in both her circle and also at Friday prayer services.  

With her loan from Maya, Rabia intends to buy baby and children’s clothes wholesale. She is happy and excited because she’ll be able to earn more of her own money. With the wholesale products she buys, Rabia will be able to increase her sales and earnings, grow her business, and put her daughter through school.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Rabia Hanım evli üniversite öğrencisi bir kız annesi. Evde bebek malzemeleri yapıp satıyor. Şimdi yanında da hazır bebek ve çocuk kıyafetleri satmaya karar verdi. Çevresine ,günlerde ,Cuma okumalarında satışlarını yapıyor. Aldığı kredi ile de toplu bebek ve çocuk kıyafetleri alacak. Daha çok kazanacağı ,kendi parasını kazandığı için mutlu ve heyecanlı. Aldığı toplu ürünlerle çok satış yaparak kazancını arttırmayı ,işini büyütmeyi ve kızını okutmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy children's and baby clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 41-year-old married woman. She and her spouse have been blessed with four children. She is a farmer in Machakos town and the business has been profitable. 

She will be using this loan to buy animal feed for her livestock and seeds for planting on her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her family's living standards. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Her future hopes are to expand her farming and be successful.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her livestock and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Salamatu. She is married and has four children who are 22, 19, 17 and 4 years old. In 2010, Salamatu established her material and clothing shop business.  She was not educated so she decided to engage in a business with the hope of getting additional income to assist her husband.
 
Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Salamatu requires a loan to buy more bales of different types of clothing materials for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 1,500,000. In the future, Salamatu plans to open another shop in the same street because of the increase in sales in that area. Very hard working, she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bales of cotton materials

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es: Ángela tiene 45 años de edad y vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 5, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ángela, age 45, lives in her own house with her three children and her husband.  She has had a small store at her house for five years.  She has a lot of customers because of the good prices and her amiability towards her customers.

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, and sweet breads, etc.  This way she will be able to have better income in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, and sweet breads, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build extra rooms.

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda is a 55-year-old married woman. Her husband is a laborer and the only earner of the family. It was very tough for Fareeda to manage her household expenditures with her husband's small income. She decided to help her husband and started her business to sell bed covers and sheets. She purchases them from different markets at wholesale rate and sells them in her area. Now she is playing a very important role for her family. 

In order to increase her sales, she needs 40,000 PKR to purchase  bed sheets and spreads in different colors and designs to please her customers.

loans.use: to purchase bed sheets and spreads in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Yehowa Da Group

texts.en:
Yehowa Da is a group who live in Accra-Teshie, located in coastal Ghana. The group was formed to take loans to enable them to stay in active business. 

They are into wigs, hair products, panties, jeans, shoes, kenkey (cooked corn paste), fish, plastic items, slippers, rice and stew, and secondhand clothing, and they have been successfully running these small businesses. They have taken eight different loans and are now on their ninth loan cycle. 

The featured borrower is Charlotte, who is 42 years old and into the sale of jeans, underwear, and shoes. She has been doing this business for 5 years. Her previous loan repayments have been successful. She is married with three dependable children. She is requesting this loan to buy jeans, underwear, and shoes to sell to her customers. The group would need a total amount of GHS 4,000 to buy enough goods and serve customers better.

loans.use: To buy jeans, underwear, and shoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en: Sumaira is a 29-year-old married woman with three children. She is trying hard to provide them with food, good health, clothing, and education. She and her husband have been farmers for 12 years. They grow different vegetables and fruit and sell them in the local market.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.  Sumaira requests 40, 000 PKR to grow more crops and  generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seed, insecticides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 40-year-old energetic, married woman. She, her son, and husband sell goats. They buy animals at low prices and after raising them for a year or two, sell them during the occasion of Eidul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). 

Nazia has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more goats. She hopes to earn more income through  greater sales.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric and thread to make clothing

loans.name: Ntokoen

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Ntokoen has been in the transport business and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. He is married to Everlyne and blessed with three school-going children.

He has applied for his first loan of 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan to repair his motorbike and buy new spare wheels.

Ntokoen will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children and, in the future, he hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike and buy new spare wheels

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is an agronomist from the village of Yeghegnadzor in Vayots Dzor region. She lives with her husband and two little daughters (five and four years old). Anna works in the local kindergarten. The salary she gets there is very low and it is impossible to meet the family's daily needs with that salary. With the help of her husband, Anna breeds calves, cows and hens. This is the most important source of the family's income. As the family's everyday costs are increasing day by day, they need to find more sources of income to meet their needs. Anna currently needs a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase fertilizer, seeds and fuel for land cultivation as well as 350 packages of grass for feeding the livestock. She and her family will be very thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds and fuel for land cultivation as well as 350 packages of grass for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 45 years old. She is married to Maingi. Together they have been blessed with two children who are now 29 and 27 years old. Maingi provides additional income for his family. Esther runs a hotel, which she has operated for the last 12 years, earning a monthly income of 14,000 KES.

Esther has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of 10,000 KES, which she will use to expand her business. She intends to purchase cooking ingredients like vegetables, rice, tomatoes, baking flour and cooking oil.

With the anticipated profits, Esther will be able buy a plot of land and build a big hotel/restaurant. She hopes and dreams in the future to get a plot of land for her children to build their houses.

loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients for her hotel

loans.name: Milena

texts.es:
María Milena
Belleza 


	Es una mujer joven de 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos menores. Ella decide trabajar en su casa hace cerca de 4 años con el objetivo de cuidar a sus hijos y apoyarlos en su educación.  En la parte educativa tampoco se queda atrás, sus títulos en belleza y tratamiento de uñas la muestran como una persona con deseos de superación, al demostrar interés en capacitarse. Este negocio le ha permitido  brindarles apoyo económico para la  educación de sus hijos. Muy ordenada en su actividad, lleva un libro diario con sus cuentas y elabora su contabilidad mensual, por lo que sabe exactamente cuánto le entra y cuanto sale de su negocio. Su negocio, está inscrita en la municipalidad por lo que  cuenta con todos los permisos para su funcionamiento. Ella inició con un dinero que su esposo le dio su esposo,  con el cual invirtió en mercadería, con este capital empezó a desarrollar su negocio y le ha permitido capacitarse para diversificar sus servicios (tratamiento de uñas).

	.

	 En su casa cuenta con un local, está llevando su tercer curso en un conocido Instituto especializado  en Costa Rica  de estética corporal y ha empezado a trabajar desde hace 2 años el cuido de pies y uñas. Cuenta con el equipo de belleza. 

	El préstamo se va a utilizar para la compra de mercadería ( perfumes, cosméticos) y materiales (esmaltes, y otros para pies y uñas y tratamientos del cabello) Con esto espera incrementar los ingresos de su actividad ya que una limitante ha sido el capital de trabajo, pero después que asistió a una reunión y escuchó de Fundación Mujer  y Kiva, vio la posibilidad de cumplir sus sueños, que es  empezar a ahorrar para su casa propia y poder ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad en sus estudios y lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Milena is 33 years old. She's married with two young children. She decided to work out of her home about 4 years ago, so she could take care of her children and support their education. She doesn't get behind when it comes to her education, either. She has degrees in beauty care and nail treatment, which show her desire to excel, and her interest in learning. This business has allowed her to provide financial support toward the education of her children. She is very neat regarding her financials. She keeps a journal with her expenses and prepares monthly accounting statements, so she knows exactly what comes in and out of the business. Her business is registered in her municipality, so she has the appropriate permits for operation. 
She opened her doors with some money she borrowed from her husband to invest in supplies. She was able to make her business grow and also invest in her training and diversify into other services (nail treatment). 
She runs her business out of her home, she is taking her third training course at a very renowned beauty Institute in Costa Rica and she also began working in foot and nail care two years ago. She also has her very own beauty equipment.
She intends to use this loan to purchase goods (perfumes, cosmetics) and supplies (nail polish, and other foot, nail and hair treatment supplies).
She hopes to increase revenue from these activities, as available capital has always been a problem, After attending a meeting about Fundacion Mujer and Kiva, she saw an opportunity to fulfill her dreams, start saving to buy her own home and improve her children's quality of life through education and professional pursues.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to use in her business and to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is an experienced farmer from the village of Zartonq in Armenia. She and her son live together while her husband is a migrant laborer. 

Gayane is engaged in breeding cows, raising calves, and the cultivation of plum and cherry trees. Her son helps her a lot with selling their agricultural products at the local market. 

However, in order to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, Gayane requires a loan of USD 1,500 so she can purchase forage to feed their livestock. This will help Gayane and her family meet their daily living expenses more effectively. 

Guyane and her family will be very grateful to all the lenders for helping her collect the amount required to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase forage to feed her livestock.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.pt:
Paulina tem 27 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de uma filha ainda bebé, vive em casa própria com a sua familia, é negociante e estudante universitária.
Com o montante financiado vai comprar, carne de vaca, worce, perú para revender no mercado local.
No futuro espera ampliar  o seu negócio e abrir um estabelecimento comercial.
O seu maior desafio e terminar a licenciatura,  e liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir mais financiamentos nos futuros empréstimos
texts.en:
Paulina is 27 years old and is married with a infant daughter. She lives in her own home with her family and both studies at the university and runs her own business.

Paulina will use this loan to buy beef, sausage and turkey meat to sell at a local market. In the future, she would like to expand her business and open a store. Her main goal is to finish college and pay off this loan on time so that she can be eligible to take out further loans in the future.

loans.use: buy beef, sausage and turkey meat to sell at a local market.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar paid back her first Kiva loan successfully and thanks to this loan, she was able to greatly develop her farm and earn a good income from it. Now she hopes for her second loan. 

Gohar is still running her farming business. The second loan Gohar plans to use to purchase wheat seeds (1300 kg) and fertilizer. 

She hopes to receive the lenders' support one more time and promises responsible payment of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds (1300 kg) and fertilizer

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en:
Not many business owners get to test drive their business before jumping into ownership, but Suzanne worked for the founders of Via Yoga, earning their trust and respect – enough so that she was their preferred buyer when they sold the business. Via Yoga matches yoga with other activities like surfing, Pilates, and fitness classes. Suzanne’s business helps to support herself, her husband, and young daughter.
 
One major service Via Yoga offers is retreats. Suzanne says, “The hardest part about this business is that due to the seasonality of the business, cash flow is really tight during the off season.” To address this, Suzanne wants to offer year round retreats in 2015, allowing for more customer options, as well as encouraging a steadier stream of business cash flow. “I see Via Yoga offering year round retreats and diversifying our current locations to offer local options.”

Suzanne will use this loan towards marketing and PR efforts for the upcoming 2015 retreat season.

loans.use: to pay for advertising to promote the 2015 retreat season

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria de 39 años e edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de medicina natural, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas medicinas natural por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 39 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. For three years she has worked selling natural medicines. Her business is located in her place of residence and she has a lot of customers due to the quality of the products and good prices. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy more natural medicines in bulk so that she can continue her sales and so increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more natural medicines in bulk.

loans.name: Oscar Ovidio

texts.es:
Oscar, con 40 años de edad, es padre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. 

Nació y se crió en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas al lado de su padre; gracias a ello, hoy en día tiene cultivos de Papa, cuya cosecha es vendida y de esta manera obtiene los recursos para llevar el alimento a su hogar. 

El prestatario es un hombre pujante, luchador, dedicado a su familia y a su trabajo, eso lo motiva para trabajar largas jornadas y tratar de salir adelante; día a día lucha para sobrepasar los obstáculos que se le presentan, ha pasado por situaciones económicas difíciles debido al bajo precio de la papa en el mercado, lo que afecta el precio de su producto. 

Oscar solicita su primer ciclo de crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas), con el fin de darle continuidad a su negocio y preparar sus cultivos para cosechar un producto de muy buena calidad, que le permita venderlo a un mejor precio para obtener mejores utilidades. 

Oscar sueña con mejorar sus cultivos, ampliarlos para obtener de estos una buena renta mensual, que le permita brindarles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y una mejor educación a sus hijos, para que su futuro sea exitoso.
texts.en:
Oscar is 40 years old and is the father of 2 children. He lives in a common law marriage with his partner. 

He was born and grew up in the farm where he learned agriculture from his father.  Because of that he now has potato crops and sells the harvest, this way he makes the income to bring food to his home.

The borrower is a thriving, hard-worker man dedicated to his family and to his work. That is what motivates him to work long days and to prosper.  Day by day he works to overcome the obstacles that he encounters. He has been through difficult economic times due to the low cost of the potatoes in the market, which affects the price of his product.

Oscar is asking for his first loan cycle to invest in the purchase of farming supplies (organic, chemical fertilizers, pesticides), with the purpose of continuing his business and to prepare his crop to harvest a good quality product. This will allow him to sell it at a better price to obtain better earnings.

Oscar dreams of improving his crops and of expanding them to obtain a better monthly income. That will allow him to bring a better quality of life to his family and a better education for his children so that their future is a successful one.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as fertilizers.

loans.name: Tanganush

texts.en: Tanganush is an experienced agronomist from the village of Hatsik in the Shirak region. Her family consists of her husband, her daughter, and retired mother-in-law. To meet the family’s daily needs, Tanganush breeds livestock: cows, calves, piglets and hens. She is also involved in cultivation of pepper and apricots. Her family members assist her a lot in running the farm. Tanganush's husband helps her to sell the agricultural products at the local market. As the needs of the family are growing day by day, they now need to enlarge their livestock a little bit. A loan of US $2,000 will be a huge support for this hardworking family and will help them purchase six pigs, forage for feeding the livestock, and fertilizer. Tanganush and her family will be grateful to the lenders for their good will in helping them to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for six pigs, forage for feeding the livestock, and fertilizer

loans.name: Pavel

texts.en:
Pavel is a private entrepreneur from Nikopol, Dnepropetrovsk region. He has been running his own enterprise for five years. However, he has been working in this specific sphere of business for the last 16 years. Pavel sells fruit and nuts wholesale: apples, peaches, apricots, grapes, sweet cherries, and strawberries. Usually he sells fruit from May until fall, while in winter he processes and sells mostly nuts. He rents a facility that serves as a storehouse for his merchandise. 

Pavel needs 40 000 Grivnyas to purchase a batch of walnuts, process and peel them to be able to sell whole walnut kernels later. Pavel is hoping to generate additional income by summer so that he can invest additional funds in the purchase of land. One of Pavel's big dreams is to plant a fruit orchard where he could grow fruit trees and have his own produce every year.

loans.use: to purchase a batch of walnuts, process and peel them to be able to sell whole walnut kernels later

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is grateful for the financial assistance she previously received from Kiva. The additional funds helped her grow her income and, as a result, family budget. Marina confesses that she still remembers how, in the past, her family was struggling with even basic needs. However, now thanks to the consistent growth of her business and a stable income, she feels restored and full of enthusiasm to move on with dignity.

Marina is seeking another 26,000 UAH because she wants to extend one of her existing greenhouses before the winter season. This fall was cold and windy in Ukraine which caused damage to Marina's crops. Marina is hoping to extend the greenhouse, make it 15 meters longer. She still has an additional piece of land that just sits there empty while it could serve as extra greenhouse space with the right temperatures for growing crops.

loans.use: to extend one of her existing greenhouses before the winter season.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee un puesto de venta de pescados y mariscos ubicado en el mercado municipal, tiene muchos clientes porque siempre mantiene frescos los productos y por los precios accesibles a los clientes, Luis esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mariscos y pescados por mayor para poder aumentar sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Luis is 34 years old, and lives in his own home with his family group. He owns a stall located in the municipal market where he sells fish and shellfish. He has a lot of customers because he always keeps his products fresh and at accessible prices for his customers.

Luis is asking for a loan in order to buy shellfish and fish in bulk so that he can increase his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: to buy shellfish and fish in bulk.

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi is a greenhouse owner. He is married with a son and a daughter. He is 36. Vitaliy has been working in this sphere of business for 10 years. He lives in Bolshaya Kardashinka and owns a piece of land where he grows early and late crop vegetables – cucumbers and tomatoes. 

Vitalyi is planning to use 30,001 Grivnyas to construct two additional greenhouses on his land lot. He is planning to invest his income in further maintenance of existing greenhouses, upgrading them and building new ones as well, for expanding his greenhouse farm eventually.

loans.use: to construct two additional greenhouses on his land lot

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy threads and nylon in different colours in bulk.

loans.name: Leocadio Valeriano

texts.es:
Valeriano es un hombre de 48 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es el comercio de garrafas de gas licuado.
El es independiente, constante, responsable, paciente y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Karapata’ que se encuentra ubicado a orilla del lago Titicaca, a una altura aproximada de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar, de clima frio y seco, con una temperatura que varía entre 6 y 12 grados centígrados.
Valeriano es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el aymara que se habla en el lugar y para realizar comercio en la ciudad habla español. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su madre que tiene 73 años y tiene muy buena vista, viven en una casa propia de ladrillo; cuenta con electricidad y recientemente agua potable. Su negocio es el comercio de gas natural en garrafa; en el lugar se cocina con leña y bosta (eses de vaca) que arden para cocinar en cocinas de barro y fogatas nocturnas, debido a las lluvias de temporada es muy difícil encontrar algo seco que se pueda quemar, es por esa razón que mucha gente tiene su garrafa de gas con la que cocinar, es la época donde su comercio aumenta, el transporte de las garrafas es difícil porque no cuenta con transporte propio. Su sueño es construirle una casa grande a su mamá. Él desea realizar la compra de garrafas por mayor para poder ofertarla en su comunidad y en otras comunidades cercanas, porque todos lo conocen y es el único que realiza esta labor. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en tres años que viene realizando esta labor.
Es por esos motivos que Leocadio solicita un préstamo para la compra de garrafas de gas por mayor para ofertarlas a los comunarios vecinos que la necesitan en la época de lluvias.
texts.en:
Leocadio is 48. He is single with no children and he owns a business selling liquefied gas tanks. He is independent, consistent, responsible, patient and hardworking. His business is located in the community of Karapata, on the shores of Lake Titicaca, 3.800 meters above sea level, with cold and dry weather and temperatures ranging between 6 and 12 degrees Celsius.
Leocadio has dark skin, he is medium built, has short, black hair, his first language is Aymara, spoken in his birthplace, and he also speaks Spanish in the city. He shares his life with his 73-year-old mother, who has a great eye sight. They live in a brick house they own. They have electricity and very recently, they also began running drinking water. 
He works in the business of selling natural gas and propane tanks. People in this region are used to cooking using firewood and dung (cow feces) which they burn in clay ovens and night fires, but due to the rainy season, it is really difficult to find dry spots, so many people are forced to use gas tanks to cook, so business increases during this season. Transportation is difficult because he doesn't own a truck. His dream is to build a big house for his mother. He would like to purchase tanks in bulk to offer to his community and others nearby, because he is well known by everybody and he is the only one in this line of work. This is his first line of loans with this group in three years of working in this field. He is asking for a loan now to buy gas tanks in bulk to offer to his neighbors in need during the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy gas tanks in bulk to offer to his neighbors in need during the rainy season

loans.name: Katrina

texts.en:
Katrina says she has been passionate about the salon business “forever and a day.” Her grandmother was in the salon business, so Katrina had early exposure to this work. She currently has three stylists on contract and one employee who helps with booking clients, clean up, and clerical work. Katrina’s work supports her two daughters. 

Katrina works hard to make sure her clients are happy and says, “I’m doing what I love to do and my customers love my work.” Katrina’s salon provides make-up services in the Elizabeth, NJ area. With the upcoming holiday season, Katrina expects demand to pick up as clients come to her to get ready for their big events. Her loan will go towards make-up inventory, as well as investing in airbrush make-up tools.

loans.use: to purchase make-up inventory, including airbrush makeup tools

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is a small-scale farmer. She's only 20; however, she is very hard-working and enterprising. She has been running this business for two years. At the moment, Alina owns four greenhouses. She grows vegetables on her own land lot in Vodyanoye, mostly cucumbers and tomatoes. 

After Alina got married, she and her husband built a few big greenhouses and installed good heating. Unfortunately, there was a bad storm this fall that ruined two greenhouses and damaged the third one. It was a frustrating experience for a young family; however, they don't want to give up.

Alina is seeking 40,000 Grivnyas to reconstruct and fix greenhouses that need to be rebuilt or refurbished. Two of them need a complete makeover; the third one needs to be fixed – arches need to be replaced and reinforced. 

In time, Alina is planning to purchase more land and construct new greenhouses in the future.

loans.use: to reconstruct and fix greenhouses that need to be rebuilt or refurbished after a bad storm

loans.name: Silviya

texts.en:
Silviya has already benefited from financial aid received from Kiva. She used the funds to buy a vending spot that she used to rent before. Moreover, Silviya increased her stock, which helped her get more loyal clientele and better revenue as a result – it has increased up to 2,000 Grivnyas. All this benefits the family budget and helps Silviya assist her son with his academic fees.
 
This time Silviya is requesting 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal merchandise, i.e., winter jackets and coats for sale.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise, i.e., winter jackets and coats for sale.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana has already used financial assistance from Kiva. She invested it in the diversification of assorted produce in her store, which led to an increase of income as a result.  

Oksana is seeking to buy additional supplies of sugar, flour, sunflower oil, etc., for further retail sale. She is planning to invest 12,000 Grivnyas in purchases, and she is hoping to receive these funds from Kiva. Oksana is hoping to stock her little store with merchandise that is always on the list of top-selling items at current wholesale prices. With the situation in Ukraine, the prices went up. The situation with price fluctuations is still unstable at the moment, which is why Oksana wants to secure herself and her business from extra expenses.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of sugar, flour, sunflower oil, etc., for further retail sale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se la ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de cereales de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
This young man has had his face pixelated because he is 25 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He works as a street vendor, selling cereals at different markets found near his home. The young man lives in his own house with his family group. 

He is asking for a loan in order to buy more merchandise in bulk so he can continue his work and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy cereals in bulk.

loans.name: Ruth Marina

texts.es: Ruth de 36 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza de cerdos,  comercializa los cerdos en los diferentes mercados y con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, Ruth vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar concentrado, maíz, maicillo para engordar a los cerdos y asi poder continuar con la crianza de los mismo y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ruth is 36 years old. She's worked raising pigs for several years. She sells pigs in different markets and she covers all her household expenses with her profits. Ruth lives with her husband in a house they own. 
She is asking for a loan to buy feed, corn and millet to fatten pigs and so to continue the breeding process and have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy feed, corn and millet to fatten pigs

loans.name: Embassy Group

texts.en:
Aisha, who is in her late 30s, is married with two kids who are still in school.  She has been running two projects, operating a beauty salon and selling cosmetics in the same shop.  She works from 8 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Aisha's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to start selling cosmetics and increased the salon equipment.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase her cosmetics stock and buy up-to-date salon products.  She dreams of owning a boutique shop.

Aisha will share this loan with her loan group "Embassy", which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her cosmetics stock and buy up-to-date salon products.

loans.name: Julio Adalberto

texts.es: Julio de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el posee un molino de nixtamal y realiza trabajo de albañilería, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Julio quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo una pared en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero no le alcanza con lo que gana para poder realizarlo, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena, hierro, etc. para que el y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros.
texts.en:
Julio is 43 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and three children.  He owns a corn mill and performs masonry work.  From the earnings of his work he is able to cover household costs.

Julio wants to improve his house by building a wall in the area shown on the photograph, but he doesn't earn enough to achieve that.  For this reason, he requests a loan for the purchase of bricks, cement, sand, iron, etc. so that he and his family can live in a safer place.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, sand, iron, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy up-to-date products.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Ivan is 27 years old, married and has two sons. He has worked manufacturing socks for kids for the last 13 years. It is a family business that his father started and taught him. In the business, he works with his father and a brother. He is asking for a loan to purchase materials for production. His biggest accomplishment is growing the business and being able to buy a car and, most important, providing financial stability to his family.

loans.use: To purchase material for manufacturing socks

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a vigorous, married woman. She has been doing hand embroidery for many years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. Salma’s embroidery patterns are very popular in her area, and she has the best resource for earning an income in her house.

Her husband is the only breadwinner, but he does not earn enough to support his family's well-being. Therefore Salma started hand embroidery. She is a mother of four children. She wants to grow her business. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Therefore she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, needles and pearls in large quantities to meet increasing demand. 

She shared her dream of running a training center for girls in her village. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work and to increase the number of her clients.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, needles and pearls in large quantities

loans.name: Sunil

texts.en:
Sunil is 42 years old and lives with his wife and child. He is a rice farmer and has cultivated rice for many years. Sunil is a very good client of Seva MFI who repaid his loan always on time. 

Sunil's fields are too far from home, that is why he needs SRD 13,000 to buy a panel truck to transport seeds and fertilizers to his fields.

loans.use: to buy a panel truck to transport seeds and fertilizers to his fields.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.pt:
O SR. Francisco de 27 anos de idade, casado e pai de 1 filhos que esta a frequentar a escola no ensino primaria. Ele è supervisor  na empresa de producao de banana a mais de 3 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar materia de construcao (blocos, cimento, janela e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a sua casa.
Tem como grande desafio melhorar as condicoes de habitacao e a dieta alimentar.
texts.en:
Francisco is 27 years old and is married with one child who is in elementary school. For more than three years he has worked as a supervisor for a commercial banana farm. 

With this loan Francisco would like to continue with a home construction project by buying materials like blocks, cement, and windows, and paying workers to help with the project. His main goal is to improve his family's living conditions and nutrition.

loans.use: buy construction materials like blocks, cement, and windows, and pay workers to help with his home construction project.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y asi poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman whose face is blurred because she is 24 years old and lives in a high-risk area has made a living by selling products for personal use for many years. Her business is located in her home and she also sells in an itinerant fashion around various neighborhoods. The young woman lives in a house she owns with her life partner and their son. She is asking for a loan to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants etc., all wholesale. In this way she will be able to continue with her work to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants etc., all wholesale

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de pollos  su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de pollos por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida junto con su hijo.
texts.en:
Elena is 55 years old and lives at home with her son.  

She sells chickens.  Her business is located in the municipal market and has many customers due to her good prices.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase chickens wholesale so as to continue with her sales and so to have better earnings and a better quality of life along with her son.

loans.use: to purchase chickens wholesale

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en:
Fuad is 32 years old, but does not have children yet. He has always worked in agriculture, growing onions and potatoes. Fuad has also worked as a taxi driver, but 10 years ago he decided to have his own farm as well to continue growing onions and potatoes. He sells this harvest in a local market, and this is how he makes an income to provide for the family. Fuad’s situation is very hard. He needs to raise vegetables and care for them, but the lack of water in the region makes this a problem. Because of this problem, productivity has fallen, and he cannot cover the family’s needs. 

He has applied for a 1,000 AZN loan in order to be able to supply water to his garden weekly. This will increase productivity again, and the family’s income will rise.

loans.use: to supply water to his garden weekly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, chickens, vegetables, tomatoes,  etc.

loans.name: Gabino

texts.en: Gabrino is 60 years old, lives with his wife and has a 13-year-old daughter. He has worked all his life in either retail or product transportation. He is asking for a loan to make some necessary repairs to his bus. This is important to him because it is his main source of income. His biggest accomplishment is providing financial stability to his family and making some improvements to his home. Gabino says he only asks for small loans that he knows he will be able to pay on time.

loans.use: To repair his public transport bus.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy construction materials like blocks, cement, and windows, and pay workers to help with a home construction project.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is from Vinogradovo in Ukraine. She is married with 2 sons – 12 and 28 years old. Both of her sons have congenital problems with their eyes. 

Mariya grows tomatoes, cucumbers, and cabbage in her greenhouses. She owns 50 ares of land and 5 very solid greenhouses. 

Mariya is planning to invest 15,000 UAH in the purchase of plastic film for the greenhouses, and wood and seeds for the next farming season. 

In the near future, Mariya is hoping to not only construct one more greenhouse. But, since her younger son currently has only 30% vision, Mariya is also hoping to afford the medical expenses related to his upcoming eye surgery.

loans.use: to purchase plastic film for her greenhouses, and wood and seeds for the next farming season.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.pt:
O SR. Carlos de 36 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos dos quais 2 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primaria 2 sao menor de idade para frequentar a escola sustenta sua mae. Ele è chefe geral da machamba  na empresa de producao de banana a mais de 5 anos.
O presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar materia de construcao (blocos, cimento, janela e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a sua casa.
texts.en:
Carlos is 36 years old and is married with four children, two of whom are in elementary school and two of whom are too young to be in school yet. In addition to his family, he helps to support his mother financially. For more than three years he has worked as a manager of small farms for a commercial banana supplier.

Carlos will use this loan to buy construction materials like blocks, cement, and windows, and pay workers to help with the building of his house.

loans.use: buy construction materials like blocks, cement, and windows, and pay workers to help with the building of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, jams of different flavors, molds, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer emprendedora de 49 años de edad, madre de dos hijos convive con su compañero sentimental en unión libre. 

Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado en diferentes talleres de confecciones como operaria de máquina, razón por la cual posee experiencia y conocimientos en el manejo de este tipo de negocios; pero, ya cansada de trabajar en otros talleres y con el ánimo de pasar más tiempo con su familia, decidió emprender su propio taller de confección, para lo cual se anima a solicitar el crédito que será invertido en la compra de una maquina fileteadora, recubridora e insumos de confección como tela e hilos. 

Esto le permitirá poner en marcha su proyecto productivo con el que espera generar un buen impacto en el sector para que le genere una rentabilidad favorable y así lograr cumplir el sueño de posicionarse en el mercado y, con su empuje y ambición se proyecta en un futuro a mediano plazo generando empleo.
texts.en:
Rosa is an enterprising 49-year-old mother of two, and she lives with her partner.
Throughout her life, she's worked in various garment workshops as a machine operator, so she has experience and knowledge in managing this type of business; however, she is tired of working for others and she wants to spend more time with her family, so she decided to start her own clothing business, and she feels ready to ask for a loan to buy a serger machine and supplies such as fabric and thread.
This will allow her to launch a production project that is expected to generate a good impact on this sector that would generate a great return and to help her fulfill her dream of position herself in this market. With her drive and ambition she can see a future in which she can start hiring her own employees.

loans.use: to buy a serger machine and supplies such as fabric and thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fit out his tailoring business in order to offer a better service to his clients.

loans.name: Mercedes Dolores

texts.es: Mercedes de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de obras artesanales como las que muestra en la fotografía desde hace 4 años, se ha hecho de mucha clientela por la calidad de su trabajo, ella esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar arcilla, pintura y barniz, y asi poder continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Mercedes is 52. She owns her home and lives with her family. She makes and sells crafts, like those shown in the picture and she's done so for 4 years.
