She has several customers thanks to the quality of her work and she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy clay, paint and varnish, and so continue with her work and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy clay, paint and varnish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is a 34-year-old mother of two school-age children. Her husband is a migrant worker in a neighboring country where he performs construction work. To be able to sustain her children's living, Lusine has been involved in farming for many years. She specializes in breeding livestock, specifically cows, calves and hens. Lusine takes care of the house and farm with great pleasure and care. She asks for this loan to be able to purchase forage for feeding the livestock (400 packages of grass) to be prepared for the coming breeding season. 

Lusine has taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately was not able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work in recent times, she has been able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. Therefore, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase forage for feeding livestock (400 packages of grass)

loans.name: Zoodo De Bingo Group

texts.fr:
Mr TASSERE est responsable du groupe ZOODO DE BINGO. Marié, il est père de 07enfants. Le plus âgé a 26ans et le moins 05ans. 02vont à l’école.
Mr fait l’élevage et la couture  depuis plus de 40ans. Il s’approvisionne au marché de Kokologho.
Il veut s’acheter 1/12 de rouleaux de tissus et 04 rouleaux de fils.
Avec ses b bénéfices, il veut améliorer l’élevage. Mr ambitionne devenir un grand éleveur et un grand couturier.
texts.en:
Mr. Tassere is responsible for the Zoodo de Bingo group. He is married and the father of seven children between the ages of five and 26. Two of them go to school. 

Mr. Tassere has been working in livestock livestock farming and sewing for 40 years. He buys his supplies in the Kokologho market. He would like to buy 1/12 roll of fabric and four spools of thread. 

With his earnings, he would like to improve his livestrock farming. He would like to become a successful farmer and fashion designer.

loans.use: buy 1/12 roll of fabric and four spools of thread.

loans.name: Los Perseverantes Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS PERSEVERANTES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Jessica, la socia tiene 34 años de edad y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de intenet, la socia cuenta con sus cabinas de internet, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para arregla una de las maquinas.
Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de pasamanería, hospedaje, fotocopiadoras, cabinas de internet, cerrajero, restaurante, panadería.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo y salud.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank “LOS PERSEVERANTES”. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in Cusco province, in the department of Cusco.

Member Sra. Jessica is 34 years old, and has 2 children. She alternates between her daily activities and her internet cafe business, as she has internet booths. Jessica has run this business for a long while, and it is going well for her thanks to the determination she puts into it every day. Jessica wishes to continue working in order to support her family. Jessica is asking for this loan in order to repair one of the computers.

The other members of the communal bank earn their living in a variety of ways, including selling accessories, providing lodging, running photocopy shops, internet cafes, restaurants, and bakeries, and locksmiths.

The members who appear in the insets asked permission to arrive late to the meeting due to their work and health.

The person who appears with their face redacted does not belong to the communal bank.

Jessica is grateful to those who are involved in this dream through this medium and she is committed to making her repayments on schedule.

loans.use: to repair one of their computers.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika es una joven que a su corta edad ya está preocupada y lucha incansablemente para poder brindarle todo lo mejor a su familia porque es la mayor motivación que tiene en la vida y porque quiere mejorar su calidad de vida. Está estudiando con mucho esfuerzo la carrera de economía y también tiene un trabajo como Analista en una entidad Financiera. ella es una joven muy alegre y soñadora, le gusta leer y en ocasiones prepara un delicioso estofado para compartirlo con su familia.
Erika está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá asumir algunos gastos de su casa como el pago de algunos servicios y comprar enseres para amoblar su vivienda, con esto ella continuará luchando para saca adelante a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Erika is a young woman who, at her young age, is already concerned and strives tirelessly to be able to provide all the best for her family.  She does this because it is the greatest motivation that she has in her life and because she wants to improve their quality of life. She is putting forth a lot of effort to study for her economics degree and also has a job as an analyst at a financial organization. She is a very cheerful and visionary young woman, she likes to read, and sometimes she prepares a delicious stew to share with her family.

Erika is grateful for the Kiva lenders because with the support that they have provided her, she can cover some of her household expenses, such as paying for some services and purchasing necessities to furnish her home.  With this, she will continue fighting for her loved ones to move ahead.

loans.use: to purchase some necessities for her house

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren decided to invest in a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to take advantage of his animals' manure to become more self-sufficient in his supply of energy and fertilizer, while saving money and protecting the environment. He owns cows, horses and sheep. By inputting their waste in the biodigester, the natural methanisation process and bacteria will transform it into biogas to cook and heat water, as well as a nutrient-rich organic fertilizer. Efren will be able to displace the expensive LP gas (propane) he currently depends on, and will improve the yield of his crops in a natural way, allowing him to sell more corn of higher quality on the local market. 

With the savings he will make with the biodigester, he wants to buy more cows and expand the plot of land where he currently grows crops. In the medium term, he plans to use this additional money to pay for his children in order to keep them in school. She This loan represents 16% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, soft drinks, sweets, grains, sugar, and other products that sell quickly

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en: Hannatu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hannatu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Barnabas, Mercy and Patric.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hannatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, in order to meet her immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hannatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Hannatu  spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure other members of her community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To access a loan to meet expenses like child school fees and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel started Affordable Health Solutions in Oct. 2014, providing insurance-policy-advising services and helping clients navigate their different insurance options. Originally from New York, he, his wife, and two children now live in Florida. During last year’s U.S. enrollment period (mid-November through mid-February), he worked with 250 customers to select the right insurance.

For this upcoming enrollment period, Daniel needs a new computer and other home office equipment. This will help him to market to and re-enroll his current client base. His goal is to further build and strengthen the business during this enrollment period and says, “Personally, it will give me the opportunity to be around my family more than I would otherwise.”

loans.use: to purchase home office equipment to increase efficiency of client enrollment.

loans.name: Apu Phuycuclla Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal APU PHUYCUCLLA, el banco está ubicado en la comunidad Kiscay, distrito de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Josefina tiene 52 años de edad y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia siembra papa entre otros, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono y semillas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales menores.
El socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Josefina belongs to the APU PHUYCUCLLA communal bank, which is located in the community of Kiscay, in the district of Paucartambo, department of Cusco.

Josefina is 52 years old and is married. She alternates her daily activities with agriculture. She has grown potatoes and other crops for years and does well thanks to the effort she puts every day into her business. She wishes to be able to continue working to support her family. 

Josefina is requesting the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. She feels thankful for this loan and promises to pay on time. 

The other members work in agriculture and raising small animals. The member who appears in the other photo was late to the meeting because of work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for advertising in neighboring areas and for updated equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her home (to finish building a porch).

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is married and she has one child.  Her husband is a driver. She is applying for a loan of $1,000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop selling secondhand clothes in the market. Julieta has been involved in business activities since a year ago, when she started with her own working capital of $200.00. She is earning a good income from selling secondhand clothes because many people like to buy them, as they are cheap and unique, compared to new clothes. She is happy with her business. She also has animals like pigs and chickens.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shorts, shirts, skirts, kids clothing and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hatun Rumiyoc Group

texts.es:
La socia Victoria pertenece al banco comunal HATUN RUMIYOC, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Melina tiene 58 años de edad es soltera y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna su actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cosméticos como cremas, pefumes, colonias entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia vende a sus amistades, entre otros, la socia a la vez es administradora de un hospedaje, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de colonias para damas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de artesanía,produccion de zapatos, periodista, contadora, elaboración de tortas.
texts.en:
Melina is a member of the communal bank Hatun Rumiyoc. The bank is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Bank member Melina is 58 years old. She is single and has 2 children. She divide her time between her daily activities and her business of selling cosmetics such as creams, perfumes, and colognes, among other items. She has had her business for quite some time. It is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She sells to her friends, among others. At the same time, she is the administrator of a hostel. She wants to be able to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family.

She is applying for a loan to purchase colognes for women. She feels grateful for the loan granted and promises to make the scheduled payments.

The members shown in the appended photos asked permission to arrive at the meeting late because of work reasons.

The other members sell handicrafts, produce shoes, work in journalism, work as an accountant, and make cakes.

loans.use: to buy women's colognes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make a drain and connect sewage pipes improving the quality of living of the family, sanitation in the house being very important.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her certificate, title and certificate course for a bachelor of accounting degree and to look for better work opportunities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her pastureland and guarantee food for her cattle in the summertime.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a sump to make the toilet she has installed that had no sewage outlet usable.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 46 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Gemma is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. Gemma has been in pig fattening for 20 years and also earns additional income from a general store.



She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Janilyn

texts.en: Janilyn is 30 years old and married with three children, for whom she works hard to provide.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.  These include bread, noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, and candies.  Janilyn has been in this business for three years.  Janilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bread, noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, and candies.

loans.name: Anadelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Anadelia works hard to support her family. She sells ready-to-wear products in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling charcoal. Anadelia is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock. This includes shorts, shirts and sandals for her ready-to-wear business.

Anadelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase shorts, shirts, and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of used American clothing for children and adults and buy more jewellery to sell more  and benefit her family.

loans.name: Junjie

texts.en:
Junjie is 26 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Junjie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Junjie has been raising pigs for two years and also earns income from abaca weaving. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is 71 years old and has six children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Brigida is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Brigida has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Brigida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines,  feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maurita

texts.en:
Maurita is 49 years old and married with eight children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed.

Maurita has been pig fattening for seven years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de 32 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos de 14 y 9 años y una hija de 3 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida rápida.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, trabajadora, buena madre y responsable, su negorio lo realiza en la zona ‘El Tejar’ caracterizado por el comercio informal en todas las áreas, ciento de vendedores se sitúan lado a lado para ofertar, carne, ropa, verduras, comida, etc., de clima frio y seco.
Sonia es de tez morena estatura mediana, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua nativa es el aymara y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la realiza junto a su esposo que se dedica al comercio de pollo, y sus hijos los mayores están en edad escolar y estudian, viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad, no cuenta con alcantarillado por la zona recién se está urbanizando. Su negocio es la venta de comida como; pollo frito y pollo al espiedo (cocinado en horno). Ella alquila un pequeño cuarto que utiliza como cocina y restaurante, sus clientes son constantes y su negocio es prospero. Su sueño es comprar la casa donde tiene su negocio porque ya es conocido, y desea realizar la ampliación de su negocio realizando la compra de un kiosko para la venta de salchipapas (papas fritas y salchichas cortadas en rodajas). Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en seis años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Sonia solicita un préstamo para la compra de un kiosko para la venta de salchipapas y ampliar su negocio de comida.
texts.en:
Sonia is a 32-year-old woman. She is married and has two sons, who are 14 and 9, and a 3 year-old daughter. Sonia sells fast food. She is an entrepreneurial, independent, hardworking woman. She is also a good and responsible mother.

She runs her business in the neighborhood of El Tejar, which is known for informal commerce of all kinds. There are hundreds of vendors lined up side-by-side to offer meat, vegetables and other food; and things like clothing. These vendors sell in good weather or bad.

Sonia has a dark complexion and is of average height. She has long dark hair which she braids, and she wears traditional clothing (a hat, shawl and sweater). Her native language is Aymara, but she speaks Spanish for business. 

She is going through life along with her husband, who sells chickens. Their older children are school-aged and are studying. They live together in a rented house which has electricity and drinkable water, though they still do not have a sewage system because their area was only recently urbanized.

Sonia sells food such as fried chicken and "pollo al espiedo" (oven-cooked chicken). She currently rents a small room which she uses both as kitchen and restaurant. She always has customers and so her business is prosperous. Sonia's dream is to purchase the house where she has her business, because the location is known. She also wants to grow her business by purchasing a food stall from which she will sell "salchipapas" (french fries and sausages cut up in slices). 

This is the first loan cycle that this bank has had for this type of business in 6 years. For this reason, Sonia requests a loan to purchase the food stall in order to sell salchipapas and grow her food business.

loans.use: to purchase a food stall.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. She is married and does business buying and selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 110,00 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for 25 years now. She would like to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 22 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Analiza has been fattening pigs for six years now, and has borrowed from NWTF six times in the past to sustain her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en:
Tahmina is 46-year-old widow, and she has a son. She lives in her mother’s home and has run a local grocery store for more than 26 years. At her store, she sells different grocery products. She is the only breadwinner in the family. Her mother and son help her to organize her business, but her monthly income is very low. It doesn’t cover the family’s needs.

To keep her small business functioning in a sustainable way, Tahmina needs to make some investments. A loan of 1,000 AZN will be a huge help to this hard-working woman and her family, and will enable her to purchase more grocery products to resell in her store. Tahmina relies on the goodwill of lenders, and she is thankful to them for supporting her in sustaining and developing her small business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 56 years old and married with two children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Alicia has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.en:
Maria Carmen manages her farm, where she lives surrounded by her family. She decided to invest in her Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to generate savings by displacing the wood and expensive LP gas she used to buy, as well as to protect the environment and improve her and her family's health. Prior to owning the biodigester, she cooked and heated water with wood, resulting in the exposure of her family to harmful smoke, which she was inhaling while cooking.

From now on, the waste of her cows, hogs and poultry will allow her to produce her own biogas, resulting in a smoke-free kitchen and water heated through this renewable energy. The natural bacteria within the biodigester also generates an organic, nutrient-rich fertilizer, which will help Maria Carmen to increase the yield of the corn she is cultivating in her fields, as well as the vegetables she grows in her garden. Maria Carmen's overall quality of life will improve and she plans to use her savings to buy more hogs and expand her farm.

This loan represents 16% of the total cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 60 years old and separated with three children. With one child still in school, Carmen works very hard to provide for them.

Carmen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Carmen has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, bread, cereals, soft drinks, etc.

In the future, Carmen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Om Abdullah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om Abdullah. It consists of four women from Mokala city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Afrah is the leader of the group. She is a 49-year-old married woman with eight children, living with her family in a very old house. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family and he works as a fisher with a limited income. The house where Afrah and her family live is very old and needs to have some of its doors changed and to make flagstones for the floor of most of the rooms. Afrah decided to make the necessary renovations for the house and she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase some new doors and flagstones for most rooms of the house.

Afrah hopes to renovate all her house in order for it to be suitable for living.

loans.use: to purchase some new doors and flagstones for most rooms of the house.

loans.name: Neisi

texts.es:
Neisi es una mujer de 59 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 18 años y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de empanadas tradicionales.
Ella es fuerte, emprendedora, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’, caracterizado por el crecimiento gigante de su población; emigrantes de tribus del lugar como los ‘Ayoreos’ y mineros relocalizados del occidente del país, de clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura ambiente de aproximadamente 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Neisi es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello gris largo trenzado, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español. Su vida la realiza con su hijo que se encuentra en último año de la escuela y piensa continuar sus estudios, viven en una casa propia (de herencia familiar) de ladrillo y cuentan con agua potable y luz eléctrica. Su negocio es la venta ambulante de empanadas; que es una fina masa de pan, masa quebrada u hojaldre rellena con una preparación salada o dulce y cocida al horno. La masa, generalmente, es de harina de trigo –aunque también puede usarse harina de maíz u otros cereales– sus horneados generalmente son: cuñapé (pan de queso), el sonso (yuca molida y queso), el pan de arroz (a base de harina de arroz) y la empanada de trigo. Su sueño es tener un negocio fijo para ya no tener que ambular, ella desea realizar la compra de diferentes tipos de harina (arroz, trigo, blanca, etc.) por mayor para estar abastecida y que no le falte en las fiestas de fin de año, que son las fechas donde las compras por mayor escasean y los productos de todas las áreas suben de precio. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en dos años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Neisi solicita un préstamo para la compra de diferentes tipos de harina por mayor para vender empanadas a fin de año.
texts.en:
Neisi is a 59-year-old woman. She is single and has one son who is 18 years old. Neisi prepares and sells traditional empanadas. She is strong, entrepreneurial, persevering, responsible and hardworking. She runs her business in the "plan 3000" neighborhood which is characterized by the huge expansion of its population, many of whom are emigrants from outlying areas such as the Ayores area; as well as miners who relocated from the western part of the country. Their area is tropical with a warm and humid climate. The average temperatures are around 30 degrees Celsius all year long. 

Neisi has a dark complexion and is short with long gray hair which she braids. Her native language is Guaraní and she also speaks Spanish.

She lives her life with her son, who is currently in the last year of school and hoping to continue his studies. They live in their own home which is built of brick and which she inherited from her family. They have drinkable water and electricity.

Neisi runs her business on foot, selling empanadas. She makes them with a fine bread dough as well as pastry dough which she turns into puff pastry and fills with a sweet or savory mixture and cooks in the oven. She usually uses wheat flour, though sometimes she uses corn or other grains. In addition to the empanadas, her baked goods include "cuñape" (cheesy bread), "sonso" (ground yucca with cheese), and rice bread (which is made with rice flour). 

Neisi's dream is to run her business out of a fixed location so that she doesn't have to work by foot anymore. She also hopes to purchase a variety of flours (rice, wheat, white, etc.) to be better-stocked so that she doesn't run out during the end-of-year celebrations. The end of the year is the time when it becomes most difficult for her to buy in bulk and when all the prices go up.

This is the first loan of this type that Emprender has seen in 2 years, and for this reason Neisi requests a loan to purchase a variety of flour in bulk so that she can sell empanadas at the end of the year.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of flours in bulk.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 27 years old and married with one child who is in school. Diana works very hard to provide for them.

Diana runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Diana has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Diana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like threads, fabrics, needles, etc. for her tailoring business.

Ginalyn has been in this business for 10 years. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like threads, fabrics, needles, etc. for her tailoring

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 53, is a farmer who owns a tranquil, rustic homestead in Chuka, Kenya. She lives with her husband. They have been practicing mixed farming for the last 30 years. Their five children pay a visit from time to time, and offer assistance on the farm when needed. Her primary income sources are eggs and milk produced on the farm. She sells these at a local market. 

A while ago, Mary joined a self-help group named Njeruni comprised of mostly marginalized female farmers. All the members of this group were in search of new ways to generate income. Kiva Field Partner Juhudi Kilimo motivated them to secure a loan and have the members guarantee each other. After being successfully registered, they went through a training of basic financial and business skills. 

Mary is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase pigs. She is looking to diversify into other farming activities. She is always cautious when approaching new business opportunities. The fact that she spends most of her time at the farm makes her confident that she can take good care of the pigs. With the loan, she will be able to sell pork, which has a ready market in the Chuka area and also in the neighboring towns. Income generated from this investment will be enough to meet her farm's expenses. She says her family will also get to enjoy all of the benefits that come along with increased income.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Biakoye Group

texts.en:
These seven members of the Biakoye Group are on average, 41 years old with three children. They all live in Teshie-Accra and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities. Group members are retail traders of kids slippers, napkins, cosmetics, wigs, towels, hair products, tea, bread, eggs, perfumes, bags, blouses, skirts,  gari (cassava flour), maize and vegetables. 

In order to increase their operating capital, the group decided to work with ID Ghana. They are on their third group loan cycle with ID Ghana. Hannah (the woman standing second from left in the photo) sells kid slippers, napkins and cosmetics. She intends to use her loan to buy these items in Accra, and sell them to her customers. She is married with four dependent children, and hopes to attain a good profit with this loan, to be reinvested in the business, and also to support her husband to take care of their children

loans.use: to buy kid slippers, napkins, and cosmetics to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cow and feed her livestock

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed is a 32-year-old single lady who has been selling beauty accessories and cosmetics since June 2013. She has four years of experience in this domain working with her brother and sister.

Taghreed's business is going fine, but she needs some external financial support to increase her capital. This is her third loan from Kiva Field Partner Al Majmoua to increase the merchandise in her store with special items for the coming Christmas season. Her previous loans had a very good impact on her business development, and she proved to be a responsible borrower.

She hopes that she can buy her own shop in the future and save the rent fees paid monthly.

loans.use: to expand her inventory with special items for the Christmas season

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
A married parent of six children, Zita works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns income from pig fattening.

Zita is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Zita has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business

loans.name: Marrieta

texts.en:
Marrieta is 36 years old and married with two children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, noodles, etc.

Marrieta has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from gasoline retailing.

Marrieta aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, noodles, etc

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita works hard to support her family. Clarita is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Clarita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Clarita has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Clarita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman with six children. She is 49 years old and has one child currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elvira does business selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Elvira has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es una mujer de 32 años de edad, casada, tiene tres hijos de 14, 10 y 2 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos. 
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, responsable, buena madre y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Mutualista’ ubicada en pleno centro de la ciudad caracterizada por la cantidad de oficinas que abarcan todos los rubros, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura ambiente que ronda los 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Maribel es de tez morena, cabello negro corto crespo, estatura mediana, complexión física robusta, su lengua nativa es el español y habla guaraní por herencia familiar. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como empleado público y sus tres hijos; los dos mayores en edad escolar. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de marcas como; Mac, Chanel, Burberry, Dolce & Gabbana, Dior y proximamente Gucci y productos como; MASCARAS, BASES, CORRECTOR, POLVOS/BLUSH, BRILLOS, SHINE SENSATIONAL, LAPICES, SOMBRAS, TONOS, SOMBRAS,  1/2 TONOS, PLUMONES, PERMANENTES, BRILLOS REVLON, LABIALES ROJOS, LABIALES (OTROS TONOS), BRILLOS SUPER STAY REVLON, etc. anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la venta de pan, actividad que dejó de realizar, actualmente se dedica a la venta de cosméticos a tiempo completo; ella recorre toda la zona, ingresando a las distintas oficinas y ofertando a nuevos clientes y vendiendo/cobrando a antiguos clientes. Su labor la realiza todos los días de la semana; durante los días hábiles realiza visitas en el centro de la ciudad, los fines de semana tiene clientes en ferias dominicales en diferentes lugares. Su sueño es establecerse en su zona de trabajo como vendedora mayorista, y desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de cosméticos por mayor, porque las ventas a fin de año aumentan y no quiere perderlas por el bienestar de su familia. Esta es su tercera secuencia de préstamos con la institución y lleva un año de experiencia realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maribel solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos de belleza por mayor para aprovechar las ventas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Maribel is a 32 year old woman. She is married and she has three children who are 14, 10 and 2 years old. She has a business selling cosmetics. Maribel is an independent. responsible entrepreneur and a good mother and hard worker. Her business is located in the 'Mutual' area located in the center of the city which is characterized by the quantity of offices that cover all of the area, and a hot and tropical climate with an outdoor temperature around 30 degrees centigrade throughout the year. 

Maribel has a brown complexion and short black curly hair. She is a medium height with a robust physique and her native language is spanish. She also speaks guaraní because of her family heritage. She shares her life with her husband, who works as a public employee, and her three children, the older two of whom are of school age. She has a business selling branded cosmetics including: Mac, Chanel, Burberry, Dolce & Gabbana and soon Gucci. She sells products including: mascaras, foundations, correctors, blush, glitters, pencils, eye shadows, toners, pens, permanent dies, red lipsticks and other lipsticks and Revlon products, etc. 

Previously Maribel worked selling bread, an activity that she no longer does. Today she works selling cosmetics full time. She covers all of the area, entering the different offices and offering items to new clients and selling to existing clients. She does this work every day of the week. During weekdays she visits the center of the city and during the weekend she meets clients at weekend markets in different places. Her dream is to establish herself as the best vendor in the area where she works and she wants to grown her business by making the purchase of wholesale cosmetics because the sales increase at the end of the year and she does not want to lose any for the sake of the well being of her family. This is her third round of loans with this institution and she has a year of experience performing this activity. It is because of these motivations that Maribel is seeking a loan to purchase wholesale beauty products to take advantage of the sales at the end of the year.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale beauty products to take advantage of the sales at the end of the year.

loans.name: Cecilia Marysol

texts.es:
Cecilia es una mujer de 36 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 niños, y su negocio es la peluquería.
ella es emprendedora, independiente, responsable, buena madre y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘villa Fátima’ sitio caracterizado por las paradas de transporte público a diferentes localidades del norte de la paz.
Cecilia es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño largo, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español. su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica al transporte público y sus tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuanta con agua y electricidad. Su negocio es la peluquería actividad que viene realizando desde que era adolescente. Comenzó arreglando las uñas de sus clientes como manicure y pedicura,  poco a poco fue aprendiendo sobre la técnica y accedió a cursos de peluquería para profesionalizarse. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y ser reconocido por el buen servicio, ella desea realizar la remodelación de su lugar de trabajo realizando la compra de maniquíes para colocar pelucas, cuadros y material de trabajo (tintes, tijeras, ruleros, secadoras, etc.) por mayor. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 16 años que viene realizando esta labor.
Es por esos motivos que Cecilia solicita un préstamo para la ampliación de su peluquería y la compra de material de trabajo por mayor.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a 36-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and has three children. Her business is a hair salon. She is entrepreneurial, independent, responsible, hard working, and a good mother. She runs her business in the "Villa Fátima" area, a site characterized by bus stops for public transportation headed to different locations to the north of La Paz. 

Cecilia has olive skin, long dark hair, and medium stature. Her mother tongue is Aymara; she also speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her partner, who works in public transportation, and her three school-aged children. They live in a rented house built of bricks that has water and electricity. 

Her business is hair styling, which she has done since she was a teenager. She started doing her clients' nails, both manicures and pedicures. Little by little, she learned about technique and was admitted to hairstyling courses to become a professional. 

Her dream is to expand her business and be known for her good service. She would like to remodel her place of work by purchasing mannequins for wigs, decor, and wholesale work supplies (dyes, scissors, rollers, dryers, etc.). This is her second loan with the institution in the 16 years that she has been doing this work.

This is why Cecilia is requesting a loan to expand her hair salon and purchase work supplies at wholesale.

loans.use: to expand her hair salon and buy work supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 54 years old and married with two children. 

Editha is in the agricultural business by pig fattening in the Philippines. Editha requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Editha has been pig fattening for three years now.  She has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Editha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 49 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nora has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 46 years old and has one child who is currently in school. Helen has a fish and shell vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish and shells to sell. Helen has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and shells to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is the mother of one lovely child and is a very hard-working woman. She is based in Biribiriet, a remote village in the Eldoret highlands, an area with fertile soil famous for dairy farming. The region's staple food is “Mursik,” a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from milk. Jane has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. Selling eggs and milk has earned her a decent income. She also engages in another business to make ends meet. 

Jane passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early riser and wakes up every morning to milk her cow. While this humble mom has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. 

Jane is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. With this loan, she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This will help fully satisfy the demand. Through Kiva Field Partner Juhudi Kilimo, she attended training sessions and was taught financial management skills. This will help her save more money, repay the loan fully, and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy another quality dairy cow

loans.name: Sirvard

texts.en:
Sirvard is from Saramej village in the Lori region. She lives with her husband and son. Sirvard, with the help of her husband, is breeding livestock including cows, calves and hens. They are also cultivating wheat, potatoes and cabbage. Livestock breeding and plant cultivation are very important sources of income for the family. To be able to continue, Sirvard needs a loan of USD 2,000 to purchase two tires for the combine, two oxen, and forage for feeding the livestock. 

Sirvard has taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, she has been able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Sirvard and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for two tires for the combine, two oxen, and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is 35 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Juvelyn has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Juvelyn has been pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Juvelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Jennifer has been in this business for seven years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 51 years old and married with three children. Elsa works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries like shampoo, biscuits, coffee, snack foods, canned goods, beers, etc. to sell.

Elsa has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as those listed above, to her customers. 

Elsa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Locilyn

texts.en:
Locilyn is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Locilyn is 44 years old and has four children who are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Locilyn has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing net.

Locilyn has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Locilyn would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing net.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has an oyster culture business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like bamboo, plastic wires, etc.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 25 years now. She would like to save enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like bamboo, plastic wires, etc.

loans.name: Rodita

texts.en:
Rodita is 60 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of household goods like sugar, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc.

Rodita has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from oyster culture. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of household goods like sugar, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es:
Carlos de 68 años de edad, no estudió, esta casado. Su pareja trabaja los oficios domésticos, tiene 4 hijos los cuales no viven en casa porque tienen sus propios hogares. 

Carlos trabaja con ganado de repasto (bovino) lo ha hecho por mas de 40 años, lo aprendió de sus padres y decidió dedicarse a este trabajo para buscar un ingreso económico extra para su familia. También trabaja la agricultura y cultiva café, la distancia donde tiene las plantaciones de café está como a 3 km y viaja a pie y su horario es de 5:00 am a 12:00 md. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar ganado de repasto, le mejorará mucho porque le generará ingresos económicos que le permitirán tener mejor calidad de vida.

 Sus sueños son seguir trabajando lo mejor que se pueda para prepararse para su vejez, el préstamo le ayudará porque tiene la oportunidad de seguir trabajando sin tener limitantes y con las ganancias ir pagando el préstamo y así responderle de la mejor manera a Credicampo.
texts.en:
Carlos, who is 68 years old, did not go to school. He is married. His wife does the domestic work. He has four children who don't live in his home because they have their own households.

Carlos works with pastured livestock (cattle). He has done this for more than 40 years. He learned it from his parents and decided to do this work in order to seek extra economic income for his family. He also works in agriculture and raises coffee. The distance to his coffee plantation is about 3 kilometers, and he goes there on foot. He schedule is from 5:00 am to 12:00 noon.

The loan that he is applying for is to buy livestock to pasture. It will help him a lot because it will generate economic income for him that will allow him to have a better quality of life.

His dreams are to continue working the best that he can to prepare for his old age. The loan will help him because he has the opportunity to continue working without having limitations, and with the earnings, he will continue paying back the loan and respond to CrediCampo in the best way possible.

loans.use: to buy livestock to pasture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a septic system in her house.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Imelda is 45 years old.

Imelda has a sewing business in the Philippines. Imelda requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials to use in her sewing business.

Imelda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials to use in her sewing business.

loans.name: Pedro De Jesús

texts.es:
Pedro de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta 2° grado de educación básica, está soltero y no tiene hijos. Él vive con la mamá y un sobrino, el sobrino estudia. 

Pedro tiene un taller de carpintería por mas de 12 años y lo aprendió siendo empleado en un taller por más de 8 años y decidió independizarse para tener mejores ingresos económicos. La distancia esta como a 3 cuadras de su casa y viaja a pie, nadie de su familia se involucra y su horario es de 6:00 am a 4:00 pm. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar madera, barnis, clavos, taladro, pulidora, para la carpintería. Con el préstamo le mejorará mucho su negocio, porque tendrá material para poder fabricar diferentes muebles y así ofrecerles a sus clientes y también le generará mayor ganancia.

 Sus sueños son seguir trabajando para ofrecer a sus clientes y no clientes diferentes productos.
texts.en:
Pedro is 46 years old and studied to the 2nd grade in basic education. He is single and has no children. He lives with his mother and a nephew who is still studying.

Pedro has had a carpentry shop for more than 12 years. He learned the trade as an employee of another shop for over 8 years and decided to become independent in order to have a better income. Pedro's shop is some 3 blocks from his house and he travels on foot. No one else from his family works in the shop and his hours are from 6:00 am until 4:00 pm.

The loan Pedro requests is for purchasing wood, varnish, nails, a drill, and a buffer for his carpentry shop. With this loan he will greatly enhance his business; he will have the materials to be able to fabricate different pieces of furniture and, thus, offer them to his customers and, also, to generate greater earnings.

Pedro's dreams are to continue working and to offer different products to his customers and non-customers alike.

loans.use: to buy wood, varnish, nails, a drill, and a buffer for his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es:
El Sr. José Dolores es una persona humilde, trabajador, tiene la edad de 51 años, casado, tres hijas mujeres, la mayor estudia en la Universidad, la siguiente en secundaria y la menor el próximo año entra a la primaria, con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzos le ha brindado lo mejor a su familia sobre todo la preparación a sus hijas; anteriormente don José Dolores trabajaba para una Micro financiera y con la Liquidación pudo establecer una pequeña Farmacia que está a cargo de su esposa, las ganancias son invertidas en la misma farmacia y así ir ampliándola poco a poco.   Actualmente Don José labora para una empresa del Estado el Magfor como Administrador III en Chontales, y en tiempos libres por las noches y sabatino imparte clases a jóvenes Universitarios de la UPONIC, así se esfuerza para que a su familia no les falte lo básico en el  hogar.
Don José Dolores desde que ha tenido sus trabajos ha invertido también en su vivienda y cuenta con su casa muy bonita, con su porche, cocina, sala, no así con su servicio higiénico dentro de la vivienda, en la actualidad usa letrina.  Su propósito con este  crédito es construir el Sumidero e instalar su inodoro en la parte interna de su vivienda, con esta mejora su familia gozara de mayor higiene y privacidad en su hogar.

Su próximo proyecto es construir cuartos en un anexo que compró para alquilarlos y mejorar su calidad de vida sobre todo estas ganancias las piensa invertir en los gasto universitarios de sus hijas menores.
texts.en:
Jose Dolores is a humble and hardworking person. He is 51 years old, married and has three daughters. The oldest is in university, the middle one in high school and the youngest one will start elementary school next year. With a lot of sacrifice and effort, he has provided the best he can to his family, especially education. Jose Dolores used to work for a micro financing institution and with his severance payment established a small pharmacy that is managed by his wife. The profits are reinvested in the pharmacy so that it can slowly expand. 

Jose currently works for a state enterprise as an administrator in Chontales, and in his spare time in the evening and on Saturdays he teaches university students. This helps him cover his family's basic needs. 

Jose Dolores has always invested in his home and has a beautiful house with a porch, kitchen, and living room, but there is no bathroom inside the house. The family currently uses a latrine. His goal with this loan is to build a drain and install a toilet inside his house in order to provide better hygiene and privacy to his family. 

His next project is to build rooms for rent in an annex that he bought, which will improve his quality of life especially since he hopes to invest the earnings on his younger daughters' university expenses.

loans.use: to build a drain and to install a toilet and sewage pipes so his family can have better hygiene conditions.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es:
Rosa de 42 años de edad, es ama de casa y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el 5° grado, esta soltera pero tiene 2 hijos de 20 y 21 años de edad, solo uno de ellos le ayuda a Rosa a trabajar, el otro ya tiene su familia.

 Rosa posee un cafetín donde vende variedades de comidas, trabaja desde hace 10 años, oficio que lo aprendió de su madre pues ella siempre se dedico a esto, para llegar a su trabajo Rosa camina 1 kilometro, su horario es de 6:00 am a 5:00 pm. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para aumentar su negocio pues viene el tiempo de cortar caña y es cuando ella vende mas, especficamente comprara aceite, azucar, arroz, carne, pollo, verduras, lácteos, embutidos, plátanos, para elaborar la comida. Así obtendrá mas ganancias para su alimentación, el sueño de Rosa es que su negocio aumente con la ayuda de los créditos y poder tener negocio abundante y a la vez ofrecerles mas variedad a los clientes para que se sientan satisfechos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 42 years old, a housewife, and she completed a 5th grade education. She is single and has two children ages 20 and 21 years old. One of her children help Rosa with work, the other now has his own family.

Rosa owns a small snack bar where she sells a variety of food. She has had this business for 10 years. Rosa walks 1 kilometer, and works from 6:00 AM to 5:00 PM. The loan she seeks from CREDICAMPO will be used to expand her business as she is entering into a busy season when she sells more. Specifically she will buy oil, sugar, rice, meat, chicken, vegetables, dairy products, canned goods, bananas to make food. In this way she will obtain greater earnings for her food.

Rosa dreams of growing her business and with the help of the loans be able to have an abundant business and offer greater variety to her customers so that they feel satisfied.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, rice, meat, chicken, vegetables, dairy products, canned goods, bananas to make food.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina de 70 años de edad, es una mujer muy responsable y dedicada a su familia, actualmente vive solo con una hijo y su nuera, ya los otros dos hijos estan fuera del hogar. Cristina se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero actualmente quiere poner una ventecita de bocadillos típicos a la par de su casa, ya que es un lugar bien transitado y las personas se reúnen cerca. 

El dinero lo necesita para poder iniciar su ventecita, de pasteles, yuca frita, tostadas de plátano, y horchata de semilla de morro, especificamente comprara yuca, aceite, maíz, condimentos, repollo, plátanos, semilla de morro, papas, etc. con este financiamiento se le ayudara para que pueda mejorar sus ingresos.

En un futuro quiere tener una tienda, para que así las personas puedan tener donde comprar mas cerca de sus casas.
texts.en:
Cristina, age 70, is a very responsible woman who is dedicated to her family.  She currently lives alone with her son and daughter-in-law.  At this point her two other children don’t live at home.  Cristina works doing household chores, but now she wants to start selling traditional snacks from her home, because her house is in a well-travelled area and people gather nearby.

She needs money in order to be able to begin her food sales, selling cakes, fried yuca, plantain chips, morro seed horchata [a traditional drink], potatoes, etc.  This loan will help her so that she can improve her income.

In the future she wants to have a store so that people can have a place to shop that is closer to their homes.

loans.use: to buy yuca, oil, corn, seasonings, cabbage, plantains, morro seeds, potatoes, etc., in order to prepare traditional foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chickens to raise, since the December season, when she sells more, is coming.

loans.name: Bedenico

texts.pt:
O SR. Bedenico de 39 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primaria 1 e menor de idade para frequentar a escola. Ele è tractorista  na empresa de producao de banana a mais de 5 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar materia de construcao (blocos, cimento, janela e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a sua casa.
texts.en:
Bedenico is 39 years old and is married with 3 children, two of whom are in elementary school and one who is too young to be in school yet. For more than five years he has worked as a tractor driver for a commercial banana farm. 

Bedenico will use this loan to buy construction materials like blocks, cement, and windows, and pay workers to help with the building of his house.

loans.use: buy construction materials like blocks, cement, and windows, and pay workers to help with the building of his house.

loans.name: Jona Fe

texts.en:
Jona Fe is a 42-year-old married mother of one child, who is in school. She has operated a pig-fattening business in the Philippines for eight years now.

Having borrowed four times in the past to sustain her business, Jona Fe has requested a new loan of PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gerson Moises

texts.es:
Gerson es un joven muy trabajador de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta el 3° grado, no continuo sus estudios porque decidió acompañarse y junto con su compañera de vida tienen 1 hijo de 9 meses de edad, Gerson vive con su esposa, su hijo y sus padres pero de él dependen solo su hijo y su compañera de vida, ella se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuido de su bebe, mientras que Gerson trabaja como lanchero, también trabaja en los ratos libres como pescador artesanal, oficio que aprendió desde que era un niño y lo aprendió de su padre quien siempre se ha dedicado a esto, para llegar a su trabajo Gerson viaja en bicicleta 5 kilómetros, su horario es de 8:00 am a 4:00 pm. 

El crédito que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar 1 vaca lechera, en donde espera tener una bonita ganancia para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Con esto dara inicio al cuido de vacas lecheras y conseguir una entrada de dinero más.

El sueño de Gerson es tener varias vacas lecheras, para poder ahorrar mucho para cuando su hijo empiece a estudiar darle todo lo necesario y para poder pagar el crédito adquirido sin ninguna inconveniente.
texts.en:
Gerson is a hard-working 20 year old man. He completed a 3rd grade education and didn't finish his education as he decided to marry. With his wife he has one son 9 months old. He lives with his wife, son and parents but only his wife and son are dependent upon him. His spouse is a housewife and takes care of the baby while Geron works as a boatman. In his free time he also works as a traditional fisherman, work he learned as a child from his father who was a fisherman. In order to arrive to work Gerson travels by bike for 5 kilometers. He works from 8:00 AM until 4:00 PM.

He seeks a loan from CREDICAMPO to buy one milk cow. He hopes to have a little income in order to be able to give his family a better quality of life. With this he will start a business with milk cows and obtain additional money.

Gerson dreams of having several milk cows, to be able to save for when his son starts school in order to give him all he needs, and to be able to pay the back without any inconvenience.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Amada Elsa

texts.es:
Amada de 59 años de edad, es una mujer muy responsable y dedicada a su trabajo, actualmente vive sola con su sobrina, ya que todos sus hijos emigraron asía los Estados Unidos.

Amada se dedica al comercio, ya que cuenta con un puesto en el mercado donde comercializa zapatos de toda marca. Sus hijos de vez en cuando le ayudan con los gastos del hogar, la señora ya cuenta con 15 años de experiencia en la venta de zapatos. Antes de dedicarse a la venta de zapatos se dedicaba a las artesanías. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar más zapatos, ya que en esta temporada de fin de año es muy buena para las ventas.

En un futuro espera crecer el negocio y tener un mejor lugar donde realice sus ventas.
texts.en:
Amada, age 59, is a very responsible woman who is really dedicated to her work.  Right now she lives alone with her niece because all of her children have emigrated to the United States.

Amada works in retail; she has a stand in the market where she sells all brands of shoes.  She has fifteen years’ experience selling shoes.  Before selling shoes she worked in handicrafts. Her children help her with the household expenses from time to time. 

The loan she is requesting is to buy more shoes, because this end-of-the-year season is very good for sales.

In the future she hopes to expand her business and have a better place to make her sales.

loans.use: to buy more shoes because this end-of-the-year season is really good for sales.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.pt:
A Sra. Hortencia de 28 anos de idade solteira e mae de 2 filhos que estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario . Ela e negociante a mais de 7 anos, vende diversos produtos da 1ª necessidade no seu estabelicimento comercial actividade que esta a explorar junto com seus filhos.
O presente emprestimo sera aplicado para compra de produtos: feijao, amendoim, caldo,refresco, farinha de milho, batata, peixe, tomate,arroz e outros para aumentar o volume do seu negocio no seu estabelicimento comercial.
texts.en:
Hortencia is 28 years old and is a single mother to two children who are in elementary school. She has worked for more than 7 years running a store with help from her children that sells a variety of basic necessities.

With this loan Hortencia would like to increase her sales volume by buying various products: beans, peanuts, broth, soft drinks, corn meal, yams, fish, tomatoes, rice and other items.

loans.use: buy various products: beans, peanuts, broth, soft drinks, corn meal, yams, fish, tomatoes, rice and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Alma needs the loan to build a bathroom, install and toilet and sewage pipes to guarantee hygiene in her home.

loans.name: Blanca Margarita De Jesus

texts.es:
Blanca es una simpática y trabajadora mujer de 62 años de edad, que por cuestiones familiares se separó de su pareja, quedando sola con tres hijos.

Blanca se desempeña como confeccionista a terceros en un negocio que tiene ubicado en su hogar y que aprendió gracias a su madre.
Blanca quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de una maquina fileteadora para mejorar sus procesos y evitar tanto desgaste para confeccionar unas prendas ya que tiene una edad considerable en donde su piel y más precisamente las manos que se vuelven frágil.
Blanca tiene nietos y su sueño es ayudar a educarlos y hacerlos unas personas de bien como lo hizo con sus tres hijos, es algo que la hace verdaderamente feliz.
texts.en:
Blanca is a pleasant and hardworking 62-year-old woman who separated from her partner and became solely responsible for her three children. 

Blanca works making clothes in a business that she has at home and that she learned thanks to her mother.

Blanca wants to request a loan to buy a threading machine to improve her processes and avoid as much effort to make some of the pieces. She is fairly old now and her skin and hands have become fragile. 

Blanca has grandchildren and her dream is to help with their education and turn them into good people, as she did with her three children. This is something that makes her very happy.

loans.use: to buy a threading machine.

loans.name: Rubenia De Jesús

texts.es:
Rubenia es una señora de 53 años de edad, es ama de casa, por la situación económica ella no estudio y sus padres decidieron enseñarle a trabajar para que les apoyara en los gastos de la casa; se caso y junto con su esposo tuvieron 4 hijos los cuales ya todos son mayores de edad, ahora es una mujer divorciada y vive con un sobrino y su hijo el cual esta por graduarse en la escuela militar.

 Rubenia se dedica a la venta de ropa, además compra y vende gallinas indias desde hace 20 años, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres quien siempre se dedicaron a esto, para la venta de ropa ella lo hace de casa en casa en varias colonias, su horario es de 7:00 am a 5:00 p m. 

El crédito que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para pagar los gastos de graduación de su hijo pues esta próximo a realizarse y no tiene lo suficiente para los gastos.

 Rubenia sueña con que su hijo pueda tener un trabajo muy estable y así mejorara su calidad de vida, porque su hijo le ayudara con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Rubenia is a 53 years old woman. She is a housewife. Because of poverty she didn't go to school and her parents decided to teach her how to work so she could help support the household. She married and had 4 children with her husband who are now all grown. Today she is divorced and lives with her nephew and her son who is about to graduate from military school.

Rubenia sells clothing. In addition she has bought and sold chickens for 20 years. She learned this work from her parents. She sells clothing house to house in various neighborhoods. She works from 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM.

The loan she seeks from CREDICAMPO is to pay for her son's graduation expenses as it is very near and she doesn't have enough to cover the costs. Rubenia dreams that her son will have stable work and improve her quality of life, because her son helps her with her needs.

loans.use: to pay for her son's graduation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 200 bricks, four bags of cement, and a meter of sand and pay for labor to build a retaining wall at her house.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
Ese humilde y acogedor hogar es el “laboratorio” de Rosa una joven de 24 años de edad madre de 3 hijos de 2, 5, 8 años de edad que se dedica  a la preparación de comidas las cuales distribuye por su sector residencial y que aunque tiene muchos limitantes económicos pues su cocina evidencia que no tiene grandes recursos económicos quiere superarse y pelear por educar y brindar una estabilidad económica a sus hijos.
Solicita un crédito para comprar una moto para distribuir sus alimentos, recorriendo más zonas, y así podrá  realizar mas preparaciones pues con la moto podrá cubrir un mayor número de rutas.
texts.en:
This humble and cozy home is Rosa’s “laboratory.”  Rosa is a young, 24-year-old woman and the mother of three children, ages 2, 5, and 8 years.  She works preparing meals that she delivers throughout her neighborhood.  Although she has a lot of financial limitations—her kitchen is evidence that she doesn’t have great financial resources—she wants to improve herself and fight to educate her children, giving them economic stability.

She is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle in order to deliver her meals, traveling through more neighborhoods.  In this way she can make more meals, because she will be able to cover a greater number of routes with a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for meal delivery, so that she has a better income in order to live well.

loans.name: Ester Sofia

texts.es:
Ester es una vendedora de comidas de 57 años de edad que vive con su esposo y depende únicamente de su negocio para poder sobrevivir, para poder comer, pagar sus deudas etc.
Su negocio viene operando desde finales de los años 90 y ahora quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de un puesto de comidas rápidas pues los tiempos cambian y se tiene que adaptar a lo de ahora si quiere seguir ejerciendo la profesión de vendedora de alimentos. 
Este crédito le permitirá iniciar la venta de comidas rápidas y seguir manteniéndose pues es quien genera los ingresos y  no tiene alguien en quien apoyarse.
Su sueño es poder mantenerse en el tiempo vendiendo alimentos y hacer estra actividad hasta que su salud se lo permita.
texts.en:
Ester is a 57-year-old food vendor who lives with her husband and depends exclusively on her business for survival, to be able to eat, pay her debts, etc.  Her business has been in operation since the end of the 90s.  Now she wants to ask for a loan in order to buy a fast food cart, because the times are changing and she has to adapt to modern times if she wants to keep practicing her profession as a food vendor.

This loan will allow her to begin to sell fast food and keep taking care of herself, because she is the one who earns a living, and she doesn’t have anyone to support her.

Her dream is to be able to keep supporting herself by selling food, and to continue doing so as long as her health permits.

loans.use: to buy a food cart

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia trabaja en una Empresa dedicada a la venta de libros , es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia.
Celia aspira a ser una buena profesional y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas por medio de sus estudios. Ella está siguiendo la carrera de laboratorio clínico, y se esta esforzando mucho para poder lograrlo.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Celia works for a book-selling company. She is a very responsible person who is dedicated to her education and her family.

Celia aspires to be a good professional and to keep studying and serving people through her studies. She is pursuing a degree in clinical laboratory science, and she is working very hard to achieve it. 

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to pay her tuition payments.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
La Srita. Pabla vive en la ciudad de Luque, actualmente tiene como meta terminar su carrera en Ciencias de la Educación, desea cumplir el sueño de ser una profesional y así lograr obtener un buen trabajo para mejorar sus ingresos y ayudar a la calidad de vida a toda su familia.
Ella es una persona muy sacrificada, que pone todo de si para poder cumplir con su sueño anhelado.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir sus estudios, luchando por lo que quiere.
texts.en:
Señorita Pabla lives in the city of Luque. She now has a goal of finishing her program in Science of Education. She wants to accomplish her dream of being a professional and thus obtain a good job to improve her income and help the quality of life of her whole family.

She is a very sacrificing person who puts everything she has into being able to accomplish her desired dream.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her fees, and in this way be able to continue her studies, striving for what she wants.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es de la ciudad de Luque, estudia la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial, es soltero vive con sus padres que son empleados.
Juan comenta que dentro de unos años se ve ejerciendo su profesión como un buen profesional destacándose en su área. Le gustaría  terminar su carrera y administrar su propia empresa.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa manera a poder seguir sus sueños.
texts.en:
