Juan is from the city of Luque. He is studying Commercial Engineering. He is single and lives with his parents, who are employed.

Juan tells us that within a few years he sees himself excercising his profession as a good professional, and standing out in his career. He would like to finish his degree and run his own business. 

He is requesting a loan in order to pay his tuition; in this way he will be able to follow his dreams.

loans.use: to pay his tuition payments.

loans.name: Lina Maria

texts.es:
Lina una madre cabeza de familia madre de una hermosa y adorable niña de 15 meses de edad, la cual ama y da la vida por ella, se dedica a la venta de mercancía de artículos de salón de belleza y ropa, una actividad que inicio pro gusto al trabajo que se le noto cuando era estudiante y vendía coas a sus amigos y aprendió sola a vender, trabaja diariamente de 8 am a 8 pm y quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido en artículos de salón de belleza y ropa para hombre y mujer, niño y niña.
Su mayor objetivo en su vida se centra en su hija y es poder darle una buena calidad de vida y pagar su educación.
texts.en:
Lina is the head of her household, the mother of a beautiful and adorable 15-month-old daughter whom she loves and would give her life for.  She works selling beauty salon supplies and clothing.  She began this line of work because she noticed that she liked it when she was a student and would sell things to her friends.  She taught herself to make sales, working from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. daily.  She wants to ask for a loan in order to stock up on beauty salon supplies and clothing for men and women, boys and girls.

The main objective in her life centers on her daughter and is to be able to give her a good quality of life, and to pay for her education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as beauty products, in order to fight for her child.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Mary Grace is third of eight children in the family. Her mother Rosalina, who is the member of NWTF-Project Dungganon, supports the family through her buy-and-sell buri leaves (leaves used for mat weaving) business in the Philippines.

Mary Grace is studying for the Bachelor of Science in Criminology and is currently in the fourth year of this four-year course.

Rosalina is borrowing 6,000 to pay tuition fees for the first semester for her daughter Mary Grace.  

When she graduates, Mary Grace plans to help her brother and sister to finished their studies and earn additional income to help her parents.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 28 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soft drinks, chips,canned goods, sugar, etc.

Catherine has been in this business for six years.

In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soft drinks, chips, canned goods, sugar, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a coffee-pot, a deep-fryer, an apron and a chef's hat.

loans.name: Hernan De Jesus

texts.es:
Hernán un hombre casado, con la responsabilidad de mantener 3 hijos y a su esposa que inicio un negocio de venta de comidas por necesidad pues en su casa pasaban necesidades, y que ahora gracias a dios ha sacado su negocio y piensa en mejorar sus negocio a partir de un crédito de motocicleta, un molino eléctrico, e insumos para sus fabricar sus alimentos y a través del negocio busca poder pagar la educación de sus hijos. 
El crédito le permitirá aumentar sus clientes, mejorar sus ventas, tener sostenibilidad en el tiempo, ser más competitivo y mejorar su local.
Es un hombre muy decidido que hará todo lo que este a su alcance por ver a sus hijos cumplir sus sueños
texts.en:
Hernan is a married man who is responsible for supporting 3 children and his wife, who started a food business because the family was in need. With God's help, the business was survived and now Hernan wants to improve it with this loan to buy a motorcycle, an electric grinder and supplies to make the food. He wants to pay for his children's education with this business.

The loan will allow him to increase their customers, improve the sales, be able to sustain the business, be more competitive and improve the store. 

He is a decided man who will do everything within his reach to see his children achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle, an electric grinder and supplies to generate income to help his children.

loans.name: La Colonia 19 Group

texts.es: Ángela, tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, vive en el municipio de Yoro, Yoro. Ella inicio generando sus propios ingresos vendiendo pan y hace mas de 8 años decidió vender ropa, zapatos y sandalias. Esta actividad la realiza en su casa y por encargos. Ella ha decidido solicitar el segundo préstamo de 9,000 Lempiras para comprar mas mercadería en ropa, cosméticos y calzado para vender y continuar creciendo con el negocio para sacar  adelante a su familia. El préstamo es en forma grupal y suma 45,000 Lempiras, que lo utilizaran para surtir de mercadería para vender. El grupo se denomina La Colonia 19, que esta formado por 5 mujeres tal como aparece en la foto a la izquierda esta Mirna, Ángela, Carmen, Alba y María a la derecha. Todas viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican al comercio con la venta de ropa, cosméticos y calzado.
texts.en: Ángela is 51 years old, a single mother of 3 children, who lives in the municipality of Yoro, Yoro. She began generating her own income selling bread, and more than 8 years ago she decided to sell clothing, shoes and sandals.  Her business is located in her home and by order. She has decided to seek a second loan of 9000 Lempiras to buy clothing, cosmetics, and shoes to sell and continue growing her business in order to help her family get ahead. The loan is in the form of a group loan totaling 45,000 Lempiras which will be used to stock merchandise to sell. The group is called La Colonia 19 and consists of 5 members. in the photo from left to right are Mima, Angela, Carmen, Alba and Maria. They all live in the same community and have businesses selling clothing cosmetics, and shoes.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
Nidia viene de una familia de cuatro hermanos, trabaja como repositora de productos en supermercados para poder costear sus estudios.
En el futuro desea ser una excelente profesional y así poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Nidia is from a family with four siblings. She works as stocker for products in a supermarket so she can pay for her studies.

In the future she hopes to be an excelent professional so she can provide a better quality of life for her family. She is studying accounting. She is requesting the loan in order to pay her tuition costs, so that she can continue studying.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition payments.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio está cursando el ultimo año de la Carrera Licenciatura en  Enfermería, es una persona  responsable  y trabajador, estudia  para salir adelante.
Su sueño es de terminar esta carrera y el día de mañana trabajar en el Puesto de Salud que se encuentra en su comunidad para ayudar a la gente.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de tesis, de manera a poder seguir con sus sueños como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Eugenio is studying in his last year of the program for a nursing degree. He is a responsible and hard-working person. He studies to get ahead. His dream is to finish this program and in the future to work in the health station that is located in his community in order to help people. 

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay his thesis costs, so that he can continue with his dreams as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay thesis costs

loans.name: Nubia Esther

texts.es:
El sector de Uraba es la mayor productora de plátano de Colombia, una de tantas productoras es la señora Nubia que con su aporte logra vender su plátano el cual se vende tanto nacional como internacionalmente, convirtiéndose en el principal producto de Uraba. 
Hablando un poco de Nubia es una mujer que vive con su pareja con el que tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad y que sueña que este pueda ir a Medellín a estudiar una carrera universitaria por ello quiere fortalecer su empresa para que este deseo no quede en el aire, solicita un crédito para arreglar sus canales de riegos para una nueva cosecha.
Espera que este crédito le dé más estabilidad económica y un próspero futuro.
texts.en:
The Uraba area is the largest banana production area in Colombia. One of many producers is Nubia who with your support can sell her bananas both domestically and internationally, making bananas Uraba's main product. 

Nubia is a woman who lives with her partner with whom she has a two-year-old son. She dreams that he will be able to go to Medellin to study at university. It is for this reason that she wants to strengthen her business, so that her dream can become a reality.

She is requesting a loan to repair her irrigation channels for a new crop. She hopes that this loan will give her more economic stability and a prosperous future.

loans.use: to repair her irrigation channels

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba es de la ciudad de Encarnación, se dedica a la venta de ropas de todos tipos, tiene su propio local de ventas. Actualmente está estudiando peluquería en un Instituto, su carrera dura dos años y ya está terminado su curso.
Su principal objetivo es de terminar y montar su propia salón de belleza y seguir trabajando.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas del instituto, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Rosalba is from the city of Encarnación. She earns a living selling all types of clothes, and she has her own sales venue. She is currently studying hairdressing in an institute. Her certification takes 2 years, and she is now finishing her courses.

Her main objective is to finish school and start her own beauty salon and keep working. She is requesting this loan to pay for her school tuition, and in this way she can continue with her studies as she has always done.

loans.use: pay for her school tuition.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 57 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 10 años y su negocio es el comercio de cerveza.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, buena madre, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘chasquipampa’ la cual antiguamente era sitio de pastoreo de ganado y casas de adobe, actualmente se encuentra totalmente urbanizado, de clima templado en verano y muy frio en invierno.
Julia es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo trenzado, viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la realiza con su esposo que se dedica a la construcción y su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo (herencia de sus ancestros campesinos que habitaban el lugar) que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es el comercio de cerveza como; Huari (agua de manantial), Negra (con características nutritivas), light (sin alcohol), Maltin (sin alcohol para niños), etc., por mayor, que guarda en el depósito de su casa. Ella realiza la compra por mayor directamente de la fábrica y la revende a restaurantes, discotecas, fiestas privadas, etc. Su sueño es vender mayores volúmenes de su producto, ella desea realizar la compra de diferentes variedades de cervezas para almacenarlas y distribuirlas a fin de año, ya que cuenta con pedidos semanales y no quiere que escasee el producto porque es la temporada cuando sus ventas aumentan. Esta es la sexta secuencia de préstamos con la institución en tres años que viene realizando esta labor.
Es por esos motivos que Julia solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedades de cerveza por mayor y abastecer a sus clientes de fin de año
texts.en:
Julia is a 57-year-old woman who is married with a son aged 10. Her business is selling beer.  

She is enterprising, independent, a good mother, patient, responsible and hardworking. She carries out her business in the area of 'Chasquipampa' which was formerly a grazing site with adobe houses, but is now fully urbanized. It is temperate in summer and very cold in winter.

Julia has dark complexion, is of medium build, with long black braided hair. She dresses traditionally (hat, blanket and skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymara and she speaks Spanish for her business. She shares her life with her husband who works in construction and her son who studies at school. They live in their own home built of bricks (which was inherited from her peasant ancestors who lived in the area) which has running water and electricity.

Her business is selling beer including varieties such as: Huari (spring water), Black (with nutritional characteristics), Light (no alcohol), Maltin (without alcohol for children), etc. She sells it wholesale and stores it in a cellar in her house. She buys it wholesale directly from the factory and sells to restaurants, clubs, private parties, etc. Her dream is to sell larger volumes of her product, and she wishes to buy different varieties of beers to store and distribute for the end of the year because she has weekly orders and she does not want to have a lack of product in the season when sales increase. This is the sixth loan with this institution in the three years that she has been running this business.

It is for these reasons that Julia is requesting a loan to purchase varieties of beer wholesale and supply customers for the end of year.

loans.use: to buy different varieties of beer wholesale to supply her clients for the end of the year

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de Paraguarí, está estudiando la carrera de ciencias de la educación, con énfasis en bilingüismo, ella cada día va luchando por una mejor calidad de vida, y espera conseguirlo a través de sus estudios y de esa forma tener  más oportunidades como profesional,.
Tiene sus metas y objetivos que solo con el estudio podría alcanzar ya que sin profesión y capacitación que uno requiere no se puede progresar.
Maria pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y así seguir con sus sueños como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Maria is from Paraguarí. She is studying in the science of education program, with emphasis in bilingualism. Every day she is striving for a better quality of life, and she hopes to obtain it through her studies and in this way to have more opportunities as a professional.

She has her goals and objectives that she will be able to reach only through her studies, since without a profession and the training that one needs, it isn't possible to advance.

Maria is requesting this loan to be able to pay the fees for her program and thus continue with her dreams, as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Evelia

texts.es:
Evelia está estudiando la carrera de Licenciatura en Contaduría Pública, proviene de una familia muy humilde, es por eso que se esta esforzando mucho.
Su sueño es poder ser un buen profesional que ayude a las demás personas y también a su familia. esta de dedicándose mucho para seguir sus sueños.
Pide este préstamo para pagar sus cuotas y seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Evelia is studying in the program in public accounting. She comes from a very humble family. It is for this reason that she is striving hard. 

Her dream is to be able to be a good professional who helps other people as well as her family. She is working hard to follow her dreams.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her fees and continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 45 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, Lydia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, sugar, noodles, coffee, etc., to sell.

Lydia has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, sugar, noodles, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lim Rebeca

texts.es: Lim Rebeca, tiene 28 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo, vive en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa junto a su esposo y su  hijo. Hace 4 años que Lim Rebeca, se dedica a su propio cultivo, produce café  en pergamino húmedo y lo vende en el mercado local de su comunidad. Esta actividad sigue siendo su fuente de ingresos para la familia y espera seguir con ello. Ella esta solicitando otro préstamo a ODEF el cual es por 20,000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar para comprar abonos, foliar,  pago de corte y cubrir gastos de limpieza para darle asistencia a su finca de café y mejorar la producción. Su sueño es ampliar el cultivo y tener un estatus mejor de vida para su hijo.
texts.en:
Lim Rebeca is 28 years old, married, and has 1 son. She lives in the town of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, along with her husband and son.

For 4 years, Lim Rebeca has worked her own farm, where she grows wet processed coffee and sells it in her community's local market. This continues to be her source of income for the family and she hopes to continue with it.

She is requesting another loan from ODEF, in the amount of 20,000 lempiras. She will use it to buy fertilizer and foliage cover, and to pay for trimming and cleaning to support her coffee plantation and improve its production.

Her dream is to increase the size of her farm and to have a better status in life for her son.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and foliage cover, and pay for trimming and cleaning at her coffee plantation

loans.name: Christian

texts.es:
Christian trabaja en una casa de seguros , y a la vez estudia, es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia.
Aspira ser un buen profesional y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas por medio de sus conocimientos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, de manera a poder seguir estudiando y luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Christian works in an insurance agency, and at the same time he is going to school. He is a very responsible person, and is dedicated to his studies and his family. He wants to be a great professional and continue studying and serving other people with what he has learned.

He is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in paying for his university tuition. This way he can continue studying and striving to reach his goals.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar es una persona que se esfuerza mucho por poder salir adelante, esta estudiando y a la vez estudia, ya que sabe que es la única forma de poder salir adelante.
Su carrera es la de odontología, quiere ser un buen profesional que ayude a las demás personas en algo tan importante como es la salud bucal.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando como lo viene haciendo en busca de sus sueños.
texts.en:
Oscar is person who works hard to be able to advance. He is studying since he knows that it is the only way to be able to get ahead.

His program is odontology. He wants to be a good professional who helps other people in something as important as oral health.

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay his program fees, and in this way to be able to continue striving, as he has been doing, in search of his dreams.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Deidamia

texts.es:
Deidamia  viene de una familia humilde, sus padres se dedican a al comercio de productos de primera necesidad , mediante el apoyo de sus padres procura  terminar su estudios universitario, para que pueda tener un futuro mejor.
Esta estudiando la carrera de licenciatura en letras, con el que quiere poder ayudar a la sociedad en la educación a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para sus gastos de titulación, de manera a poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene y que le sera de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Deidamia is from a humble family. Her parents sell basic need items. With her parents' support she was able to finish her university studies so that she can have a better future. She is studying liberal arts, and wants to be able to help society by educating others. She seeks a loan to pay certification expenses, and being able to cover this expense that she has will be very helpful.

loans.use: to pay certification expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials so he can install a floor in his house, because the current on is made of earth.

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en:
Noeun, a married woman, lives in Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. She is a mother of four children. Two are single and two are married. 

She is an active and experienced farmer. By growing rice and selling the crop to local dealers, she can make a decent income to support her family. So far, she has been involved in this career for almost thirty years.
 
Noeun wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. 

By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Pheby Jean

texts.en:
Pheby Jean is 27 years old. She is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. Pheby Jean works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as coffee, milk, sugar, canned goods, noodles, chips, and bread.

Pheby Jean has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as coffee, milk, sugar, canned goods, noodles, chips, and bread.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marlyn requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Marlyn has been in this business for 3 years now.

Marlyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: María, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, y reside en una aldea del municipio de Esparta, Atlántida. Siempre se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa de todo tipo para tener una fuente de ingresos estable. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y vende por pedidos. Vende short, blusas, camisas, pantalones, bóxer, calcetas etc. El préstamo que esta solicitando es el tercer ciclo con la institución y es por 8,000 lempiras, y lo invertirá en la compra de ropa como blusas, short, camisas, jeans, bóxer y ropa intima para damas. Esta inversión le ayudara a surtir su negocio y a satisfacer los pedidos de los clientes. Su plan es mantener surtido para obtener mejores ganancias y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old, the single mother of 4 children. She lives in a village of the municipality of Esparta, Atlántida.

She has always worked selling clothes of all kinds, in order to have a stable source of income. She operates this business out of her home and sells by costumer requests. She sells shorts, blouses, shirts, pants, boxers, socks, etc.

The current loan is her third with the institution, and it is for 8,000 lempiras. She will use it to purchase clothing, such as blouses, shorts, shirts, jeans, boxers, and women's intimates. This investment will help her stock her business and fill her customers' orders.

Her plan is to maintain a variety of stock to make better earnings and help her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, such as blouses, shorts, shirts, jeans, boxers, and women's intimates

loans.name: Marcos Arcangel

texts.es: Marcos, tiene 36 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos y reside en una comunidad del Municipio de Trujillo, Colon junto a su esposa e hijos. Anteriormente se dedicaba a realizar trabajos de construcción, pero no recibía muchos ingresos y hace un año tres meses decidió poner su propio negocio de una pulpería junto con su esposa. En la pulpería vende arroz, azúcar, manteca, productos enlatados, jabón, churros, galletas, dulces, jugos, harina, y otros abarrotes. Ahora esta solicitando 15,000 lempiras para surtir su pulpería, comprara azúcar, arroz, frijoles, harina, manteca, huevos, churros, golosinas, jugos, embutidos, productos de higiene, y otros para incrementar el inventario y las ventas. A futuro el piensa también vender accesorios de  celulares para tener otros ingresos.
texts.en:
Marcos is 36 years old. He is married, has 3 children, and lives in a community in the municipality of Trujillo, Colon along with his wife and kids.

He used to work in construction, but he didn't make much money, so 15 months ago, he decided to start his own business with his wife: a grocery store. There, he sells rice, sugar, butter, canned goods, soap, churros, cookies, sweets, juice, flour, and other groceries.

He is requesting 15,000 lempiras to stock his grocery store. He will buy sugar, rice, beans, flour, butter, eggs, churros, sweets, juice, deli meat, hygiene products, and other items to increase his inventory and sales.

In the future, he plans to also sell cell phone accessories to have another source of income.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, beans, flour, butter, eggs, churros, sweets, juice, lunchmeat, hygiene products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban está estudiando la carrera  de enfermería con el propósito  de superarse  y ayudar a sus seres queridos. Es una persona que se está esforzando por poder cumplir sus metas.
Está trabajando y estudiando a la vez para así poder cubrir sus gastos de facultad, y seguir con sus sueños. Al culminar sus estudios se ve trabajando en el hospital de su ciudad.
Pide este préstamo para poder `pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma seguir luchando por cumplir su meta.
texts.en: Esteban is studing nursing, with the goal of getting ahead and helping his loved ones. He is a person who is working hard to achieve his goals. He is working and studying at the same time so he can cover his tuition costs and continue with his dreams. When he finishes his studies, he sees himself working in the hospital in his city. He is requesting a loan in order to pay his tuition, so that he can continue fighting to achieve his goal.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition.

loans.name: Nhóm 01_Thôn 3_Minh Châu Group

texts.en:
Lợi operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Lợi is 38 years old. She is married and has two children. 

Lợi is the group leader of the Nhóm 01_Thôn 3_Minh Châu solidarity group, which consists of seven members. This is Lợi’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Lợi has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Lợi faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Lợi hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 38 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Laura has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 44 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Lina has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buy-and-sell frozen foods.

Lina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 52 years old. She is married and has one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo and groceries.

Merly has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns income from farming rice.

Merly aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 50 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, vinegar, spices, milk, etc.

Mercedes has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from buy-and-sell frozen foods and charcoal.

Mercedes aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like noodles, vinegar, spices, milk, etc

loans.name: Merita

texts.en:
Merita lives in Baucau. She is married and she has two children.  

She has been involved in business activities since in 2011. She started with her own working capital of $ 500.00. 

She is selling second clothes and her shop for the business is in the center of the market, so every day many people come to buy.  She is earning a good income from selling second clothes so she is still happy to do her business.

Now she is applying for a loan of $1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.   She is taking this loan because she wants to add more clothes including shorts, shirts, sweatpants, long sleeves, short sleeves and other clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy shorts, shirts, sweatpants, long sleeves, short sleeves, and other clothes to sell..

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Evangeline works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables and meat. Evangeline is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through one previous loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es una joven  que está trabajando para solventar los gastos de su facultad, sigue la carrera de fisioterapia y le gustaría tener  su propio consultorio  para así poder  generar su propio  ingreso  para ayudar a su familia.
Con mucho sacrificio ha ido estudiando y cursando año tras año. Ella quiere ser una profesional útil a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar los gastos de titulación, ya que está terminando su carrera y quiere poder cubrir ese gasto.
texts.en:
Gloria is a young woman who is working to pay the costs of her school. She is continuing in the program in physical therapy, and she would like to have her own clinic to thus be able to generate her own income to help her family.

With great sacrifice, she has been studying year after year. She wants to be a useful professional in society.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay the costs of her degree, since she is finishing her program and wants to be able to cover this expense.

loans.use: to pay degree costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for graduation paperwork expenses.

loans.name: Dionesa

texts.en:
Dionesa is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 55 years old and has one child who is in school.

She has a oyster culture business in the Philippines. Dionesa requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business like plastic rope, bamboo, wood, etc.

Dionesa has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her oyster culture business like plastic rope, bamboo, wood, etc

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is 51 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Socorro runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as alcohol, cologne, biscuits, soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, detergent soap, etc. 

Socorro would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lynda

texts.en:
Lynda is one of the most determined ladies you’re ever likely to meet. After quitting her full-time job in 2009, Lynda went back to school and earned a degree in business. While in school, she got a job at a salon and discovered that she had a passion for beauty, cosmetics, and skincare.

Fresh out of school, Lynda went to a local beauty school to ask for a job and made herself a nuisance there until they finally offered her one. Starting as a front desk clerk, she eventually worked her way up to teacher’s assistant, until ultimately she was leading classes as an instructor.

Finding herself at the pinnacle of where she could go as a cosmetics and esthetics instructor, Lynda decided to open her own spa. 

Lynda will use her Kiva loan to pay for marketing as well as payroll costs associated with hiring another associate so the spa can be open five days a week during regular business hours.

Lynda’s hope for the future is that she’ll have so many clients she won’t know how to fit them all in. With the help of generous Kiva lenders, Lynda’s dream will one day be a reality.

loans.use: to pay for marketing as well as payroll costs associated with hiring another associate

loans.name: Damian

texts.es:
Damian es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, esta trabajando a la vez que estudia, sus aspiraciones son la de ayudar a los demás como un profesional hecho y derecho.
Su familia es quien lo ayuda siempre, y gracias a ellos esta saliendo adelante. Está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería agronoma, que quiere llevarlo a la practica, ya que el Paraguay es rico en su tierra.
Pide este prestamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Damian is from the city of San Ignacio. He is working and studying at the same time. His aspiration is to help others as a full-fledged professional. His family are the ones who always help him, and thanks to them, he is making progress. 

Damian is studying agricultural engineering, and he wants to put it into practice, as Paraguay is rich in land. He is requesting this loan in order to invest it in making his tuition payments, so that he can continue with his education.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Stella

texts.es:
Stella está ejerciendo la docencia, tiene 20 años de ejercicio en esta labor, con el afán de superarse profesional, personal y económicamente, dedico su tiempo a capacitarme más y más.
Hoy está muy cerca de culminar una carrera muy anhelada, cual es la de psicología, en un futuro no muy lejano desea cumplir su sueño de trabajar como psicóloga y montar su propio consultorio para poder ayudar a las personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, con lo que podrá cubrir este gasto que tiene que es muy necesario para ella.
texts.en:
Stella is working as a teacher. She has been working in this field for 20 years, with the ambition of getting head professionaly, personally, and economically. She dedicates her time to getting more and more training.

She is very close to finishing a highly-desired degree, which is psychology. In the not-too-distant future, she hopes to fulfill her dream of working as a psychologist and to start her own practice so she can help people.

She is requesting this loan so she can cover graduation paperwork fees. With it she'll be able to pay this expense that she has and which is very necessary for her.

loans.use: to pay graduation paperwork fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 48 years old and married with nine children, three of whom are in school, Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalinda runs a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of dry goods to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena works hard to support her family. Nena is married and has a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines.

Nena has been in this business for ten years now.

Nena requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

In the future, Nena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 29 years old and is married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, like chips, bread, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.

Marivic has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like chips, bread, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 41 years old and is married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a loan of 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, milk, soap, coffee, etc.

Jennifer has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns an income from fishing.

Jennifer aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, milk, soap, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
This is Rufina, 56, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Wilfredo and they have three children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Rufina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP-5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Rufina wants to have her store renovated. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries ,and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, sanitary pads, toothpaste, bath soap, diapers, canned goods, etc., to sell.

In the future, Zenaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, sanitary pads, toothpaste, bath soap, diapers, canned goods, etc., to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 38 years old and married with four children.

Irene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods.

Irene has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for fifteen years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Irene aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer is 39 years old, married, and has eight children, seven of whom are currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Jenefer has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a married woman with two children. Marlyn is 41 years old and has two children who are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marlyn has a business making nipa roofing in the Philippines. Marlyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Marlyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 25 years old and single.  

Rose runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years selling a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, candies, cereals, coffee, juice, milk, etc. 

Rose requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, candies, cereals, coffee, juice, milk, etc.

In the future, Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items  to sell such as canned goods, noodles, candies, cereals, coffee, juice, milk, etc

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Jonathan is 22 years old and is the youngest of the six children in the family. His mother, Haide, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her business raising livestock in the Philippines.

Jonathan is studying for his Bachelor of Science in Criminology, and is currently in the third year of this four-year course.

Haide is borrowing 6,750 PHP to pay for the tuition fees of her son, Jonathan, for the second semester of the 2014-2015 school year.

Jonathan plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: Venturada

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Venturada works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Venturada is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stock of bananas to sell to customers.

Venturada has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 51 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct selling of personal collection products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Leonida has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct selling of personal collection products for 20 years and earns additional income from retailing gasoline.

Leonida aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of personal collection products to sell

loans.name: Sari Wangi Ternak Group

texts.en:
Sari Wangi Ternak Group is very grateful that they can pass through the loan period with success. While raising pigs, no problems were found. The pigs grew big and healthy. The members could sell the pigs at a satisfactory price. Sari Wangi Ternak members intend to continue borrowing from MUK, because in addition to providing loans, MUK also provides training and a consulting veterinarian for free.

Ni Kadek managed to sell the piglets with a satisfactory price. She earned 150,000 IDR profit per pig. She will save the profit to expand the business. She hopes that MUK will always accompany the group until all members are independent.

To continue the effort and increase the number of pigs, the Sari Wangi Ternak group took the next loan for the same amount. These loans are used to purchase piglets, especially the superior type. The pig-breeding business can help increase their family income, because of easy maintenance, and can be used as additional work. 

Ni Kadek will use her loan to purchase superior piglets and feed. Most of the members work as farmers. They have hopes that this effort will be more advanced, and that they can save money and send their children to high levels of education.

loans.use: to buy superior piglets and feed

loans.name: Jasmine

texts.en:
Jasmine sends you her thanks for your generosity, because her previous loan has improved her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for her child's educational expenses, and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 60,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stock of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit. This will result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from increasing her profit, Jasmine wants to give her family a good life. She hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work, and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Candelaria works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising livestock. Candelaria is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell to customers.

Candelaria has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Ma. Luz works hard to support her family. She has an egg retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Ma. Luz is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock of eggs to offer for sale.

Ma. Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of eggs to offer for sale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 59 years old and has one child who is still in school.

She has a buy-and-sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Veronica has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina works hard to support her family. Catalina is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Catalina requested a loan of 12000 PHP through NWTF, to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Catalina has been in this business for two years.

Catalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nilsa

texts.es:
Nilsa siendo estudiante del último año de la carrera de Veterinaria, comenta que una de sus metas es la de abrir después de graduarse una Agroveterinaria.
De aquí a un tiempo se ve como una empresaria exitosa.  Sus aspiraciones son la de seguir formándose como profesional, realizando su posterior  especialización.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de la defensa de su tesis, de manera a cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Nilsa, a final-year student in the Veterinary degree program, says that one of her goals is to open an agricultural veterinary clinic. In the near future, she sees herself as a successful businesswoman. Her aspiration is to continue developing herself as a professional, carrying out her subsequent specialization. 

She is requesting this loan so that she can pay for the cost of defending her thesis, in order to cover this expense that she has.

loans.use: to pay her thesis expenses

loans.name: Pancrasia

texts.en:
Pancrasia is 55 years old. She is a married to a farmer and they have five children, ages 9 through 29. For the last 29 years, she has been involved in multiple small businesses to help her husband. She collects and sells firewood; makes and sells charcoal; and also grow vegetables like squash, string beans, okra and eggplants. She is asking for a loan to buy feed, piglets and vegetable seedlings. Pancrasia knows how to take risks and she would like to venture into raising hogs. Her income will provide food for her family and school fees of her children. 

In the future, Pancrasia hopes to keep a successful business and increase her income for savings and reinvestment.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets and vegetable seedlings.

loans.name: Antonietta

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Antonietta works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Antonietta is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Antonietta has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Leyte, Philippines. Cristina used to raise pigs but had to stop after Super Typhoon Haiyan ruined it.

Now, Christina just repaired her pigpen and is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise, and animal feed. This will enable her to start raising pigs again which she can sell to the market after several weeks. 

In the future, Cristina hopes of making her business sustainable and productive. She also wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise, and animal feed.

loans.name: Jose Victor

texts.es: Este es el tercer crédito que Don José ha recibido mediante KIVA-MICREDITO, se siente muy emocionado ya que los anteriores le han ayudado en gran manera a él y a su familia. Este nuevo préstamo lo piensa invertir en la compra de nuevo ganado. Dentro de su plan futuro está la compra de un motor de riego porque sabe que puede contar con el financiamiento que le brinda la institución.
texts.en: This is the third loan that José has received through Kiva-MiCredito.  He is very excited, since the previous ones have helped him and his family a great deal.  He intends to invest this new loan in the purchase of new cattle.  Within his future plan is the purchase of an irrigation motor because he knows that he can count on the funding that the institution provides to him.

loans.use: to purchase new cattle.

loans.name: Nasanod Group

texts.en:
Van's village takes water from wells and from local streams. The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The drinking water in nearby villages is also dirty and unsafe. Some people in the village, including Van, are able to buy bottled water.

Van is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income for users like Van, due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing the amount of money used to  purchase bottled water.

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find that the filter works for 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters in order to access safe drinking water.

loans.name: Engracia

texts.en:
Engracia is an entrepreneur who owns a Sari-sari store in Baybay, Leyte. In her store she sells basic household needs like salt, cooking oil, detergent, shampoo, hair conditioner, biscuits and chips. Her business has been in existence for 14 years, allowing her to earn 3,000 PHP per month. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise items in sachets like canned goods, toothpaste, conditioner, seasoning, noodles and eggs. Some amount will also be used for piglets and feed for her to start a hog-raising business.

Engracia is 54 years old. Her husband is a farmer and all her children are adults.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, toothpaste, conditioner, seasoning, noodles, eggs, feed and piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay his school fees for university, where he is majoring in Information Technology.

loans.name: Henry Alonso

texts.es:
Ser el único vendedor de mercancía de productos de consumo personal saludables es una gran ventaja para sacar su negocio adelante, además de ser un promotor de la vida saludable es ideal para que Henry prospere y se anime a triunfar en el emprendimiento y en el difícil mercado, su principal dificultad es la falta de capital para comprar mercancía y por ello quiere solicitar un crédito comprar productos de la marca Herbalife y así impulsar el consumo de productos saludables entre sus conocidos y gente de barrio. 
Su principal sueño es tener un negocio estable, un local comercial, mejorar ventas, y que este negocio le dé estabilidad económica y lo suficiente para cubrir sus necesidades y gustos.
texts.en:
Being the only seller of personal health products is a big advantage for moving Henry's business forward. In addition, being a representative of healthy living is ideal in order for him to prosper. He is ready to triumph in this undertaking and in this difficult market. 

Henry's main difficulty is the lack of capital for buying merchandise. This is why he wants to request a loan to buy Herbalife-brand products in order to boost consumption of healthy products among his acquaintances and people in his neighborhood.

His main dream is to have a stable business and a retail space, to improve sales, and for his business to give him economic stability and enough to cover his needs and wants.

loans.use: to buy Herbalife-brand merchandise

loans.name: Dongmarkngeo Group

texts.en: Seangdeuan's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in Seangdeuan's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. Seangdeuan is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. Even though some people in the village, including Seangdeuan, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Seangdeuan and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal or wood and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Seangdeuan's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Luz, una mujer que ha sabido sacrificarse a favor de su hijo, es una responsable madre de 58 años de edad, trabajadora que levanto un hogar de 0 gracias a su negocio de confección a terceros el cual desempeña 7 horas y 7 días a la semana,
Luz quiere solicitar crédito para completar el dinero para la compra de una maquina fileteadora que le permitirá mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, mejorar su utilidad, gracias a que podrá realizar procesos más rápidos y con mejor acabado.
Su gran sueño que a sus 58 años de edad no ha podido cumplir es comprar una casa propia para dejarle alguna herencia a su adolecente hijo de 23 años.
texts.en: Luz, a woman who has known how to make sacrifices for her son, is a responsible, hardworking, 58-year-old mother who raised a home from nothing thanks to her business sewing for third parties where she works seven hours a day, seven days a week. Luz wants to ask for a loan to have the rest of the money she needs to buy a sewing machine that will allow her to improve her sales, increase her customers and improve her utility thanks to the fact that she will be able to do things faster and with a better finish. Her great dream that she hasn't yet been able to achieve at 58 years of age is to buy a house of her own to leave her 23-year-old adolescent son an inheritance.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Carlos Yimmy

texts.es:
Un día se encontraba el señor Carlos mirando hacia cielo buscando una manera de generar recursos ya que el dinero no caía del cielo, y decidió tomar un curso de barbería, con el paso del tiempo le fue gustando mucho la vocación e hizo grandes sacrificios para poder montar un negocio. 
Hoy a sus 34 años de edad con el negocio ya montado busca la manera de sostener su negocio, poder generar empleo y velar por un mejor bienestar en su vivienda que su madre no tenga que trabajar ya que él se lo quiere dar todo. 
Carlos quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de una vitrina, surtido de productos para hombres,, pintura y una reja de acero para el negocio.
texts.en:
One day, Señor Carlos was looking toward the sky in search of a way to generate resources, as money wasn't falling from the sky, and he decided to take a barbering course. With time, he came to really like the vocation and made great sacrifices to be able to start a business.

Today, at 34 years of age and with his business already set up, he is seeking a way to sustain his business, generate jobs, and safeguard better wellbeing in his household so that his mother won't have to work, as he wants to provide her with everything.

Carlos wants to request a loan for the purchase of a display case, an assortment of products for men, paint, and a steel security grill for his business.

loans.use: to buy a display case, merchandise (products for men), paint, and a steel security grill for his business

loans.name: Parkxoun Group

texts.en:
Vanthone is excited that he, like his fellow group members, was able to purchase a water filter.

The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of water-borne diseases. Vanthone's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from the natural sources in his village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.

Even though some people in the village, including Vanthone, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Vanthone and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood.

Vanthone's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find that the filter works for 3-5 years. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; increasing time available for productive work. It also improves the family’s income and over all well-being.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters in order to access safe drinking water.

loans.name: Naboneneua Group

texts.en:
Nan's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and local streams; however, the water from these natural sources in Nan's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The drinking water in nearby villages is also dirty and unsafe.

Nan is excited that she, like her fellow group members, was able to purchase a water filter.

Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. Even though some people in the village, including Nan, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Nan and other filter users also decreased the amount of money spent boiling water, purchasing less charcoal or wood and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood.

Nan's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find that the filter works for 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters in order to access safe drinking water.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of 8 children from Leyte, Philippines.

She earns an income through a hog-raising business, a business in which she has been involved for more than two years now.

Dioscora is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise, as well as animal feed. A loan will help her to expand her business as well as her income.

In the future, Dioscora has hopes of making her pig-raising business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise, as well as animal feed

loans.name: Nahin Group

texts.en:
Kod's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from this problem. Some people in the village, including Kod, are able to buy bottled water.

Kod is excited that she, like her fellow group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases.

The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Kod due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal and time spent foraging for wood in order to boil water, and due to the decreased amount of money used to purchase bottled water.

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find that the filter works for 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters to access safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nakheuanai Group

texts.en:
Souy's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from the problem of dirty and unsafe drinking water. Some people in the village, including Souy, are able to buy bottled water.

Souy is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases.

The water filter also increases disposable income for users like Souy, due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal and time spent foraging for wood to boil water, and the decreased amount of money used to purchase bottled water.

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find that the filter works for 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters to access safe drinking water.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 43 years old and has six children. Mercedita is married and three of her children are currently in school.

Mercedita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Mercedita has requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business.

Mercedita has been in the pig fattening business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Eduar Jair

texts.es:
Buscando un apoyo para comprar semillas de plátano, construir canales de riego, comprar abonos, el señor Eduar quien es agricultor e inicio su negocio por iniciativa y necesidad económica viene solicitando la ayuda para cubrir sus falencias y poder producir correctamente.
El préstamo será muy trascendental en la vida de Eduar puesto que le dará la oportunidad de tener una mejor producción, mejor calidad, ampliara sus palos de platano y todo ello lo hace para poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, tener más comodidades y seguir ofreciendo su vida en post de la agricultura para que las familias puedan disfrutar de un sano producto.
texts.en:
Looking for help in order to buy plantain seeds, build irrigation canals and buy fertilizer, Mr. Eduar is a farmer and started his business of his own accord and out economic necessity. He is asking for assistance in order to cover his needs and to be able to produce properly.

The loan will be crucial in Eduar’s life since it will give him the opportunity to have better production, better quality and expand his plantain crop. He does this all in order to be able to improve his living conditions, have more amenities and continue working in agriculture so that families can enjoy a healthy product.

loans.use: to buy seeds and build irrigation canals.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Valentina requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for three years now.

Valentina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 25 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her family in Leyte, Philippines.

Joan and her husband are engaged in the motorcycle repair business. This has been the source of their income for the past two years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy materials like nuts and bolts, chains, spare tires, screw drivers and other items. With this loan, they will be able to serve  more customers in their repair shop.

In the future, Joan hopes to make her business sustainable and productive. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials like nuts and bolts, chains, spare tires, screw drivers and other items

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jonah is 42 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Jonah requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of fruits to sell.

Jonah has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Jonah would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fruit to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Juanita is 52 years old and has four children who are in school.

She has a beauty products business in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products for her business.

Juanita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Juanita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products for her business

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonila is 55 years old now.

She has a beauty products business in the Philippines. Leonila requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products for her business.

Leonila has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more products for her business

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander es un hombre soltero que desde los 10 años de edad mostro gran interés por el emprendimiento y por ser su propio jefe, generando recursos a partir de sus ideas y su capacidad de negociar.
Como buen campesino siguió sus ideales y monto un negocio de cría de ganado de porcino con el que lleva ya 20 años y quiere seguir continuando esta tradición que tantas alegrías le ha dado. 
El sueño que ha tratado de realizar estos 20 años de trabajo es poder comprar una vivienda propia y sigue trabajando diariamente por lograr este sueño.
Buscando mejorar su negocio, cubrir la futura demanda que se aproxima pues el mes de diciembre es muy común el cerdo quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de concentrado, mantenimiento de establos de los cerdos y compra de cerdos.
texts.en:
Alexander is a single man who, from the age of 10, has shown a great interest in entrepreneurship and in being his own boss, creating resources based on his ideas and his ability to negotiate.

Like a good country farmer, he followed his ideals and set up a business raising pigs.  He has had this business for 20 years now, and he wants to carry on this tradition that has given him so much happiness.

The dream that he has tried to bring about through these 20 years of work is to be able to buy his own house, and he continues working every day to achieve this dream.

Seeking to improve his business and cover the future demand that is approaching, since in the month of December pork is very common, he wants to request a loan for the purchase of animal feed, maintenance of the pigs’ stables, and the purchase of pigs.

loans.use: buy animal feed, carry out maintenance on his sheds, and buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her son who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in computer science.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly, 51, lives in a small community in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. 

Ly is a motorcycle mechanic earning a daily salary of USD 6.00. So far, he has been in this field of business for more than 10 years. His wife Piny, 22, is a cassava farmer who is able to earn USD 5.00 per day. This couple has only one dependent child who currently goes to school.

Ly wants to improve the general living conditions of his entire family by building a latrine, something his house currently lacks. 

Therefore, Ly is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders in order to build a latrine. By doing this, he can give his family members access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

Ly is thankful for the loan granted through Hattha Kaksekar Limited with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine for his house.

loans.name: Luz Miryam

texts.es:
Un pequeño restaurante fue lo que con mucho esfuerzo logro esta emprendedora mujer de 37 años de edad llamada Luz, que buscando una alternativa para generar ingresos tuvo la idea de montar su negocio. 
Hoy en día por construcción de un sistema masivo de transporte llamado tranvía su negocio está viéndose afectado pues las construcciones están alejando sus clientes y es en estos tiempos de crisis que debe demostrar que es gran empresaria y sobrevivir.
Solicita una ayuda crediticia para tener capital de trabajo para invertirlo sabiamente en esta época difícil comprando insumos ya en menor cantidad pero suficiente para atender sus clientes. 
Espera lograr superar esta crisis y gozar en un futuro de este sistema que hoy le quita clientes, pero si sobrevive tendrá muchos una vez esté terminada la obra.
texts.en:
A small restaurant was what this enterprising woman named Luz, age 37, achieved with a lot of effort.  Seeking an alternative to generate income, she had the idea to start a business.

Today, due to the construction of a mass transport system called a streetcar, her business is being affected because the construction is keeping her customers away.  It is in these times of crisis that she must demonstrate that she is a great business woman and survive.

She is requesting help through a loan to have working capital to invest wisely during this difficult period, buying supplies in smaller quantities but enough to attend to her customers.

She hopes to be able to overcome this crisis and, in the future, enjoy this system that today is taking away her customers. But if she survives, she will have many customers once the work is finished.

loans.use: have working capital to confront a customer crisis she is having, due to the construction of the streetcar in Medellin.

loans.name: Thuyen

texts.en: Mrs. Thuyen is 29 years old. She is married. Fishing is main income of her family. She sells fish and has been in this business for 5 years. She has also daily income from garden such as chicken, duck and vegetable. She is interested to improve the living standard for her family so she really needs the loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mrs. Mai is 42 years old, married and has two children. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can improve the health of her family’s member, especially her children. She has daily income from pig raising activity and fishing so she is able to repay the loan monthly as scheduled.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Muslimah

texts.en:
This is the story of Dwi, daughter of Muslimah:
I come from a poor family, I was born of parents who are named Mr. Supardi and Mrs. Muslimah, I am the 2nd child of 4 siblings. My mother and father's occupation is as a small trader (mendoan, the content being flour and soybeans fried in oil ). Mom and dad every day do not benefit much from their efforts, the results can be as little as RP 25.000/day. Dad sometimes is asked for help to repair homes, and is paid Rp. 50.000,- that is, if anyone would like to ask for help of my father. Therefore my father is dependent on other people, but if no one asks for help, my father usually helps my mother selling snacks. This is a little bit of my life story and my family in my home.

I am very grateful, because the opportunity to continue my studies of Kiva program. The loan is to pay my school fees for 3 years in vocational Sidareja. Hopefully I can finish school with good grades, in order to quickly get a job after school. so I can quickly restore this loan and can help other brothers.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school.

With more than 20 years experience and has support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly

texts.en:

She requires a loan of 100,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy furniture such as chairs and benches, along with some packs of stationery items for her students. 

Adeela has worked hard to bring her school to this point and wants to expand. She believes that making her school sustainable and profitable will allow her to grow and provide her students with better facilities and a quality education.

loans.use: to buy furniture such as chairs and benches along with some packs of stationery items for her students.
