loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a 43-year-old married woman with four children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Merlita has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Merlita has requested a 9,500 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. Merlita has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Merlita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mach's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham province, Mach is 28 years old and a mother of two young children. To support her family, she earns income by growing cassava and working for others for a fee. She can earn about 25,000 KHR per day. 

For Mach, this is her first time with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is leading a group of two members to get a new loan. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 59 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is still in school.

Norma is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Norma has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Norma has been in pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Norma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Molin's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Molin is 46 years old and a mother of four children, three of whom are in school. She earns income to improve her family’s lives via rice cropping and working for others for a fee. She has been involved in this business for ages, and it earns her about 40,300 KHR per day. 

For Molin, this is her second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. In a group of four members, she is a group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get more income to support her children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Teresita is 56 years old now.

Teresita has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her business.

Teresita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her business

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Ny is 39 years old and a mother of three children. For a living, she earns income via rice cropping and working as a construction worker to update her family's condition. 

This is second loan cycle for Ny with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has fully repaid back, has uplifted her lifestyle gradually. In a group of two members, she is a group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more income to support her children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
A local resident from Battambang province, Thy is 46 years old and a mother of five schoolchildren. She grows rice and teaches in a school to earn more income to support her family's conditions. 

For Thy, this is her second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. She will spend her loan portion to pay for the tuition fee for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in accounting. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fee for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in accounting.

loans.name: Nelsa

texts.en:
Nelsa is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nelsa is 44 years old, and four children are in school.

Nelsa has a buying and selling of ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. Nelsa requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy products to sell like clothes, etc.

Nelsa has been in this business for four years. In the future, Nelsa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy products to sell like clothes, etc.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 52 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Vivian is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Vivian has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is 56 years old and married with three children. One of her children is in school. Aurea works very hard to provide for them.

Aurea runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

Aurea has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Aurea would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Nhe's Group

texts.en: Nhe is 47 years old and the mother of three children living in Prey Veng province. For her living, she grows rice as her single source of income to support her family's living conditions. She has been involved in her current business for 27 years. For Nhe, this is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan to buy ingredients and some materials for making snacks. She hopes that she can expand her business bigger than before.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and some materials for making snacks.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 53 years old and has one child in school.

Ma. Victoria has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Ma. Victoria has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area of Kampong Cham province, Pheap is 50 years old and a mother of four children. She earns income to improve her family's living conditions by building houses and working on a rubber farm. She also earns income by working for others for a fee. She has been involved in this business for three years. This is her first cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is leading a group of two members to get new loan. As the leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide. She hopes that she can earn more income to make her family's living conditions better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Hernan Dario

texts.es:
Hernán a sus 33 años de edad ve su sueño cumplirse, el cual es ser una persona independiente y tener su propio negocio, gracias a la incursión de interactuar en su vida puede lograr este sueño y montara aprovechando su terreno una cría y venta de ganado porcino, por lo que solicita un crédito que invertirá en la compra de 2 cerdas se cría, cuido, adecuaciones de cocheras. 
Es padre de 2 hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad con los que sueña poder pagarles la educación aunque ellos quieren ser futbolistas pero Hernan como buen padre siempre estará a su lado apoyándolos incondicionalmente por eso esta tan determinado en triunfar en este nuevo proceso de su vida
texts.en:
Hernán, at 33 years old, is seeing his dream fulfilled, which is to be an independent person and have his own business.  Thanks to the introduction of Interactuar in his life, he can achieve this dream and continue upward.  Hernán is now hoping to take the opportunity to raise a calf and to sell pigs on his land, and therefore requests a loan which will purchase 2 breeding sows to look after, and modifications to the garage in which they are housed.

He is the father of two children, aged 8 and 5 years old, with dreams to pay for their education - even though they want to be footballers- but Hernán, as a good father, is always at their side to support them unconditionally.  This is why he is so determined to succeed in this new process of his life.

loans.use: to start his venture of raising pigs, looking to support his children in realizing their dreams.

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
A resident from Kampong Cham province, Sophy is 40 years old and a mother of one child. She grows rice on two hectares to support her family's living conditions. She also earns more income from cows and pig-raising. 

For Sophy, this is her first time with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is a group leader of three members requesting a new loan. She will use her loan portion to buy piglets and make a cage for her pig-raising. She hopes that she can make her family's living conditions better than before and can help her child graduate from university successfully.

loans.use: To buy piglets and make a cage for her pig-raising.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Thorn, 63, is a father of four children living in Kampong Cham province. Nowadays, he needs to support three children, two of whom are in university and one is in school. To support his living, he can improve his living conditions via house renting, and he can earn more income from snack selling. 

For Thorn, this is his first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He will spend his entire loan portion to pay for the tuition fee for his daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor degree's majoring in nursing. He really hopes that his daughter can get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fee for his daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in nursing.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
A mother of five children, Nary is 48 years old and living in Kampong Thom province. To tackle her family’s hardship, she grows rice and teaches in school as her main source of income. Moreover, she works as a contract worker to earn extra income. 

This is the first loan cycle for Nary with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan to pay for the tuition fee for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in university. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fee for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in university.

loans.name: La

texts.en:
A resident of Kampong Speu Province, La is 32 years old and single. For her living she grows rice, and this is her main source of income. In addition  she is a tailor, and she can earn an income of about 9.5 USD. 

This is La's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she wants to focus on her brother's education instead. Therefore she is applying for a new loan in order to pay tuition fees for her brother who wants to pursue a bachelor degree at university. 

She hopes that her brother can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her brother who wants to pursue a bachelor degree at university.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y poder ofrecerles na buena educación a sus dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad son las metas que motivan a levantarse y trabajar duramente a la señora Mónica, quien con su negocio de cría de gallinas ponedoras ha logrado ser útil y apoyar a s esposo en los gastos del hogar.
Mónica buscando ser más competitiva, más agresiva frente a la competencia, perdurar en el tiempo, mejorar las ventas, tener mayor existencia en su granja quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar gallinas ponedoras y tener un número de huevos muy alto y ser una distribuidora a considerar.
texts.en:
Improving her housing conditions and providing a good education to her two children, aged 10 and 8 years old, are the goals that motivate Mónica to get up and work hard. Mónica, with her business of keeping laying hens, has managed to be useful and to help her husband with household expenses.
Looking to be more competitive and more assertive against the competition, to have a long-lasting business, to improve sales, and to have a better life on her farm, Mónica wants to apply for a loan to buy laying hens and to have a very high level of egg production, in order to become a distributor to be reckoned with.

loans.use: to buy laying hens, in order to increase her daily production of eggs. Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Milfor Emilio

texts.es:
Milfor es un responsable, respetuoso, trabajador, honrado y honesto hombre que da su vida por apoyar incondicionalmente a su hija de 11 años, esa pequeña lo es todo para él y gracias a ella siempre tiene una sonrisa para atender sus clientes cada que van a comprar algún artículo. 
Milfor tiene una tienda de productos de la canasta familiar y su sueño es poder tener una casa propia para vivir junto con su hija y pareja sin tener que pagar arriendo y ese dinero ahorrarlo para una universidad para su hija. 
Gracias al crédito podrá invertir en compra de surtido en grano, carnes, dulces, snacks, víveres.
Y su mayor beneficio es diversificar la oferta de productos a los clientes.
texts.en:
Milfor is a responsible, respectful, hardworking, honest and honorable man who lives his life to support his 11-year-old daughter unconditionally.  That little girl is everything to him.  Thanks to her, he always has a smile to greet his customers, each of whom will buy an item.
Milfor has a store selling staple grocery items, and his dream is to own a home to live in with his daughter and family without paying rent, and to save the  money -  which would otherwise go to rent -  for college for his daughter. Thanks to the loan, he will be able to invest in the purchase of assorted beans/grains, meats, sweets, snacks, and groceries.  The greatest benefit of the loan is to diversify the products offered to customers.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of staple food products, sweets, soft drinks, packaged snacks, and other snacks.

loans.name: Pech's Group

texts.en:
An old woman living in Kampong Speu Province, Pech is 60 years old and a mother of three children. 

Pech can earn income to support her family through rice cropping and by working for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved in her business for ages and she earns about 30,000 KHR per day. 

This is Pech's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she is leading a group of eight to get a loan. She is the leader of the group, and she will spend her loan portion on building a decent latrine. 

She hopes that her family will have better health than before.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Moeun's Group

texts.en: Moeun, 45, is the mother of eight children living in Kompong Speu province. She secures the basic needs of her family via rice cropping. Moreover, she can earn more income via working for others for a fee. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of five to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her house will have a latrine to use.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is a 33-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marisa has a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy bamboo to weave. She has been in this business for 1 year. 

In the future, Marisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bamboo to weave

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson de 65 años de eda vende dulces mecatos y mangos verde con sal, desde hace 14 años en la puerta de un colegio. Su negocio fue producto de imitar el negocio de un amigo, el cual mostraba utilidades que beneficiaban su familia. El tiene una pequeña chaza pequeña pero quiere crecer parea lograr sosternerlo y ganar mas dinero. nelson es un hombre saludable que se propone vivir tranquilo y eso es lo que logra cada vez que genera ingresos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financimento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen dulcería productos alimenticios empacados, y mango . Con esta inversión espera crecer un poco mas y tener nuevos ingresos invirtiendo y vendiendo de contado, para recuperar rapidamente su inversión y esto es justamente el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en: Nelson, 65 years old,  has been selling sweet packaged snacks and green mangoes with salt, in the entrance to a school. His business was the product of imitating a friend's business, which showed profits that benefited his family. He has a tiny little stand but wants to grow it in order to be able to sustain it and to earn more money. Nelson is a healthy man who intends to live in peace and that is what he is achieving by generating increased income. Currently, he is applying to a community finance group. The first loan will be through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which he will buy sweets, packaged food products, and mangoes in greater volume. With this investment, he hopes to grow the business a little more and to have new income by investing and selling on the spot to quickly recoup his investment.This is precisely the intended outcome of his community finance group.

loans.use: to buy sweets, packaged food products, and mangoes in greater volume.

loans.name: Nelvyn

texts.en:
Nelvyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Nelvyn has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Aizamae

texts.en:
Aizamae is 26 years old and married with one child in school, and she works very hard to provide for her family.

Aizamae runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc. She has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future Aizamae would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 42 years old and widowed with two children. With one child currently in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of items like rice, feed, eggs, bottled water, soft-drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, coffee, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for nine years.

Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of items like rice, feed, eggs, bottled water, soft-drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nuanlahong

texts.en: Nuanlahong's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village, including Nuanlahong, are able to buy bottled water.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. Nuanlahong is excited that she, like many people in the nearby area, have been able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter since the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Nuanlahong due to less need for purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Phakkhayar Group

texts.en: Khoy's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams. However, the water from natural sources in Khoy's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. Khoy is excited that he, like his group members, is able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter because the filter removes bacteria and other waterborne diseases. Even though some people in the village, including Khoy’s, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Khoy and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water since they purchase less charcoal or wood and decrease the time spent foraging for firewood. Khoy's filter is guaranteed for two years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: José Salvador

texts.es:
José de 45 años de edad,  estudio hasta noveno grado. La esposa se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras y son padres de tres hijos los cuales viven con él.

José se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años de edad, el papá le inculco este oficio ya que como familia siempre se han dedicado a esto y él quería que aprendiera bien el oficio para que se pudiera mantener en un futuro de este trabajo.

José solo se dedica a la agricultura y el trabajo le queda cerca de la casa y lo hace en un horario de las 6:00 am a las 12:00 pm.  

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar frutas y verduras para reiniciar el negocio de su esposa,  ya que dejo 4 meses de vender frutas por el embarazo que ella tenía pero hoy ya empezara a vender la fruta y verdura y necesita comprarla;  ya que ese negocio siempre le daba muchas ganancias. Otra parte del crédito será para sacar la cosecha de maíz de José y trasladarla a su casa.


Los sueños de  José son  que siempre le preste vida Dios, para seguir trabando la tierra y sacar adelante a su familia que no le falte nada en la casa y que los hijos  se superen y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Jose, 45, has a ninth grade education.  His wife sells fruit and vegetables and they are the parents of three children who live at home.

Since the age of 12 Jose has been working in agriculture.  His father taught him the trade because it was what the family always had done.  Jose wanted to learn so he could earn a living in this line of work.  This is his only means of income and the land is very near home.  His work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.

The loan he is requesting is to buy fruit and vegetables to restart his wife's business.  She paused her activity four months ago due to pregnancy but now will take up the business again and needs to buy fruit and vegetables.  It always has been a profitable business.  The rest of the loan will be used to harvest Jose's corn crop and transport it home.

Jose's dreams are to be blessed with a long life, to continue working the soil and to provide for his family and see his children receive an education and become professionals.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables to restart his wife's business, and to harvest Jose's corn crop for transport to his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy pants, blouses, skirts, shoes, sandals, spandex etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits like bananas, pineapples, oranges and other fruit which will sell better with students. She will also buy donuts, hotcakes, and cookies that kids like.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy underwear, blouses, skirts, pants, shirts, t-shirts etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy chickens, special chicken feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: José Orlando De Jesús

texts.es:
José es un agricultor de 46 años de edad, que tiene sexto grado de nivel académico  que no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir sus estudios por situaciones económicas de su padre.  Está casado la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y han procreado 8 hijos los cuales cuatro de ellos están en la escuela los otros ya no estudian.


José se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20  años,  este trabajo se lo enseño el papá que quería que aprendiera bien la agricultura desde entonces  él ejerce esta actividad, luego se casó y es de la agricultura que está sacando adelante a sus hijos; también se dedica a la venta de verduras cuando no trabaja la agricultura, sale en su carro por los cantones aledaños a vender frutas y verduras en este negocio se involucra la esposa que junto a ella salen a vender y este oficio lo aprendieron solos,  ya que vieron la necesidad de buscar una fuente de ingreso adicional a la agricultura, lo hacen en un horario de las 6 am a las 4 pm que llegan a la casa.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para terminar de pagar la reparación del carro ya que se le arruino el motor del carro que utiliza para salir a vender frutas y verduras;  ya que el crédito anterior lo necesito para los granos básicos, hoy él comprara esos repuesto para que el negocio siempre le siga dando muchas ganancias,  ya que ese trabajo es bastante rentable y con todas esas ganancias un día poder comprar un carro en mejor estado
texts.en:
José, 46, is a farmer who studied until the sixth grade but was unable to continue because of his father's economic situation. His is married and his wife is a homemaker.  They have eight children, four of whom attend school.   

José has worked in agriculture for 20 years, ever since his father taught him the trade.   He also works in the sale of vegetables when he isn't working in agriculture. He goes out in his car to the neighboring towns to sell fruits and vegetables. His wife is also involved in the business as she goes with him to sell. It is a self-taught trade. Since they needed to find an additional source of income apart from agriculture, they decided to start this business. They work a schedule from 6:00 in the morning and it is 4:00 in the afternoon when they arrive home. 

The loan requested is to pay off the cost of repairing José's vehicle which broke down because of the engine.  He used the previous loan to buy basic grains.  Now he will buy spare parts so his business continues to earn a good profit.  He hopes to use the profits to buy a better car one day.

loans.use: To pay repair costs of the vehicle he uses to sell fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Mayra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mayra de 38 años de edad,  está acompañada y vive junto a su esposo y tres de sus hijos. Ella posee una pequeña tienda y elabora artesanías religiosas que luego va a vender a las Iglesias de la zona.
Mayra tiene ya algún tiempo de estar trabajando en su pequeña tienda y además siempre ha gustado de hacer reliquias religiosas, esto debido a que lo aprendió como un pasatiempo, pero luego vio que habían buenas ganancias en ese negocio.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para pagar mano de obra para sacar sus cultivos de frijol y el maíz que ella y su esposo han sembrado en esta cosecha y necesitan un poco de dinero extra ya que tuvieron un pequeño contratiempo debido a una enfermedad de un familiar y su presupuesto se desajusto.

Ella planea seguir trabajando para poder ver a ella y su familia estar bien económicamente.
texts.en:
Mayra, 38, lives with her husband and three children.  She has a small store and makes religious crafts which she sells in the church area.  She has been running the store for quite some time and enjoys her craft-making which she learned as a hobby.  After seeing she could earn a profit with it, she started the business.

The loan she is requesting is to pay labor costs to harvest the bean and corn crops she and her husband have.  They need a little extra money because of an unexpected illness in the family which affected their budget.

Mayra plans to continue working and supporting her family economically.

loans.use: To pay labor costs to harvest her beans and corn crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a tortilla grill.

loans.name: José Leonel

texts.es:
José de 25 años de edad,  es padre de dos niños,  actualmente vive junto a su familia que consiste en su padre, madre y dos hermanos en una casa que todos han construido con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación por años. A sus pequeños los visita a diario y siempre está al pendiente de ellos a pesar que no está junto a sus niños es un padre responsable.

José lleva ya un par de años trabajando como panadero repartidor en una panadería y también dedica tiempo a la crianza de pollos para obtener un ingreso adicional lo que en el pasado le permitió comprarse su propia motocicleta para trasladarse a su trabajo.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar pollos, concentrado, vacunas para aumentar la cantidad de pollos a engordar, ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y el consumismo de la población se hace más grande hacia este tipo de alimentos.

José dice que gustaría volver a retomar sus estudios ya que él sueña con ser un profesional algún día,  pero para eso dice que también es necesario aprender otros oficios, ya que no solo de una cosa se vive en la vida.
texts.en:
25-year old José has two children, but he currently lives with his father and mother and  two siblings in a house which they built with much effort and dedication over several years. He visits his children every day, and although he doesn't live with them he is a responsible father who supports them.

José has spent a couple of years working as a delivery person for a baker. He also raises chickens to earn extra money which enabled him to buy a motorcycle so he could get to work.

The loan he is seeking from CREDICAMPO will be used to buy chickens, specialized feed, and vaccines so that he has more chickens to raise ready for the approaching Christmas season, a time when local people typically buy chickens to eat.

José says that he would like to return to school and take more courses as his dream is to get a professional job some day. However, he also says that it is necessary to learn other skills as you can't survive knowing only one job.

loans.use: buy chickens, specialized feed, and vaccines so that he has more chickens to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in chickens, vitamins and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in pigs, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 44-year-old woman living with her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her hometown is very populated and most of the crowd likes to chew betel leaf. So a few years ago, her husband decided to open a pan shop to offer different kinds of betel leaf to the people. He offers all kinds of betel leaf such as sweet pan, which consists of a mixture of chopped or coarsely ground areca nuts, mint, coconut, fruit preserves, gulkand (rose petal preserves), and various spices and tobacco pan, which consists of powdered tobacco. He is expert in preparing pan because he has been running this shop for many year and a lot of customers like to take betel leaf that is prepared by him. To cope with the increasing demand, he wants to keep more stock of ingredients so that he can maximize his income.
 
Therefore, Rehana has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy betel leaf, chopped areca nuts, tobacco etc to sell.

loans.use: To buy betel leaf and ingredients for making pan to sell.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a selling of used clothing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,500 through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of used clothing to sell for her business.

Cresencia has been in this business for 11 years. She earns more income from her general store.

Cresencia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Cina

texts.en:
Cina is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cina is 45 years old and has three children who are in school.

Cina has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Cina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Cina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area in Kampong Speu province, Sim is 30 years old and a mother of two children. She earns income to improve her family's condition via rice cropping. She has been involved in this business for 20 years and earns about 26,400 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of five members to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She expects that her family will have a latrine to use so they can live in good health.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Ou Dong District

loans.name: Adilet

texts.en:
Adilet  is a freshman student at American University of Central Asia. Here’s his story: 

“My name is Adilet. I live with my mother. My parents divorced when I was six and my mother brought me up alone.  I keep in touch with my father, but he has another big family and can’t support us at the same time.

My mother says that every person must be educated and well-bred in order to be a strong person and succeed in the future.  I finished the Turkish High School, where subjects also taught in English are very useful when studying at AUCA. AUCA is the first university in Central Asia to offer US accredited degrees in liberal arts through a partnership with Bard College in the United States. My goal is to finish the BA Program and have my own business. In fact, many AUCA Alumni are prosperous and have implemented their ideas into reality. I hope that I will be successful too and will be able to take care of my future family and my mom after graduation.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 31 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Mercy is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Mercy has been raising livestock for nine years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elena is 47 years old and one of her children is in school.

Elena has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Elena has been in this business for 29 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 42 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Amelita has a hardware business in the Philippines. Amelita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of wood to sell.

Amelita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Amelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wood to sell.

loans.name: Kylym

texts.en:
Kylym is a freshman at American University of Central Asia, Department of Psychology, and this is her story:

“My sister is a senior in the Economics Program at AUCA and my last four years have been connected with AUCA. She has told us a lot of interesting things about AUCA and I attended many events on campus. Based on this experience, I decided to apply to this University. I worked to get high exam scores and was accepted.
 
Why did I choose AUCA? Firstly, AUCA strives to provide the best education to those students, like me, who want to change their world for the better. Secondly, it allows us to study in various good universities in the World through Exchange Programs that are sponsored by either AUCA or partner institutions. Finally, a truly international atmosphere at AUCA makes you feel as a part of a big friendly family.
 
My parents support my choice and do their best to pay my tuition. However, I have other siblings they need to take care of with their small salary, which makes it nearly impossible to cover my education in full. Therefore, a Kiva loan is critical for me and my family. I am very fortunate to have this opportunity to mobilize some resources through Kiva, and greatly appreciate the lenders’ trust and their help to me.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Leone

texts.en:
Leone is 30 years old and has one child in school. She is a married woman.

Leone is in the agricultural business in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leone would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Shahzadi's Group

texts.en:
Shahzadi is a 40-year-old married woman who lives with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession and drives his rickshaw in Lahore city, which is a very populated area. A few days ago, he got into a road accident. He was looking for a passenger by standing beside the road and a speedy car collided with the rickshaw from behind. He did not get any fractures but the rickshaw body was seriously damaged and needs to be replaced with a new one. Her husband is some amount short to buy the new body for his auto rickshaw.
Therefore, Shahzadi has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband is able to buy the body of an auto rickshaw.
Shahzadi is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan for this support.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body.

loans.name: Ailien

texts.en:
Ailien is 32 years old and married with two children who are currently in school. Ailien works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like milk, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, cereals, etc. to sell.

Ailien has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as the above. 

In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional items like milk, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 35-year-old married woman with six children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lolita has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Laba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 22 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 27 octobre 2007. Les femmes ont une bonne cohésion sociale. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche.
Penda, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 03 garçons. Elle fait comme activité du commerce au marché de la localité. Elle fait cette activité depuis 06 ans. Elle achète 02 paniers de poissons fumés à 50000 F, 03 sacs d'oignons à 24000 F du piment à 10000 F, des épices à 15000 F pour les revendre au détail sur la place du marché.
Ses bénéfices vont lui permettre de répondre aux besoins de sa famille (nourriture, habits, soins médicaux).
texts.en:
This group is made up of 22 members and is part of the Banc Villageois that was established on October 27, 2007. The women have a good social cohesion. Their main businesses are retail and fattening livestock.

Penda, age 42, is the woman standing on the right and raising her hand in the photograph. She's married and the mother of seven children, three of them boys.

For the past six years, she's been a merchant at the market of the place where she lives. She will buy 2 baskets of smoked fish costing XOF 50'000, 3 sacks of onions costing XOF 24'000, chili pepper for XOF 10'000, and spices for XOF 15'000. She will retail those products in the market place.

She will use her profits to provide for her family (food, clothing, and healthcare).

loans.use: to buy smoked fish, onions, chili pepper, and spices

loans.name: Ndella's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 06 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 27 octobre 2007. Les femmes ont une bonne cohésion sociale. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche.
Laba, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 59 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont 04 garçons. Elle fait comme activité le commerce. Elle a ouvert une échoppe qu'elle gère elle même. Elle pratique cette activité depuis 2007. Elle va acheter  du riz en gros pour une valeur de 100000 F; 03 sacs de farine à 17500 F l'un; 03 sacs de sucre à 22000 f l'un; du thé, du café et autres denrées qu'elle va revendre au détail.
Les bénéfices vont lui permettre de renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
This group is made up of six members and is part of the Banc Villageois that was established on October 27, 2007. The women have a good social cohesion. Their main businesses are retail and fattening livestock.

Laba, age 59, is the woman standing on the right and raising her hand in the photograph. She's married and the mother of five children, four of them boys.

Her business is retail. She opened a shop that she runs on her own. She's been in this business since 2007. She will buy XOF 100'000's worth of rice wholesale, 3 sacks of wheat costing XOF 17'500 each, 3 sacks of sugar costing XOF 22'000 each, tea, coffee, and other food products to retail.

She will use her profits to strengthen her working capital.

loans.use: To buy rice, wheat, sugar, tea, coffee, and other food products

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 50-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lydia has a food vending business in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 30 years. 

In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Carlito works hard to support his family.

He has a junk shop in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. He is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy more stocks of recycled materials to sell for his junk shop business.

Carlito has been sustaining his business activities through his past 12 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him to attain his dream of saving enough money so he can continue to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz Edilma

texts.es:
60 años de edad, un no en cada puerta que toco buscando trabajo, es mujer separada y a pesar de todo eso se muestra como una mujer firme y determinante en sus decisiones que hoy con la ayuda de interactuar quiere montar su propio negocio un restaurante y gracias a que encontró por fin un sí que se le dio Interactuar podrá iniciar formalmente su negocio pero para ello es el crédito con el que comprara activos fijos, losas, mesas, sillas, fritadoras, horno, ollas, e insumos para su restaurante.
Espera que al apoyen, quiere trabajar, no se quiere quedar en casa esperando que el dinero le resulte va hacer todo lo posible por triunfar y hacer de su restaurante un negocio la que todos quieran ir y volver
texts.en:
She is 60 years old and has knocked on many doors looking for a job, just to hear “no”. Despite being separated, she is a strong woman, confident on her decisions. Today, with the help of Interactuar, she wants to start her own business, a restaurant. She heard a “yes” from Interactuar, so she will be able to formally open her business.

For this, she needs a loan. She will buy fixed assets such as tableware, tables, chairs, a deep fryer, an oven, pots and ingredients for her restaurant. She hopes to receive support. She wants to work, not stay at home because she does not have money. She will do everything she can to get ahead and open a restaurant where people feel they want to visit over and over again.

loans.use: to open a restaurant and buy a deep fryer, an oven, pots, tableware, tables, chairs and ingredients.

loans.name: Mariel

texts.es:
Mariel tiene 28 años, es casada, no tiene hijos. Ella es una mujer profesional es licenciada en educación especial, y comerciante desde hace más de 3 años. Inició su negocio con el objetivo de ayudar con los gastos de su hogar, generar ingresos adicionales, y tener independencia económica. Gracias a la buena gestión que hizo  en su negocio se dio cuenta que de los ingresos podía costearse una carrera profesional, y fue así como se preparo en el área de educación; Siempre ha tenido el apoyo de su esposo. Actualmente ella solo se dedica a las actividades comerciales, actividad que desarrolla muy bien, porque le gusta mucho. Sus aspiraciones son trabajar en una escuela, pero sin dejar de lado sus ventas, ya que los horarios de los educadores son muy flexibles, y le daría la oportunidad de seguir trabajando en lo propio. 
Inicio su negocio con capital propio, y un monto de 200,000 colones, con las que hizo las primeras compras de productos sus  y jeans. De ese importe logro capitalizar y seguir reinvirtiendo, Actualmente tiene muchos pedidos, y necesita hacer una inversión más grande en mercadería y prepararse para la temporada navideña. 
Vende de forma ambulante, y también muchos de sus clientes fijos llegan hasta su casa. Combina muy bien sus estudios y el negocio, y eventualmente un posible trabajo como maestra.
texts.en:
Mariel is 28 years old, is married and does not have children. She is a professional woman. She is licensed in special education and has been a trader for more than three years. She began her business with the objective of helping with her household bills generating additional income and having economic independence. Thanks to her good management of her business, she realized that her income could pay for a professional course and thus she studied in the field of education. She has always had the support of her husband. Currently, she is only dedicated to commercial work, work she has developed well because she likes it a lot. Her aspirations are to work in a school but without having to give up her sales since educator's hours are very flexible and would give the opportunity to keep working on the same.

She began her business with her own capital with an amount of 200,000 "colones" with which she made her first purchase of her products and jeans. From this, she managed to capitalize and keep reinvesting. Currently, she has a lot of orders and needs to make a larger investment in merchandise and prepare for the Christmas season.

She sells on foot and has a lot of fixed customers who come to her house. She combines her studies and her business and eventually a possible job as a teacher well.

loans.use: to buy jeans, plastic utensils, perfumes, lotions, creams and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
Irish is a married woman from Leyte, Philippines. 

She used to raise pigs as her source of income, but she has to stop after typhoon Haiyan hit their place and ruined her business.

She is starting to recover again and is planning to take a loan to buy piglets to raise and animal feed. Irish believes that a loan would help her realize her dream of improving her way of living.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Ernesa

texts.en:
Ernesa is 40 years old, married, and has three children who are all in school.

Ernesa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ernesa has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

Ernesa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Ernesa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 28 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are in school.

Mary Grace is in the agricultural business in the Philippines, raising pigs. She has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Mary Grace requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Askar

texts.en:
Askar is a first-year student at the American University of Central Asia, Department of International and Business Law. Here is his story:

“We are four children in the family. My two elder sisters have own families and live separately. The third sister studies in Kyrgyz-Chinese University, and now I am a freshman.  My father has psoriasis and spends substantial part of family’s income on ointments. My mother is a lecturer and is the only bread-winner in our big family. A famous proverb: “Measure thrice and cut once” - describes my family’s financial situation so well.

"We didn’t live in affluence, don’t have an expensive car, we even used to save on expensive food and clothing. Some people still don’t understand me, why I have chosen the costly university.

"I heard about AUCA when I was ten years old. Everyone used to talk about it and list its advantages in my family. My family strongly believes in a value of education, and now barely making ends meet, my parents vest hopes in me. I am happy to be a freshman at AUCA, which serves as an example of the university committed to freedom of expression, critical inquiry and academic honesty.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia is 60 years old and a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Concordia has a frozen foods retail business in the Philippines. Concordia has been in this business for two years.

Concordia requested a PHP 18,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell. In the future, Concordia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith works hard to support her family. 

Judith is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Judith requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Judith would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika is a freshman at American University of Central Asia, Department of Journalism and Mass Communications, and this is her story:

“My name is Malika. I have been an exemplary school girl and love my school very much. It gave me a good education, upbringing, wonderful friends, and unforgettable school years. I hope to get all these positive things from AUCA, and in addition, hope to improve my English, develop critical thinking and experience its Exchange Study Program.

"I worked hard on my English, math and essay writing skills for several years in order to enter AUCA. I managed to pass the entrance exams and now found myself around the bright-heads. I have dreamt about the study at AUCA and don’t want to be dismissed because of the financial problems, as my family is not able to pay the whole tuition. AUCA provided me financial aid, but even after that I need Kiva loan to cover the rest part of the fee. I will study hard, will be active, and will continue volunteering to change my future or to build better future for my family.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Her name is Margarita, 54, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. Life is quite a struggle for she is a widow with six children. She works doubly hard to support her children and provide for their daily needs.

Margarita owns and oversees operation of her jeepney service. She has one unit (14-16 person capacity) of jeepney. Jeepneys are the most common form of public transport throughout the many islands of the Philippines. Most of the time, the jeepneys are packed with passengers. Jeepneys offer one of the cheapest ways of getting somewhere. They are one of the remnants of the American military presence in the Philippines during the second World War and are still to be seen throughout the Philippines, in many colors and all over the place. 

Originally, jeepneys were old American Jeeps. They were used in the war against the Japanese army who occupied the Philippines for several years. After the Japanese army was defeated and the American military mission was completed, the Jeeps were left by the tens of thousands on the islands in the Philippines. The Filipinos saw possibilities to make out of these Jeeps. They saw a real transportation means by making these Jeeps about two meters longer and by putting two long seats in them, one on each side from the front to the back. Since then, jeepneys have been used as small buses for cheap transport of people, goods, and even sometimes little animals. Jeepney transport service is one of the stable businesses in the Philippines. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Margarita is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan, which she will use to recondition/restore the used tires of her jeepney to a usable condition. It is very important that her unit is always in good running condition to ensure efficient service. Her earnings from the service is her only source of income to provide for her family's needs.  She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Margarita aims to have one more jeepney unit to improve her income. She prays that her transportation service will always be safe and efficient. She dreams for her children to get the best education. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for tire recap of her jeepney.

loans.name: Nhóm 01_Thôn 4_Minh Châu Group

texts.en:
Lan is 35 years old. She is married and has two 2 children. Lan is the group leader of the Nhóm 01_thôn 4_Minh Châu solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

This is Lan first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Lan has a retail business selling lagim. She is requesting a loan to purchase household commodities in general to resell. Lan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: To purchase household commodities to resell.

loans.name: Santos Ángel

texts.es:
Santos de 49 años de edad,  es una persona con excelentes principios que lo hacen  una persona muy respetada y reconocido en su comunidad.

Él trabaja en el campo como agricultor,  los fines de semana se dedica al comercio a la compra y venta de ganado en su comunidad y alrededores, para posteriormente ser vendidos a un mejor precio.  Santos se creció junto a sus padres quienes fueron personas  trabajadoras que le formaron y enseñaron a cultivar la tierra, su familia formada por sus padres y sus 3 hermanos juntos trabajaban para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar. Su nivel de estudio es de tercer grado al transcurrir el tiempo, cuando ya era un joven conoció a su querida esposa, dese entonces él se dedica a la agricultura y venta de helados los fines de semana.

Santos se ocupa de cultivar granos básicos, con  experiencia de 40 años, actividad que aprendió de sus padres, ya que toda la vida ha sido su principal fuente de ingresos y la actividad que le permite llevar el sustento diario a su familia. Motivado por las ganancias que le generaba la venta de ganado se ha propuesto comenzar el negocio de cerdos lo que le generara un mejor ingreso económico,  lo que ayudara a cumplir con el compromiso crediticio.


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar una vaca en estado de gestación, la cual comenzara a cuidar hasta que tenga la cría de esta forma aprovechara la leche que producirá.  Su esposa se dedicara a la venta de lácteos, de esta manera tendrán un mejor ingreso y una mejor nutrición para su familia, también se invertirá en la compra de cerdos para engorde. 


Las proyecciones a futuro son las de tener un negocio más fuerte que le permita dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y apoyar en la educación de su hijo hasta que sea un profesional,  tener una casa con todas las comodidades  y que le garantiza una vivienda digna a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 49 years old. He is a person with excellent values which make him a very respected and well known person in his community. 

He works in the countryside as a farmer. On weekends he works as a merchant, buying livestock in his community and its surroundings, to later sell at a better price. Santos grew up with his parents who were hardworking people who educated him and taught him to cultivate the land. His family, made up of his parents and his 3 siblings, worked together to meet the household needs. He has had a third grade education  over time and when he was a young man he met his beloved wife. Since then he has worked in agriculture and selling ice cream on the weekends. 

Santos grows basic grains. He has 40 years' experience. He learned this activity from his parents. His whole life it has been his main source of income and this activity allows him to support his family. Motivated by the earnings that he has generated by selling livestock, he has decided to start a pig business which will generate better income. This will help him pay off his debt.

The loan he is asking for is to buy a gestating cow. He will care for it until it calves and then he will use the milk it produces. His wife will sell the dairy products and this way they will have better income and nutrition for the family. He will also invest in in buying pigs to fatten.  

His goals for the future are to have a stronger business that will allow him to give his customers a better service and support his son's education until he graduates from college, to have a house with all the conveniences to guarantee a dignified life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a gestating cow which he will care for until it calves. This way, he can use the milk it will produce. He will also buy pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 60 years old and married with two children.

Editha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from pig fattening. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like detergent soap, canned goods, soft drinks, toothpaste, coffee, etc. to sell.

Editha has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. Editha aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like detergent soap, canned goods, soft drinks, toothpaste, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Myriam Elena

texts.es: A sus 37 años de edad Elena está casada,  ella tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando, su esposo se dedica a trabajar al jornal, Elena trabaja en la crianza de animales, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca ya que dice que con este negocio puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, la mas grande aspiración es que sus hijos estudien y por medio de esto puedan tener un buen futuro.
texts.en: At 37 years old, Elena is married. She has 2 children that are in school. Her husband works as a laborer. Elena works raising animals. She is going to invest in buying a cow, because she says that this business can help her and her husband wit the household expenses. Her biggest goal is for her children to be educated and in this way have a better future.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Reyna Maribel

texts.es:
Reyna de 39 de edad, estudio hasta 6° grado, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor, tienen 2 hijos que viven con ellos y estudia 8° grado, en la casa vive sus padres y una hermana. 

Reyna ayuda a su madre a vender productos de la tienda desde hace 4 años, también se dedica a la compra de ganado más que todo terneros o novillos crecerlos y venderlos, el horario de la tienda es de 7 am a 8 pm.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar dos terneros crecerlos y luego venderlos, obtiene ganancias para pagar los gastos de educación y alimentación de la familia.

En un futuro desea tener una tienda propia y comprar más ganado y reproducirlas y que su pareja maneje la ganadería.
texts.en:
Reyna is 39 years old. She went to school up to the 6th grade. She is married and her spouse is a farmer. They have 2 children who live with them and are in 8th grade. Her parents and a sister live in the house.   

Reyna has helped her mother sell products in a store for 4 years. She also buys livestock, especially calves or steers to raise and sell. The store schedule is from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m.

She needs the loan to buy two calves and to raise and later sell them. She will obtain profits to pay for the family's education and food expenses. In the future she wants to have her own store and buy more livestock to breed them and for her spouse to manage the livestock.

loans.use: to buy two calves to raise and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cattle.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: José de 54 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 5 hijos de 12, 21, 24, 18 y 30 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se dedica a cultivar la tierra, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder contar con su pequeño cultivo de: pepino, pipían, ayote, ejotes, etc. Y es gracias a este negocio que lograría sostener la economía de su hogar.  José desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y evitar así que sus pocas pertenencias se deterioren por las filtraciones del techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
José is 54 years old and lives in his own home alongside his wife and his 5 children, aged 12, 21, 24, 18, and 30. He is a hardworking man who makes a living by farming the land. He feels very happy to be able to count on his small plot of: cucumber, pipián and ayote (both types of squash), green beans, etc. It is thanks to this business that he will succeed in maintaining the economic wellbeing of his home.

José wants to replace the roof of his house and, to do this, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to replace the roof of his house. In this way, he can avoid the deterioration of his few belongings due to the leaks in the roof of his house.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to replace the roof of his house.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María de 59 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder brindarle un lugar seguro donde vivir. Ella es una mujer admirable que desde muy joven ha aprendido a ganarse la vida, es por ello que desde hace 20 años instalo una tienda en su vivienda, gracias a la cual ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos ya mayores de edad que le apoyan con los gastos de su hogar. María siempre ha soñado con tener un lugar adecuado en el cual tener agua recolectada para el uso de su hogar, es por ello que se acerco a FUSAI para solicitar un crédito para invertirlo en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una pila en su vivienda, en la que espera guardar agua para su uso y el de su familia, ya que actualmente solo cuenta con un barril de plástico.
texts.en:
María is 59 years old and she lives in her own home with her family. She feels very happy to be able to provide the family with a safe place to live.

She is an admirable woman. She learnt to make a living when she was very young. That is why 20 years ago, she set up a store in her house. Thanks to this store she has managed to support her children, who are now adults and help her with the household expenses.

María has always wished to have a proper place to store collected water for personal use. This is the reason she came to FUSAI to request a loan. She will use it to buy cement, sand, gravel and iron beams to build a concrete water tank, where she wants to keep collected water for herself and her family, since now they only have a plastic barrel.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and iron beams to build a concrete water tank for her house.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther has 8 children, is 52 years old, and lives in Kemuyembe village in Migori County, Kenya. Kemuyembe village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their drinking water from a local water source. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Esther’s community members may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Esther works as a subsistence farmer to earn a living, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Esther and 4 other promoters in this loan group from her community need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Esther will encourage her community to treat their drinking water with the dispenser and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Esther wants to be a promoter because she envisions a water-borne disease free community.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Esther’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of water-borne diseases by providing access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

As a volunteer promoter, Daniel represents his community on Kiva’s website and educates his community on how to protect their families from unsafe drinking water by using the chlorine dispenser system. Daniel and two other promoters, Mariam and Sophia, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Daniel wants to be a promoter because he believes that the chlorine dispenser will help alleviate water-borne diseases and improve their lives.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Daniel’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To support an innovative water treatment technology - chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es:
Ceferina  de 41 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos. Ella estudio hasta cuarto grado, comenta que no pudo continuar estudiando porque en el tiempo de su infancia era bien difícil estudiar una por la escases de recursos económicos, no habían escuelas cerca de su casa y lo otro por la inseguridad producto de la guerra que se vivía en el país en ese tiempo, actualmente ella vive junto a sus tres hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela  y son las únicas personas que dependen de ella.

Ceferina se dedica a los oficios domésticos y cuidar de sus 3 hijos que viven con ella en casa, pero su principal actividad es la sastrería, ella elabora todo tipo de ropa para dama niños y caballeros. El oficio lo aprendido gracias a un taller de aprendizaje que curso ella y gracias a su deseo de tener su propio trabajo, ella logro aprender el oficio y hoy en día lo desempeña con facilidad, comenta que tiene 12 años de experiencia en este oficio por eso tiene amplia demanda en su trabajo tiene muchos clientes que le buscan para hacerles diferente costuras, pues ella tiene mucho trabajo y lo que a ella le gusta es que el trabajo lo tiene en su casa no tiene que salir, hay algunos días cuando tiene mucha costuras y trabaja hasta la noche y pues el trabajo lo ha enseñado a sus hijos,  ellos también le apoyan en los trabajos cuando tiene alta demanda. Otra actividad que tiene junto a su hija es la elaboración y venta de antojitos típicos como por ejemplo tamales,  yuca, pastelitos etc. Estas dos actividades son las que le generan ingresos económicos para ella y toda familia. 


El préstamo lo utilizara específicamente para comprar una máquina de coser que sea más moderna y práctica. Pues hoy en día su sastrería tiene una amplia demanda de costuras y la máquina que tiene ya no le da abasto  a todos los trabajos, con la ayuda del financiamiento y la compra de su nueva máquina, ella podrá realizar los trabajos más fácil y terminar más pronto sus pedidos, pues era un deseo que tenía desde hace tiempo de tener una mejor máquina para cubrir la amplia demanda en la sastrería, gracias a esto Ceferina podrá obtener mayores ganancias económicas para su familia.  

Ceferina lo que desea para el futuro es poder ampliar su sastrería, también desea emplear un taller para que los jóvenes puedan aprender este oficio que hoy en día en bien rentable, también desea que sus hijos sigan estudiando con la ayuda y esfuerzo de ella,  que logren terminar sus estudios universitarios y que sean personas de bien en la sociedad, todo esto dice que lo lograra con las ganancias de su trabajo y con futuros créditos que solicitara.
texts.en:
Ceferina, 41, is a single mother of three children. She studied up to the fourth grade and says that she could not continue studying due to the difficult financial situation when she was a little girl. Besides, there were no schools close to where she lived and it was unsafe to go out because of the war and the unsafe conditions it caused. She is now living with her three children, who go to school and are the only ones that depend on her.

Ceferina works taking care of the household chores and her three children, who live with her. However, her main activity is making all kinds of clothes for women, children and men. She learned to do this because she attended a workshop, thinking of being self-employed. She is now very good at it. She says that she has been doing this for twelve years, so she receives a lot of orders from customers that come to her with different needs.

She has a lot of work and what she likes about her job is that she can work from home. Some days there are a lot of things to sew, so she has to stay up late. She has taught her children, who help her when this happens. She has an additional activity and her daughter helps her. They make traditional snacks, such as tamales, fried cassava, pies, etc. These two activities are a source of income for her and her family.

She will use this loan to buy a more modern and efficient sewing machine. She has a lot of orders to fulfill and the machine she has cannot cope with the work. With the help of this loan and the new machine, she will be able to do her job more easily and in a shorter time, which was something she wanted long ago. Thanks to this, Ceferina will make better profits for her family.

Ceferina would like to expand her dressmaking business in the future and open a workshop where young people can learn this profitable activity. She would also continue supporting her children’s studies so that they can receive a university degree and become good people. She says that she will achieve all these goals with the profits she will make and with other loans she will request in the future.

loans.use: to buy a more modern and efficient sewing machine.

If Kiebiya community had a way to treat their drinking water, they could improve the health of their community keeping children at school and parents at work.

On behalf of his community, Josephat is requesting a loan for a chlorine dispenser. Josephat was elected to represent his community as a volunteer promoter. The loan will be used for the installation of the dispensers and the initial supplies of chlorine. Josephat believes chlorine will kill bacteria in water hence making the water safe to drink.

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph lives in a home with mud walls, a dirt floor, and an iron roof in Nyamwini village in Kuria East, Kenya with  his family, which includes 5 children. The community of Nyamwini village collects their drinking water from Nyamwini spring  because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases often making the community of Nyamwini sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser program offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans and then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from re-contamination. Nyamwini village benefits from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Joseph has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are 3 other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Charles, Elizabeth and John.

Nyamwini community needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Joseph believes that chlorine helps in preventing typhoid and amoeba and improves their health. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Joseph’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water
